wine_description: Color is ruby ​​red, brilliant, clear. The nose is rather expressive, of average complexity. The first fruits are blackcurrant and cherry.  Friandy, rather supple, not very voluminous, the mouth is characterized by its balance: an acidity and a quasi absence of tannins favor the impression of roundness. Beautiful finish, elegant, fresh.

name: Antinori Tenuta Guado al Tasso Bolgheri Superiore 2014
wine_name: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Bolgheri Superiore

name: Antinori Badia a Passignano Gran Selezione Chianti Classico 2013
wine_name: Badia a Passignano Gran Selezione Chianti Classico
wine_description: Marchesi Antinori’s passion for viticulture is expressed through perseverance: their continuous pursuit for quality improvement, even in the smallest details. Research and development is an ongoing process both in the vineyards and in the cellars: selecting new clones of local and international varieties: experimenting with new techniques in the vineyards and vineyard altitudes, new approaches to fermentation and temperature control, experimenting with both traditional and innovative winemaking philosophies, using new types of oak for barrels, barrel size and age, and varying length of aging in the bottle before commercial release. To succeed at best expressing what a vineyard, grape, and a winemaker can achieve requires constant trial and error, both in the vineyard and in the winery. At Marchesi Antinori, these experiments include a wide range of different grape varieties and clones, planted in a variety of vineyards, different styles and sizes of fermentors as well as techniques of fermentation; barrel types and sizes; length of barrel and bottle aging.

name: Grattamacco Bolgheri Superiore 2014
wine_description: The taste of this wine reverberates the elegance of the vintage characters, presenting a jaunty aromatic intensity, where we find the characteristic fruity and balsamic notes and its own bloody imprint. The patient maturation of the skins and pips is felt in the fragrance of the tannin and acidity lively vein that accompanies the broad flavour in the final.

name: Château Gruaud Larose Saint-Julien (Grand Cru Classé) 2005
Château Léoville Barton Saint-Julien (Grand Cru Classé) 2003
wine_description: This wine has an opaque dark red violet colour. With lovely herbal, lavender and blackberry notes on the nose. Tart berry, blackberry, black fruit palate with depth and sweet tannins.

name: Château de Beaucastel Châteauneuf-du-Pape 2014
wine_description: A stunning example of this Southern Rhône blend with a smooth, earthy nose velvety texture and fruit-forward style; lovely, generous ripe black raspberry fruit and an exquisite finish.

name: Château Lilian Ladouys Saint-Estèphe 2014
wine_description: It is soft and velvety, with blueberry and blackberry aromas. Full body, with round tannins and a long finish. A rich and almost jammy wine.

name: Domaine de Chevalier Pessac-Léognan (Grand Cru Classé de Graves) 2009
Château Sociando-Mallet Haut-Médoc 2006
wine_description: Opaque black/purple colour, with notes of crushed rock, white flowers, graphite, blueberry and cassis, the wine is tight and needs to be coaxed from the glass. It is medium to full-bodied, with an excruciatingly tough-textured finish.

name: Château Pape Clément Pessac-Léognan (Grand Cru Classé de Graves) 2012
Pio Cesare Nebbiolo 2015
wine_description:
The sources of the grapes, enriched by a small proportion of Nebbiolo from the Barbaresco and Barolo region, provide body, structure and a long ageing potential.
The fruit is intense and ripe but at the same time fresh with very sweet tannins. Nice fragrancy and longevity.

name: Château de Fieuzal Pessac-Léognan (Grand Cru Classé de Graves) 2009
Trimbach Gewürztraminer Alsace 2016
wine_description: This variety really comes into its own in Alsace exhibiting the full aroma of the grape. Its wines are full, balanced and very aromatic.

name: Château Pichon Baron Pauillac (Grand Cru Classé) 2003
wine_description: A wine of great personality with fresh red-fruit and blackberry scents. It is quick to express itself on the palate, rolling out its assertive, powerful character and rich flesh. The finish is very long-lasting, with dense, precise tannins. A finely-balanced wine of substance with firm structure and body.

name: Château Poujeaux Moulis-en-Médoc 2009
wine_description: Lovely bright fruit, with a crystalline black summer berry character. The palate has good freshness, with a crisp style, and crunchy black fruits. There is even a little suppleness to it. Firm, tannic backbone too, with good acidity.

name: Castello Monaci Primitivo Salento Pilùna 2018
wine_description:
Dark crimson-red colour; full bouquet of ripe grapes, with notes of pepper and vanilla and
hints of Mediterranean scrub; robust, concentrated, soft but very firm flavour with an elegant, lingering aftertaste of small black fruits conserve and liquorice.

name: Domaine du Vieux Télégraphe Châteauneuf-du-Pape (La Crau) 2014
wine_description: Deep ruby with some purple nuances, this wine is medium to full-bodied and reveals notes of licorice, pepper, Asian spices, black cherry, raspberry, and currant, as well as a relatively big, sweet palate impression with moderate tannin in the finish.

name: Château de Camensac Haut-Médoc (Grand Cru Classé) 2009
La Spinetta Ca' di Pian Barbera d'Asti 2015
Château Fombrauge Saint-Émilion Grand Cru (Grand Cru Classé) 2012
wine_description: Color is ruby ​​red, brilliant, clear. The nose is rather expressive, of average complexity. The first fruits are blackcurrant and cherry.  Friandy, rather supple, not very voluminous, the mouth is characterized by its balance: an acidity and a quasi absence of tannins favor the impression of roundness. Beautiful finish, elegant, fresh.

name: Château Fombrauge Saint-Émilion Grand Cru (Grand Cru Classé) 2011
wine_description: Color is ruby ​​red, brilliant, clear. The nose is rather expressive, of average complexity. The first fruits are blackcurrant and cherry.  Friandy, rather supple, not very voluminous, the mouth is characterized by its balance: an acidity and a quasi absence of tannins favor the impression of roundness. Beautiful finish, elegant, fresh.

name: Château Grand-Puy-Lacoste Pauillac (Grand Cru Classé) 2006
wine_description: Exhibits classic Pauillac aromas and flavors of creme de cassis along with stony/floral notes.

name: Castello di Ama Chianti Classico Vigneto Gran Selezione San Lorenzo 2013
wine_name: Chianti Classico Vigneto Gran Selezione San Lorenzo
wine_description: Bright red , bright and intense . Bouquet of wild berries red berry . Attack brilliant where the fruity notes are complemented by spicy aromas . Elegant and refined .

name: Château Léoville Poyferré Saint-Julien (Grand Cru Classé) 2011
Château Pichon Longueville Comtesse de Lalande Pauillac (Grand Cru Classé) 2003
wine_description: The wine is seductive when young without prejudicing its longevity. As well as an oaky flavour imparted by new oak barrels, the wines show inimitable aromas of tobacco, violets, blackcurrant and ripe fruit, and also hints of pencil lead.

name: Château Pichon Longueville Comtesse de Lalande Pauillac (Grand Cru Classé) 2007
wine_description: The wine is seductive when young without prejudicing its longevity. As well as an oaky flavour imparted by new oak barrels, the wines show inimitable aromas of tobacco, violets, blackcurrant and ripe fruit, and also hints of pencil lead.

name: Château Ormes de Pez Saint-Estèphe 2011
wine_description: Dark red violet in colour. On the nose ripe currant, red berry and herbal notes. A tasty, herbaceous, berry and cassis palate with a medium finish.

name: Château Léoville Poyferré Saint-Julien (Grand Cru Classé) 2005
Cos d'Estournel Pagodes de Cos 2010
wine_description: The joy and spontaneity of moments shared with loved ones. An impromptu lunch with friends is the perfect occasion to open a bottle of Pagodes de Cos. It is reminiscent of the simple pleasures of life, like homemade blackcurrant syrup, a bowl of just-picked red cherries or a freshly opened jar of citrus jam. Pagodes de Cos is at once indulgent, comforting and vivacious, like a carefree conversation with family or friends in a familiar place.

name: Château Montrose Saint-Estèphe (Grand Cru Classé) 2006
wine_description: It has a fine and elegant robe with a beautifully intense and dark garnet. The nose, powerful and harmonious, is pleasantly woody. Aerated, it reveals lightly toasted aromas, followed with hints of ripe fruits and liquorice. The palate is full and soft with tight tannins and a light sweetness. The finish is long and harmonious.

name: Château Léoville Poyferré Saint-Julien (Grand Cru Classé) 2000
Château Léoville Barton Saint-Julien (Grand Cru Classé) 2005
wine_description: This wine has an opaque dark red violet colour. With lovely herbal, lavender and blackberry notes on the nose. Tart berry, blackberry, black fruit palate with depth and sweet tannins.

name: Château Léoville Poyferré Saint-Julien (Grand Cru Classé) 2008
Château Léoville Poyferré Saint-Julien (Grand Cru Classé) 2003
Château Sociando-Mallet Haut-Médoc 2012
wine_description: Opaque black/purple colour, with notes of crushed rock, white flowers, graphite, blueberry and cassis, the wine is tight and needs to be coaxed from the glass. It is medium to full-bodied, with an excruciatingly tough-textured finish.

name: Château Palmer Alter Ego Margaux 2010
wine_description: Alter Ego is a spontaneous uninhibited wine, soft and round as soon as it has finished barrel ageing. Its lush aromas and supple tannins make it a wine that can be appreciated in the first years after bottling. Finesse and elegance, aromatic richness, harmony and length.

name: Antinori Tenuta Guado al Tasso Bolgheri Superiore 2016
wine_name: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Bolgheri Superiore

name: Château Ksara Reserve du Couvent 2014
wine_description:
This dark ruby-red wine, joins finesse and elegance with the aroma of wood
and vanilla, supple, pure and round tannins give it length and persistence on the palate.
It can be drunk when bought or kept for 3 to 5 years in a good cellar.

name: Château Léoville Barton Saint-Julien (Grand Cru Classé) 2008
wine_description: This wine has an opaque dark red violet colour. With lovely herbal, lavender and blackberry notes on the nose. Tart berry, blackberry, black fruit palate with depth and sweet tannins.

name: Château Poujeaux Moulis-en-Médoc 2012
wine_description: Lovely bright fruit, with a crystalline black summer berry character. The palate has good freshness, with a crisp style, and crunchy black fruits. There is even a little suppleness to it. Firm, tannic backbone too, with good acidity.

name: Banfi Poggio alle Mura Brunello di Montalcino 2012
wine_name: Poggio alle Mura Brunello di Montalcino
wine_description: The red color is very intense. The bouquet is sweet and complex, with notes of blackberry jam, tobacco and vanilla. The structure is incredibly extensive but soft and well balanced. Great persistence in the finish.

name: Cos d'Estournel Cos d'Estournel 2003
wine_description: The call of faraway lands. As mysterious and intriguing as a lone adventurer returning from a solitary sail, Cos d’Estournel is slow to reveal itself. Little by little, it evokes stories of distant places, market stalls brimming with unfamiliar fruits, spices and wares, village festivities warmed by the joy of revelers and the setting sun, and sumptuous visions of ladies and their voluptuous curves. A myriad of scents, colors and tastes appeals to the senses. The Grand Vin of Cos d’Estournel is both demure and deliberately sensuous, a fascinating and elegant nectar.

name: Sena Aconcagua Valley 2013
wine_description: Dark, dry red color. The scent has notes of berries, tobacco, cocoa, coconut and pepper. The flavor is intense, with a wealth of nuances and a very nice balance, which gives it a very classic French flavor.

name: Château de Camensac Haut-Médoc (Grand Cru Classé) 2010
Trimbach Riesling Alsace Cuvée Frédéric Emile 2008
wine_description: This harmonious wine is very rich and fat, but has no residual sugar and has a wonderful mineral structure.

name: Cloudy Bay Te Koko Sauvignon Blanc 2014
wine_description: Aromas of lemon thyme, mandarin blossom and stonefruit combine harmoniously with ginger spice and nutty and savoury tones, underlined by exotic tropical notes. The many-layered palate is creamy and textured, balanced by a clean, mineral acidity. This wine has excellent persistence of flavour and intensity.

name: Château La Lagune Haut-Médoc (Grand Cru Classé) 2007
Séptima Malbec 2018
wine_description: Fresh cherry, toasty and vanilla notes obtained from the oak, acidity and alcohol content are perfectly balanced with soft and delicate tannins.

name: Château d'Armailhac Pauillac (Grand Cru Classé) 2005
wine_description: A dense and deep red with a violet tint, the wine has a still slightly reserved nose which opens with airing on hints of cassis, blackberry and fresh red fruit mingled with touches of cedarwood. The attack is nicely rounded, with well-integrated tannins that fill out on a mid-palate full of fruit. The flavours linger pleasingly in a full and expressive finish that gives the wine a fine overall balance.

name: Dog Point Sauvignon Blanc 2018
wine_description: Colour: Bright straw green. Bouquet: Ripe citrus and tropical fruits underpinned by a degree of minerality and a hint of basil. Palate: Fresh, concentrated and full bodied showing excellent balance between fruit and acidity.

name: Château Calon-Ségur Marquis de Calon Saint-Estèphe 2014
wine_description: The estate’s Second Wine is a different expression of the Calon terroir. With an average proportion of 75% Merlot in the blend, it is enjoyable to drink in the immediate term and exhibits a warm and velvety character. It is aged in barrels, a third of which are new, for up to 18 months.

name: Château Montrose Saint-Estèphe (Grand Cru Classé) 2012
wine_description: It has a fine and elegant robe with a beautifully intense and dark garnet. The nose, powerful and harmonious, is pleasantly woody. Aerated, it reveals lightly toasted aromas, followed with hints of ripe fruits and liquorice. The palate is full and soft with tight tannins and a light sweetness. The finish is long and harmonious.

name: Cos d'Estournel Cos d'Estournel 2001
wine_description: The call of faraway lands. As mysterious and intriguing as a lone adventurer returning from a solitary sail, Cos d’Estournel is slow to reveal itself. Little by little, it evokes stories of distant places, market stalls brimming with unfamiliar fruits, spices and wares, village festivities warmed by the joy of revelers and the setting sun, and sumptuous visions of ladies and their voluptuous curves. A myriad of scents, colors and tastes appeals to the senses. The Grand Vin of Cos d’Estournel is both demure and deliberately sensuous, a fascinating and elegant nectar.

name: Château Smith Haut-Lafitte Pessac-Léognan (Grand Cru Classé de Graves) 2007
Rocca di Frassinello Maremma Toscana Le Sughere di Frassinello 2015
wine_name: Maremma Toscana Le Sughere di Frassinello
wine_description:
Deep ruby ​​red color , wide
aromas of red fruits . The mouth has a great body ,
soft and round tannins and a long finish
enveloping

name: Tenuta Sette Ponti Oreno Toscana 2011
wine_description: Dark ruby red colour tinged with decisive violet tones, expresses on the nose incredible sensations o ullness and complexity with a note of ripe berries that give sensations of chocolate and nuances of balsam. Oreno is a captivating wine, rich in structure but decisively dynamic, enhanced by the nuances of new oak and an interminable nish

name: Domaine Jean-Louis Chave Côtes du Rhône Selection Mon Coeur 2015
wine_name: Côtes du Rhône Selection Mon Coeur
wine_description: Dark robe; blackberry, licorice, concentrated nose. Well-knit, black fruit, tannin thread along the palate that broadens well, gains some chewy tannins at the end. Good, honest drinking with some fullness, late life – has a black pepper aftertaste.

name: Château Talbot Connétable Talbot Saint-Julien 2011
wine_description: This is a classic, elegant wine, with a clear, well-designed structure and a long, fresh final.

name: Vietti Barbera d'Asti Tre Vigne 2017
wine_description: Ruby purple color with ripe red cherry aromas with hints of mineral and vanilla. A dry, medium bodied red wine with refreshing acidity (making it perfect to pair with food) and soft tannins, the Barbera d'Asti Tre Vigne is well balanced with good integration of oak, good complexity and a finish of more red cherries.

name: Château Lamothe-Bergeron Haut-Médoc 2010
wine_description: Fine rounded plum fruit on the nose. Warm plush cassis fruit with a hint of oak in the mouth. Nice balance and length.

name: Château Palmer Alter Ego Margaux 2012
wine_description: Alter Ego is a spontaneous uninhibited wine, soft and round as soon as it has finished barrel ageing. Its lush aromas and supple tannins make it a wine that can be appreciated in the first years after bottling. Finesse and elegance, aromatic richness, harmony and length.

name: Château Cantemerle Haut-Médoc (Grand Cru Classé) 2008
wine_description: Attractive aromas of pepper and licorice, evolving towards red fruit after agitation. The palate shows a harmonious marriage of charm and firmness based on soft, ripe, and very smooth tannins.

name: Château La Cardonne Médoc 2009
wine_description: It has deep, slightly evolved colour. Pleasant nose of ultra ripe red fruits underscored by spice notes. The palate is harmonious, sappy and fruit is framed by freshness. A wine in fine fettle that has probably reached its peak.

name: Trimbach Riesling Alsace Cuvée Frédéric Emile 2007
wine_description: This harmonious wine is very rich and fat, but has no residual sugar and has a wonderful mineral structure.

name: Château d'Armailhac Pauillac (Grand Cru Classé) 2006
wine_description: A dense and deep red with a violet tint, the wine has a still slightly reserved nose which opens with airing on hints of cassis, blackberry and fresh red fruit mingled with touches of cedarwood. The attack is nicely rounded, with well-integrated tannins that fill out on a mid-palate full of fruit. The flavours linger pleasingly in a full and expressive finish that gives the wine a fine overall balance.

name: Château de Camensac Haut-Médoc (Grand Cru Classé) 2012
Cloudy Bay Pinot Noir 2016
wine_description: Intensely fragrant with alluring aromas of dark plums and lifted hints of blueberry, layered over spicy sandalwood and smoky bacon. The palate is succulent and flavoursome with dark fruits and toasty oak gently supported by plush tannins.

name: Château Léoville Barton Saint-Julien (Grand Cru Classé) 2001
wine_description: This wine has an opaque dark red violet colour. With lovely herbal, lavender and blackberry notes on the nose. Tart berry, blackberry, black fruit palate with depth and sweet tannins.

name: Pio Cesare Nebbiolo 2016
wine_description:
The sources of the grapes, enriched by a small proportion of Nebbiolo from the Barbaresco and Barolo region, provide body, structure and a long ageing potential.
The fruit is intense and ripe but at the same time fresh with very sweet tannins. Nice fragrancy and longevity.

name: Henri Bourgeois Petit Bourgeois Sauvignon Blanc 2017
wine_description: It has fruity and floral bouquet, very aromatic with pleasant flower and fruit fragrances recalling the flower of the vine and the fruit. On the palate it reveals a freshness and vivacity characteristical of grapes harvested at good maturity.

name: Château Léoville Barton Saint-Julien (Grand Cru Classé) 2010
wine_description: This wine has an opaque dark red violet colour. With lovely herbal, lavender and blackberry notes on the nose. Tart berry, blackberry, black fruit palate with depth and sweet tannins.

name: Château La Tour de By Médoc 2011
wine_description: A beautiful dark ruby color, this wine has an elegant nose of blueberry, blackberry accompanied by a beautiful empyreumatic palette. The palate is dense, concentrated and fresh and taut tannins give this wine a nice length.

name: Bertani Amarone della Valpolicella Classico 2008
wine_description: Amarone Classico Bertani is a timeless wine that expresses the unique style that Bertani has always dedicatedly pursued. It is a classic style that does not need to change because it is always up-to-date. This wine has a deep garnet red colour. It presents a great variety of characters: dry fruit, liquorice and spice. It opens up in the mouth with all the red-berry fruits.

name: Château La Tour Carnet Haut-Médoc (Grand Cru Classé) 2012
wine_description: Color is deep garnet color with mahogany reflections slightly tuilés.  The nose is complex, we recognize in this order, blackcurrant, plum. Secondly, it is the spices that are expressed as cinnamon. Roasting the notes then appear in the form of wood burned. The mouth: Franche, mouth lets perceive immediately the incredible delicacy of tannins, coated, perfectly balanced. On the palate, ripe fruit and roasting.

name: Marqués de Riscal Rioja Gran Reserva 2011
wine_description: Deep black-cherry colour, almost opaque. Very elegant, complex nose, with aromas of black fruit and lots of spice. It is smooth and round in the mouth, with tannins which are firm, yet silky and very sweet and which envelop the whole palate. The finish is long, lingering, fresh and balanced  with a hint of fine elegant tannins.

name: Château Potensac Médoc 2010
wine_description: One of the showpieces of the Medoc, this structured and firm wine has strong Cabernet flavors that give both dry tannins and juicy black currant fruits. Still youthful, this balanced wine is likely to age well.

name: Bertani Amarone della Valpolicella Valpantena 2015
wine_description: Deep dark red color with violet rim. In the nose a deep scents of cherry, sour cherry and berries typical of Amarone della Valpolicella and notes of spices and dry fruit typical of Valpantena. In the mouth the tannins are present in the flavor of red fruit.

name: Henri Bourgeois Petit Bourgeois Sauvignon Blanc 2016
wine_description: It has fruity and floral bouquet, very aromatic with pleasant flower and fruit fragrances recalling the flower of the vine and the fruit. On the palate it reveals a freshness and vivacity characteristical of grapes harvested at good maturity.

name: Château Léoville Las Cases Clos du Marquis Saint-Julien 2005
Xavier Vignon Arcane XIX Le Soleil Côtes du Rhône Villages 2015
wine_name: Arcane XIX Le Soleil Côtes du Rhône Villages

name: Penfolds St. Henri Shiraz 2013
wine_description: Dark garnet with a deep core. Floral, perfumed, fresh. Boiled-fruitcake mix - nutmeg/cinnamon and mixed spices are laced with glacéed (Cointreau-like) citrus fruits. Subtle praline & liquorice trail on the finish. Medium to full-bodied with an acid/tannin conveyance propelling flavour to the back-palate.

name: Château du Tertre Margaux (Grand Cru Classé) 2012
wine_description: Great sweetness and flavour. Silky and freshness are combined in this flask to bring you the elegance expected of a great Margaux wine.

name: Château Pichon Baron Pauillac (Grand Cru Classé) 2010
wine_description: A wine of great personality with fresh red-fruit and blackberry scents. It is quick to express itself on the palate, rolling out its assertive, powerful character and rich flesh. The finish is very long-lasting, with dense, precise tannins. A finely-balanced wine of substance with firm structure and body.

name: Château d'Armailhac Pauillac (Grand Cru Classé) 2014
wine_description: A dense and deep red with a violet tint, the wine has a still slightly reserved nose which opens with airing on hints of cassis, blackberry and fresh red fruit mingled with touches of cedarwood. The attack is nicely rounded, with well-integrated tannins that fill out on a mid-palate full of fruit. The flavours linger pleasingly in a full and expressive finish that gives the wine a fine overall balance.

name: Paul Jaboulet Aîné Crozes-Hermitage Les Jalets 2016
wine_description: Attractive bright ruby colour, with a violet hue. Aromas of tart red berries, with a spicy final. Smooth, rich attack, finishing with liquorice notes.

name: Château de Beaucastel Châteauneuf-du-Pape 2013
wine_description: A stunning example of this Southern Rhône blend with a smooth, earthy nose velvety texture and fruit-forward style; lovely, generous ripe black raspberry fruit and an exquisite finish.

name: Casanova di Neri Rosso di Montalcino 2016
wine_description: It has ruby red with garnet hints of cherry, violet and red fruits. Great finesse in the mouth with tannins still young but high quality. Long, elegant and persistent.

name: Château La Lagune Haut-Médoc (Grand Cru Classé) 2010
Château Sociando-Mallet Haut-Médoc 2008
wine_description: Opaque black/purple colour, with notes of crushed rock, white flowers, graphite, blueberry and cassis, the wine is tight and needs to be coaxed from the glass. It is medium to full-bodied, with an excruciatingly tough-textured finish.

name: Château Giscours La Sirène de Giscours Margaux 2010
wine_description:
Deep purple color, soft concentrated nose of red fruits and fresh cut cedar. 
Mouth: some ripe fruit, some consentration and bitter, dry and short finish.

name: Château Montrose La Dame de Montrose Saint-Estèphe 2010
wine_description: It has a silky robe with a beautiful cherry red colour. The nose is very expressive and concentrated, slightly sweet and woody, with a mixture of red fruit aromas, raspberry, and morello cherry. The palate is powerful and racy, combining suppleness and tight tannins. Beautiful length in the mouth, with tannins less evident in the after-taste.

name: Penfolds St. Henri Shiraz 2012
wine_description: Dark garnet with a deep core. Floral, perfumed, fresh. Boiled-fruitcake mix - nutmeg/cinnamon and mixed spices are laced with glacéed (Cointreau-like) citrus fruits. Subtle praline & liquorice trail on the finish. Medium to full-bodied with an acid/tannin conveyance propelling flavour to the back-palate.

name: E. Guigal Châteauneuf-du-Pape 2015
wine_description: Deep dark red in colour. On the nose spices and mature red fruits. On the palate round tannins with powerful complexity. A rich unctuous wine with notes of mature plums, hazelnuts and red fruits. Very rich wine full of harmony and balance.

name: Château Carbonnieux Pessac-Léognan Blanc (Grand Cru Classé de Graves) 2014
wine_name: Pessac-Léognan Blanc (Grand Cru Classé de Graves)

name: Arboleda Cabernet Sauvignon 2014
wine_description: The nose offers aromas of red and black fruits, such as blackcurrant, blueberries, and strawberries, interlaced with notes of spices, smoke, and tobacco, and a light balsamic note that recalls bay leaf. A medium-bodied palate offers flavors that follow the nose along with soft tannins and fresh acidity that stimulates a juicy sensation that leads to a long and persistent finish.

name: Château du Tertre Margaux (Grand Cru Classé) 2010
wine_description: Great sweetness and flavour. Silky and freshness are combined in this flask to bring you the elegance expected of a great Margaux wine.

name: Château La Lagune Haut-Médoc (Grand Cru Classé) 2009
Château Duhart-Milon Pauillac (Grand Cru Classé) 2010
wine_description: Dark with good concentration, and the nose has a tightly defined fruit character, reticent rather than open, with a light sprinkle of chalk over some floral, black fruits. The palate has a very polished style, with a shell of fruit sitting around a core of very firm tannins which, although a strong component of the blend, do not over-ride the other elements.

name: Château Pichon Longueville Comtesse de Lalande Pauillac (Grand Cru Classé) 2008
wine_description: The wine is seductive when young without prejudicing its longevity. As well as an oaky flavour imparted by new oak barrels, the wines show inimitable aromas of tobacco, violets, blackcurrant and ripe fruit, and also hints of pencil lead.

name: Louis M. Martini Alexander Valley Cabernet Sauvignon 2015
wine_description: The dark purplish-red hue is indicative of its decadent blueberry and black cherry aromas and flavors. Notes of smoky cedar, dried herbs and licorice unfold around this wine’s assertive tannins that will soften with age. Rich and well-structured with a long, lingering finish.

name: Château Lagrange Les Fiefs de Lagrange Saint-Julien 2013
wine_description: Lively, intense color, without premature evolution. The nose has a fine, elegant character with aromas of ripe fruit and slightly woody notes. In the mouth, the balance is long and consistent. The aftertaste brings out the purity of the fruit thanks to moderate tannins.

name: Prunotto Barbaresco 2014
wine_description: Garnet red color of good intensity. Complex with hints of red fruit and spicy notes. Full flavor and velvety with a persistent aftertaste.

name: Castello Nipozzano Vecchie Viti Chianti Rùfina Riserva 2014
wine_description: Ruby-red colour, luminous and brilliant.  The nose opens with very ripe fruits: cherry, strawberry and raspberry are prominent.  Sweet scents of cotton candy and wild rose and notes of walnut and walnut husks.  Spicy notes follow such as cloves, star anise; the finish is minerally.  The palate is persistent and fresh, very smooth.

name: Château d'Armailhac Pauillac (Grand Cru Classé) 2008
wine_description: A dense and deep red with a violet tint, the wine has a still slightly reserved nose which opens with airing on hints of cassis, blackberry and fresh red fruit mingled with touches of cedarwood. The attack is nicely rounded, with well-integrated tannins that fill out on a mid-palate full of fruit. The flavours linger pleasingly in a full and expressive finish that gives the wine a fine overall balance.

name: Allegrini Amarone della Valpolicella Classico 2015
wine_description: The result of the Allegrini family’s expertise, a true classic of the appellation, this red wine embraces tradition, territory and the know-how of country ways. Corvina, Corvinone, Rondinella and Oseleta are left to air dry at least until December and are checked daily to ensure perfectly healthy grapes.

name: Château Latour-Martillac Pessac-Léognan (Grand Cru Classé de Graves) 2012
Château Smith Haut-Lafitte Pessac-Léognan (Grand Cru Classé de Graves) 2010
Château Lascombes Margaux (Grand Cru Classé) 2011
wine_description: This wine exhibits a deep blue/purple hue along with a sweet perfume of blueberries, black raspberries, cherries, incense, smoke, and spring flowers. While opulent, underneath the full-bodied richness of fruit and depth, is a structured wine.

name: Château Pape Clément Pessac-Léognan (Grand Cru Classé de Graves) 2006
Château Léoville Poyferré Saint-Julien (Grand Cru Classé) 2004
Château Grand-Puy-Lacoste Pauillac (Grand Cru Classé) 2011
wine_description: Exhibits classic Pauillac aromas and flavors of creme de cassis along with stony/floral notes.

name: Château Pichon Baron Pauillac (Grand Cru Classé) 2011
wine_description: A wine of great personality with fresh red-fruit and blackberry scents. It is quick to express itself on the palate, rolling out its assertive, powerful character and rich flesh. The finish is very long-lasting, with dense, precise tannins. A finely-balanced wine of substance with firm structure and body.

name: Château Gruaud Larose Saint-Julien (Grand Cru Classé) 2001
Altesino Brunello di Montalcino 2014
wine_description: It a brilliant ruby red colour, tending towards garnet red with age. Its bouquet is intense, pure, pleasant and refined, reminiscent of sweet violet, tobacco, chocolate and pleasant hints of wild berries and vanilla. Its flavour fully confirms the above in a well-balanced, full-bodied wine with good tannins and a solid structure.

name: Château Gruaud Larose Saint-Julien (Grand Cru Classé) 2000
Bouchard Père & Fils Beaune du Château Premier Cru 2015
Château de Beaucastel Coudoulet de Beaucastel Côtes-du-Rhône 2014
wine_description: Dark garnet in color, fading to pink at the rim. Full bodied, smooth textured and well structured, with good length, this one really benefits from some extended air, as the fruit turns richer and sweeter.

name: Château Grand-Puy-Lacoste Pauillac (Grand Cru Classé) 2012
wine_description: Exhibits classic Pauillac aromas and flavors of creme de cassis along with stony/floral notes.

name: Château Ormes de Pez Saint-Estèphe 2009
wine_description: Dark red violet in colour. On the nose ripe currant, red berry and herbal notes. A tasty, herbaceous, berry and cassis palate with a medium finish.

name: Penfolds St. Henri Shiraz 2009
wine_description: Dark garnet with a deep core. Floral, perfumed, fresh. Boiled-fruitcake mix - nutmeg/cinnamon and mixed spices are laced with glacéed (Cointreau-like) citrus fruits. Subtle praline & liquorice trail on the finish. Medium to full-bodied with an acid/tannin conveyance propelling flavour to the back-palate.

name: Château Prieuré-Lichine Margaux (Grand Cru Classé) 2010
wine_description: A glossy crimson-black hue, with the aromas of blackberry. A soft creamed-fruit substance on the palate, with lots of ripe, supple, velvety tannins and a good core of acidity. Rich, substantial, with a firm grippy finish.

name: Antinori Pian delle Vigne Brunello di Montalcino 2014
wine_name: Pian delle Vigne Brunello di Montalcino
wine_description: Marchesi Antinori’s passion for viticulture is expressed through perseverance: their continuous pursuit for quality improvement, even in the smallest details. Research and development is an ongoing process both in the vineyards and in the cellars: selecting new clones of local and international varieties: experimenting with new techniques in the vineyards and vineyard altitudes, new approaches to fermentation and temperature control, experimenting with both traditional and innovative winemaking philosophies, using new types of oak for barrels, barrel size and age, and varying length of aging in the bottle before commercial release.

name: Château Lanessan Haut-Médoc 2010
wine_description: Deeply colored and flavored, fuller than most Haut Medocs. Spice, anise, tar, black-currant and plum flavors lend it complexity and character.

name: Château Montrose Saint-Estèphe (Grand Cru Classé) 2008
wine_description: It has a fine and elegant robe with a beautifully intense and dark garnet. The nose, powerful and harmonious, is pleasantly woody. Aerated, it reveals lightly toasted aromas, followed with hints of ripe fruits and liquorice. The palate is full and soft with tight tannins and a light sweetness. The finish is long and harmonious.

name: Château Pichon Baron Pauillac (Grand Cru Classé) 2009
wine_description: A wine of great personality with fresh red-fruit and blackberry scents. It is quick to express itself on the palate, rolling out its assertive, powerful character and rich flesh. The finish is very long-lasting, with dense, precise tannins. A finely-balanced wine of substance with firm structure and body.

name: Château de Beaucastel Châteauneuf-du-Pape 1998
wine_description: A stunning example of this Southern Rhône blend with a smooth, earthy nose velvety texture and fruit-forward style; lovely, generous ripe black raspberry fruit and an exquisite finish.

name: Alión Ribera del Duero 2003
wine_description: It appears with hints of roast from the grape and top-quality wood. On the palate, the sweetened tannins of the concentrated black fruits blend with the dry creamy tannins of the French oak. It is full of flavor, strong, fleshy and unfolds a truly suggestive range of tastes.

name: Domaine de Chevalier Pessac-Léognan (Grand Cru Classé de Graves) 2012
Feudi di San Gregorio Falanghina 2018
wine_description: The color is straw yellow that contains brilliant green reflections. The perfume is intense and persistent with sensations of delicate white flowers and fruit. The taste offers freshness and balance, with a clean finish.

name: Château Duhart-Milon Pauillac (Grand Cru Classé) 2005
wine_description: Dark with good concentration, and the nose has a tightly defined fruit character, reticent rather than open, with a light sprinkle of chalk over some floral, black fruits. The palate has a very polished style, with a shell of fruit sitting around a core of very firm tannins which, although a strong component of the blend, do not over-ride the other elements.

name: Château Smith Haut-Lafitte Pessac-Léognan (Grand Cru Classé de Graves) 2005
Lapostolle Canto de Apalta Cellar Selection 2011
wine_description: Brilliant red purple color with aromas of chocolate and tobacco. On the palate, the wine offers elegant and balanced tannins that are very well integrated with bitter chocolate and coffee notes in aftertaste. Very persistent finish.

name: Antinori Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri 2013
wine_name: Tenuta Guado al Tasso Cont'Ugo Bolgheri
wine_description: Marchesi Antinori’s passion for viticulture is expressed through perseverance: their continuous pursuit for quality improvement, even in the smallest details. Research and development is an ongoing process both in the vineyards and in the cellars: selecting new clones of local and international varieties: experimenting with new techniques in the vineyards and vineyard altitudes, new approaches to fermentation and temperature control, experimenting with both traditional and innovative winemaking philosophies, using new types of oak for barrels, barrel size and age, and varying length of aging in the bottle before commercial release.

name: Villa Borghetti Valpolicella Classico 2018
wine_description:
a deep red color, the nose is fresh with notes 
of red fruits such as currants and cherries. The palate is well structured, 
round and round and well balanced.

name: Château Pavie Esprit de Pavie Bordeaux 2011
Château Fleur Cardinale Saint-Émilion Grand Cru (Grand Cru Classé) 2009
Château Léoville Barton Saint-Julien (Grand Cru Classé) 2009
wine_description: This wine has an opaque dark red violet colour. With lovely herbal, lavender and blackberry notes on the nose. Tart berry, blackberry, black fruit palate with depth and sweet tannins.

name: Château Fombrauge Saint-Émilion Grand Cru (Grand Cru Classé) 2014
wine_description: Color is ruby ​​red, brilliant, clear. The nose is rather expressive, of average complexity. The first fruits are blackcurrant and cherry.  Friandy, rather supple, not very voluminous, the mouth is characterized by its balance: an acidity and a quasi absence of tannins favor the impression of roundness. Beautiful finish, elegant, fresh.

name: Château Beaumont Haut-Médoc 2012
wine_description: Great intensity. Very deep colour with garnet reflections. The nose is very open and inviting with soft oaky notes of vanilla and spice bringing out the red fruits such as blackcurrant and black cherry. The attack on the palate is smooth and fresh. The tannic development is of great quality, with fatness giving real mouthfeel. The lightly oaked fruit aromas are very elegant and contribute to the fine aromatic persistence.

name: Château Kirwan Margaux (Grand Cru Classé) 2012
wine_description: Moderately saturated ruby. Out of a decanter, fairly forward blackberry and floral nose, but the body is light and the wine shows little until some really grippy tannins and acidity appear and bring the wine to a screeching halt. A highly structured Margaux.

name: Château Gruaud Larose Saint-Julien (Grand Cru Classé) 2006
Château Giscours La Sirène de Giscours Margaux 2014
wine_description:
Deep purple color, soft concentrated nose of red fruits and fresh cut cedar. 
Mouth: some ripe fruit, some consentration and bitter, dry and short finish.

name: Querciabella Chianti Classico 2014
wine_description: This Chianti Classico is a great Tuscan red with concentrated sour cherry fruit flavour, a hint of star anise and super-sleek texture.

name: Château Patache d'Aux Médoc 2011
wine_description: Brilliant dark in colour and spicy on the nose. The mouth is rich, complex and fleshy with a beautiful persistence. It has beautiful black fruit aromas and generous tannins.

name: Château Malartic-Lagravière Pessac-Léognan (Grand Cru Classé de Graves) 2009
wine_description: This wine has an purple colour accompanied by an unctuous texture, extraordinary elegance, lots of licorice, graphite, blueberry, black raspberry and cherry characteristics. It has a full body, terrific purity and length and good acidity.

name: Château Clerc Milon Pauillac (Grand Cru Classé) 2006
wine_description: The nose reveals finely toasted spice and tobacco notes combined with more intense aromas of red fruit and cherry stone with a mineral touch. The palate is full and well-defined, dominated by the lustre of succulent fruit and refined, flavoursome tannins that open on a hint of chocolate. The long, warm-hearted finish is lifted by a slightly saline taste.

name: Château Pape Clément Pessac-Léognan (Grand Cru Classé de Graves) 2009
Famille Perrin Côtes du Rhône Nature Rouge 2016
wine_description:
It is characterized by a deep red color.A rich nose of red fruits and a spicy palate structure. 
Good structure, fruity in the mouth, leaving a nice freshness. With soft and elegant tannins.

name: Masi Serego Alighieri Vaio Armaron Amarone della Valpolicella Classico 2012
wine_name: Serego Alighieri Vaio Armaron Amarone della Valpolicella Classico
wine_description: Deep, bright, ruby red. Complex, super-ripe cherries with baked plums. Cherry and berry fruit tastes. Spicy hints of cinnamon and vanilla.

name: Château Montrose La Dame de Montrose Saint-Estèphe 2011
wine_description: It has a silky robe with a beautiful cherry red colour. The nose is very expressive and concentrated, slightly sweet and woody, with a mixture of red fruit aromas, raspberry, and morello cherry. The palate is powerful and racy, combining suppleness and tight tannins. Beautiful length in the mouth, with tannins less evident in the after-taste.

name: Nino Negri 5 Stelle Sfursat 2009
wine_description: This wine is redolent with spicy notes that disperse into hints of coffee. The flavour is concentrated, vigorous, extraordinarily intense and attractive and with an aristocratic undertone of jam and spices. The finale is full-bodied, ample and very persistent.

name: Château Pape Clément Pessac-Léognan (Grand Cru Classé de Graves) 2007
Château La Tour de By Médoc 2012
wine_description: A beautiful dark ruby color, this wine has an elegant nose of blueberry, blackberry accompanied by a beautiful empyreumatic palette. The palate is dense, concentrated and fresh and taut tannins give this wine a nice length.

name: Château Figeac Saint-Émilion Grand Cru (Premier Grand Cru Classé) 2000
wine_name: Saint-Émilion Grand Cru (Premier Grand Cru Classé)

name: Santi Valpolicella Ripasso Classico Superiore Solane 2015
wine_description:
Valpolicella Classico Superiore Ripasso Solane wine is strongly linked to the territory and to
This sincere and full of character . It shows a beautiful ruby color and deep.

name: Henri Bourgeois Petit Bourgeois Sauvignon Blanc 2018
wine_description: It has fruity and floral bouquet, very aromatic with pleasant flower and fruit fragrances recalling the flower of the vine and the fruit. On the palate it reveals a freshness and vivacity characteristical of grapes harvested at good maturity.

name: Shafer One Point Five Cabernet Sauvignon 2016
wine_description: Aromas of crushed red and black summer berries, rose petal and herbs. In the mouth the generous, lush black and red fruits integrate enticingly with sage, tobacco leaf, smoke and black spice all wrapped within a structure of ripe Stags Leap District tannins.

name: Château Léoville Barton Saint-Julien (Grand Cru Classé) 2011
wine_description: This wine has an opaque dark red violet colour. With lovely herbal, lavender and blackberry notes on the nose. Tart berry, blackberry, black fruit palate with depth and sweet tannins.

name: Château Potensac Médoc 2011
wine_description: One of the showpieces of the Medoc, this structured and firm wine has strong Cabernet flavors that give both dry tannins and juicy black currant fruits. Still youthful, this balanced wine is likely to age well.

name: Château Potensac Médoc 2012
wine_description: One of the showpieces of the Medoc, this structured and firm wine has strong Cabernet flavors that give both dry tannins and juicy black currant fruits. Still youthful, this balanced wine is likely to age well.

name: Château Fleur Cardinale Saint-Émilion Grand Cru (Grand Cru Classé) 2012
Château Ducru-Beaucaillou Croix de Beaucaillou Saint-Julien 2011
Château Beaumont Haut-Médoc 2015
wine_description: Great intensity. Very deep colour with garnet reflections. The nose is very open and inviting with soft oaky notes of vanilla and spice bringing out the red fruits such as blackcurrant and black cherry. The attack on the palate is smooth and fresh. The tannic development is of great quality, with fatness giving real mouthfeel. The lightly oaked fruit aromas are very elegant and contribute to the fine aromatic persistence.

name: Château Potensac Médoc 2008
wine_description: One of the showpieces of the Medoc, this structured and firm wine has strong Cabernet flavors that give both dry tannins and juicy black currant fruits. Still youthful, this balanced wine is likely to age well.

name: Cos d'Estournel Pagodes de Cos 2011
wine_description: The joy and spontaneity of moments shared with loved ones. An impromptu lunch with friends is the perfect occasion to open a bottle of Pagodes de Cos. It is reminiscent of the simple pleasures of life, like homemade blackcurrant syrup, a bowl of just-picked red cherries or a freshly opened jar of citrus jam. Pagodes de Cos is at once indulgent, comforting and vivacious, like a carefree conversation with family or friends in a familiar place.

name: Château Ormes de Pez Saint-Estèphe 2012
wine_description: Dark red violet in colour. On the nose ripe currant, red berry and herbal notes. A tasty, herbaceous, berry and cassis palate with a medium finish.

name: Château Montrose Saint-Estèphe (Grand Cru Classé) 2000
wine_description: It has a fine and elegant robe with a beautifully intense and dark garnet. The nose, powerful and harmonious, is pleasantly woody. Aerated, it reveals lightly toasted aromas, followed with hints of ripe fruits and liquorice. The palate is full and soft with tight tannins and a light sweetness. The finish is long and harmonious.

name: Château Léoville Las Cases Saint-Julien (Grand Cru Classé) 1995
Château Carbonnieux Pessac-Léognan Blanc (Grand Cru Classé de Graves) 2016
wine_name: Pessac-Léognan Blanc (Grand Cru Classé de Graves)

name: Domaine de Chevalier Pessac-Léognan (Grand Cru Classé de Graves) 2008
Bertani Amarone della Valpolicella Classico 2009
wine_description: Amarone Classico Bertani is a timeless wine that expresses the unique style that Bertani has always dedicatedly pursued. It is a classic style that does not need to change because it is always up-to-date. This wine has a deep garnet red colour. It presents a great variety of characters: dry fruit, liquorice and spice. It opens up in the mouth with all the red-berry fruits.

name: Château Pichon Baron Pauillac (Grand Cru Classé) 1996
wine_description: A wine of great personality with fresh red-fruit and blackberry scents. It is quick to express itself on the palate, rolling out its assertive, powerful character and rich flesh. The finish is very long-lasting, with dense, precise tannins. A finely-balanced wine of substance with firm structure and body.

name: Two Hands Gnarly Dudes Shiraz 2015
wine_description: Deep dark red, with flecks of magenta at the meniscus. Dark and alluring with notes of blackberries, bramble, roast meats, lavender and coal dust. Lovely density and weight, blackberry and plum cascade across the palate with notes of roast meats, pipe smoke and cedar playing a supporting role.

name: Château Calon-Ségur Marquis de Calon Saint-Estèphe 2015
wine_description: The estate’s Second Wine is a different expression of the Calon terroir. With an average proportion of 75% Merlot in the blend, it is enjoyable to drink in the immediate term and exhibits a warm and velvety character. It is aged in barrels, a third of which are new, for up to 18 months.

name: Château Pichon Baron Pauillac (Grand Cru Classé) 2007
wine_description: A wine of great personality with fresh red-fruit and blackberry scents. It is quick to express itself on the palate, rolling out its assertive, powerful character and rich flesh. The finish is very long-lasting, with dense, precise tannins. A finely-balanced wine of substance with firm structure and body.

name: Château Bois Pertuis Bordeaux 2014
wine_description: Bright garnet colour with ruby tints. The nose is fruity, spicy and complex. It offers cherry, pepper, vanilla scents and a spicy note. On the palate, the wine is full and well-balanced.

name: Château Léoville Poyferré Saint-Julien (Grand Cru Classé) 2010
Two Hands Gnarly Dudes Shiraz 2014
wine_description: Deep dark red, with flecks of magenta at the meniscus. Dark and alluring with notes of blackberries, bramble, roast meats, lavender and coal dust. Lovely density and weight, blackberry and plum cascade across the palate with notes of roast meats, pipe smoke and cedar playing a supporting role.

name: Château Maucaillou Moulis-en-Médoc 2010
wine_description: It is generally sumptuous in colour, with a particularly subtle and pleasantly fruity aromatic strength, very ripe and concentrated flavours. It is harmoniously balanced, expressive and generous, with finesse and elegance. It has a great length on the palate, with a lively appeal and remarkable cellaring potential thanks to very fine, yet clearly present, tannins.

name: Château Latour-Martillac Pessac-Léognan (Grand Cru Classé de Graves) 2010
Château Gruaud Larose Saint-Julien (Grand Cru Classé) 2007
Louis Jadot Chablis 2018
wine_description: It has a very nice golden yellow colour. Lipid, bright and fresh wine, which taste and bouquet develop relatively quickly.

name: Domaine du Vieux Télégraphe Châteauneuf-du-Pape (La Crau) 2016
wine_description: Deep ruby with some purple nuances, this wine is medium to full-bodied and reveals notes of licorice, pepper, Asian spices, black cherry, raspberry, and currant, as well as a relatively big, sweet palate impression with moderate tannin in the finish.

name: M. Chapoutier Belleruche Côtes-du-Rhône 2018
wine_description: Colour: Garnet red. Nose: Red fruit aromas, mainly Morello cherries. Mouth: aromas of red fruits (mainly morello cherries) and spices (liquorice, grey pepper).

name: Château Clerc Milon Pauillac (Grand Cru Classé) 2009
wine_description: The nose reveals finely toasted spice and tobacco notes combined with more intense aromas of red fruit and cherry stone with a mineral touch. The palate is full and well-defined, dominated by the lustre of succulent fruit and refined, flavoursome tannins that open on a hint of chocolate. The long, warm-hearted finish is lifted by a slightly saline taste.

name: Château Ormes de Pez Saint-Estèphe 2010
wine_description: Dark red violet in colour. On the nose ripe currant, red berry and herbal notes. A tasty, herbaceous, berry and cassis palate with a medium finish.

name: Château Pichon Longueville Comtesse de Lalande Réserve (de la Comtesse) Pauillac 2014
wine_description: Complexity, elegance and longevity are the hallmarks of this race. The nose is distinguished by a bouquet of aromas, mixing blackcurrant and violet, vanilla and cinnamon. On the palate, the tannins appear mature and melted, revealing a strong and affirmed structure, a surprising suppleness, perfect harmony and long persistency.

name: Losada Bierzo Red 2017
wine_description: A fresh, fruity, marked Atlantic and wine berciano character.Ripe aromas, and juicy dark fruit and peppercorn flavours.

name: Pio Cesare Nebbiolo 2013
wine_description:
The sources of the grapes, enriched by a small proportion of Nebbiolo from the Barbaresco and Barolo region, provide body, structure and a long ageing potential.
The fruit is intense and ripe but at the same time fresh with very sweet tannins. Nice fragrancy and longevity.

name: Château Brane-Cantenac Margaux de Brane (Margaux de Henri Lurton) 2015
wine_name: Margaux de Brane (Margaux de Henri Lurton)

name: Château Palmer Alter Ego Margaux 2011
wine_description: Alter Ego is a spontaneous uninhibited wine, soft and round as soon as it has finished barrel ageing. Its lush aromas and supple tannins make it a wine that can be appreciated in the first years after bottling. Finesse and elegance, aromatic richness, harmony and length.

name: E. Guigal Gigondas 2015
wine_description: Beautiful purple in colour. Intense nose with dominant stone fruits and liquorice. On the palate generous, powerful and full-bodied with a long finish.

name: Château Poujeaux Moulis-en-Médoc 2011
wine_description: Lovely bright fruit, with a crystalline black summer berry character. The palate has good freshness, with a crisp style, and crunchy black fruits. There is even a little suppleness to it. Firm, tannic backbone too, with good acidity.

name: Luce della Vite Lucente 2017
wine_description: The nose is just as impressive, presenting a broad range of elegant aromatic impressions. Smooth, ripe scents of dried plum and blackberry preserves are easily noted, along with more pungent roasted espresso bean and baker’s chocolate, and subtle notes of green pepper.

name: Château Léoville Las Cases Clos du Marquis Saint-Julien 2000
Domaine de Chevalier Pessac-Léognan (Grand Cru Classé de Graves) 2011
Barton & Guestier B&G Réserve Pinot Noir 2018
wine_description:
The star grape variety of Burgundy gives also its best in Corsica!

Region: Corsica Island in the Mediterranean sea.
Grape Variety: 100% Pinot Noir.
Soil : A wide variety of soils such as sand, clay, chalk, schist, gravel and pebbles.
Climate : Mediterranean climate, very windy with high temperatures and exceptional sun. Wide temperature range between cool nights and warm days, ideal for the maturation of the Pinot Noir.
Vinification: De-stalked grapes – cold pre-fermenting maceration for 3 days to extract complex aromas (at 12°C / 54°F) and under CO2 protection – alcoholic fermentation in vats with punching of the cap twice a day (temperature carefully controlled to reach 27°C / 81°F at the end of the fermentation).
Malolactic fermentation in vats.

Ruby red with violet hues. Intense nose of red cherry combined with seductive mocha, vanilla and spicy notes.
Soft on the palate with velvety tannins, dominated by notes of kirsch and spices.

Best served between 14°C and 16°C / 57°F and 61°F.

name: Château Citran Haut-Médoc 2011
wine_description: It has beautiful intense black color with violet highlights.  Expressive, releasing aromas of ripe black fruit with light notes of roasting. Good attack with volume, very present black fruits, beautiful structure, well balanced tannins and harmony, rich mid-palate, long finish with silky tannins and leave its full potential aromatic.

name: Château Haut-Bages Libéral Pauillac (Grand Cru Classé) 2010
wine_description:
Characterised by its red and blackberries aromas but also minerality and cedar. The nose
and the mouth show some freshness. A nice balance with fine tannins. Slightly peppery with a hint of clove.

name: Château Gruaud Larose Sarget de Gruaud-Larose Saint-Julien 2012
wine_description: Lovely deep ruby appearance with purple hints. The nose shows aromas of red fruits, fresh cherry, raspberry, light spices. Lots of freshness in the mouth. Fine balance with a great finish.

name: Château Clerc Milon Pauillac (Grand Cru Classé) 2010
wine_description: The nose reveals finely toasted spice and tobacco notes combined with more intense aromas of red fruit and cherry stone with a mineral touch. The palate is full and well-defined, dominated by the lustre of succulent fruit and refined, flavoursome tannins that open on a hint of chocolate. The long, warm-hearted finish is lifted by a slightly saline taste.

name: Château de Beaucastel Châteauneuf-du-Pape 2006
wine_description: A stunning example of this Southern Rhône blend with a smooth, earthy nose velvety texture and fruit-forward style; lovely, generous ripe black raspberry fruit and an exquisite finish.

name: Produttori del Barbaresco Nebbiolo Langhe 2018
wine_description: Medium dark violet color with pale meniscus. Smoke, oak, ripe black fruit, liquorice to the nose. Oak, smoky, black fruit, charcoal palate displaying a medium-plus finish.

name: Château Grand-Puy-Lacoste Pauillac (Grand Cru Classé) 2005
wine_description: Exhibits classic Pauillac aromas and flavors of creme de cassis along with stony/floral notes.

name: Château Léoville Poyferré Saint-Julien (Grand Cru Classé) 2012
Château Haut-Bages Libéral Pauillac (Grand Cru Classé) 2005
wine_description:
Characterised by its red and blackberries aromas but also minerality and cedar. The nose
and the mouth show some freshness. A nice balance with fine tannins. Slightly peppery with a hint of clove.

name: J. Moreau & Fils Chablis 2018
wine_description: A clean, mineral and perfumed nose, with flinty flavors of grapefruit.

name: Château Fuissé Pouilly-Fuissé Tête de Cuvée 2015
Château Pichon Baron Pauillac (Grand Cru Classé) 1995
wine_description: A wine of great personality with fresh red-fruit and blackberry scents. It is quick to express itself on the palate, rolling out its assertive, powerful character and rich flesh. The finish is very long-lasting, with dense, precise tannins. A finely-balanced wine of substance with firm structure and body.

name: Château Bouscassé Madiran 2015
wine_description:
Harmony and power, a delicate fruitiness with aromas of blackberries and well-integrated
tannins, full-bodied on the palate. This is a wine that stays young for a long time, evolving
very slowly, and thus has a good potential to age.

name: Château du Tertre Margaux (Grand Cru Classé) 2011
wine_description: Great sweetness and flavour. Silky and freshness are combined in this flask to bring you the elegance expected of a great Margaux wine.

name: Château Pichon Longueville Comtesse de Lalande Pauillac (Grand Cru Classé) 2009
wine_description: The wine is seductive when young without prejudicing its longevity. As well as an oaky flavour imparted by new oak barrels, the wines show inimitable aromas of tobacco, violets, blackcurrant and ripe fruit, and also hints of pencil lead.

name: Château Lilian Ladouys Saint-Estèphe 2011
wine_description: It is soft and velvety, with blueberry and blackberry aromas. Full body, with round tannins and a long finish. A rich and almost jammy wine.

name: Sena Aconcagua Valley 2011
wine_description: Dark, dry red color. The scent has notes of berries, tobacco, cocoa, coconut and pepper. The flavor is intense, with a wealth of nuances and a very nice balance, which gives it a very classic French flavor.

name: Château Gruaud Larose Saint-Julien (Grand Cru Classé) 2003
Château Latour-Martillac Pessac-Léognan (Grand Cru Classé de Graves) 2015
Château de Ferrand Saint-Émilion Grand Cru (Grand Cru Classé) 2010
wine_description: 75% Merlot, for fullness, roundness and persistence. 15% Cabernet Franc and 10% Cabernet Sauvignon for fruitiness, structure and complexity. Very expressive and aromatic wines with present tannins which are well-matured.

name: Château Pichon Longueville Comtesse de Lalande Réserve (de la Comtesse) Pauillac 2008
wine_description: Complexity, elegance and longevity are the hallmarks of this race. The nose is distinguished by a bouquet of aromas, mixing blackcurrant and violet, vanilla and cinnamon. On the palate, the tannins appear mature and melted, revealing a strong and affirmed structure, a surprising suppleness, perfect harmony and long persistency.

name: Sena Aconcagua Valley 2015
wine_description: Dark, dry red color. The scent has notes of berries, tobacco, cocoa, coconut and pepper. The flavor is intense, with a wealth of nuances and a very nice balance, which gives it a very classic French flavor.

name: Torres Viña Esmeralda 2019
wine_description:
Fragrant and floral (lime blossom, acacia honey) with notes of fresh fruit (Muscat grape, citrus)
and tropical passion fruit. Sensual and silky on the palate, framed by seductive, delicate acidity
(pink grapefruit).

name: Château Lascombes Margaux (Grand Cru Classé) 2012
wine_description: This wine exhibits a deep blue/purple hue along with a sweet perfume of blueberries, black raspberries, cherries, incense, smoke, and spring flowers. While opulent, underneath the full-bodied richness of fruit and depth, is a structured wine.

name: Château Pichon Baron Pauillac (Grand Cru Classé) 2002
wine_description: A wine of great personality with fresh red-fruit and blackberry scents. It is quick to express itself on the palate, rolling out its assertive, powerful character and rich flesh. The finish is very long-lasting, with dense, precise tannins. A finely-balanced wine of substance with firm structure and body.

name: Domaine de Chevalier Pessac-Léognan (Grand Cru Classé de Graves) 2010
Château Léoville Las Cases Clos du Marquis Saint-Julien 2007
Domaine de Chevalier Pessac-Léognan (Grand Cru Classé de Graves) 2006
Château La Dominique Saint-Émilion Grand Cru (Grand Cru Classé) 2010
wine_description: Deep and shiny colour with an intense, characterized nose by seducing aromas of ripe fruits and subtle spicy notes. In most vintages, you will find truffle and licorice notes, complemented by peppery and woody aromas. Fleshy and round, with silky and precise tannins. The finish is long and full and leaves you with a pleasant feeling of bliss.

name: William Fèvre Petit Chablis 2017
wine_description: This wine shows a bouquet marked by great freshness. It displays fruity, floral and mineral notes. It is a light and lively wine.

name: Château Talbot Connétable Talbot Saint-Julien 2012
wine_description: This is a classic, elegant wine, with a clear, well-designed structure and a long, fresh final.

name: Château Grand-Puy-Lacoste Pauillac (Grand Cru Classé) 2000
wine_description: Exhibits classic Pauillac aromas and flavors of creme de cassis along with stony/floral notes.

name: Tommasi Masseria Surani Dionysos Primitivo di Manduria Riserva 2015
wine_name: Masseria Surani Dionysos Primitivo di Manduria Riserva
wine_description: Intense deep ruby red color with hints of plum, blackberry and raspberry, the nose has spicy notes of coffee, pepper and chocolate. On the palate it is fine, pleasant and elegant, of good intensity, persistence and velvet tannins.

name: Château de Ferrand Saint-Émilion Grand Cru (Grand Cru Classé) 2012
wine_description: 75% Merlot, for fullness, roundness and persistence. 15% Cabernet Franc and 10% Cabernet Sauvignon for fruitiness, structure and complexity. Very expressive and aromatic wines with present tannins which are well-matured.

name: Château La Tour Carnet Haut-Médoc (Grand Cru Classé) 2014
wine_description: Color is deep garnet color with mahogany reflections slightly tuilés.  The nose is complex, we recognize in this order, blackcurrant, plum. Secondly, it is the spices that are expressed as cinnamon. Roasting the notes then appear in the form of wood burned. The mouth: Franche, mouth lets perceive immediately the incredible delicacy of tannins, coated, perfectly balanced. On the palate, ripe fruit and roasting.

name: Mastroberardino Taurasi Radici 2014
wine_description: It is deep ruby red. Full, complex and intense, with notes of cherry, violet, wild berries and a distinctive spicy aroma. Fascinating and elegant in the mouth. With flavors of plum, black cherry, strawberry and intense spices.

name: Château Lascombes Margaux (Grand Cru Classé) 2010
wine_description: This wine exhibits a deep blue/purple hue along with a sweet perfume of blueberries, black raspberries, cherries, incense, smoke, and spring flowers. While opulent, underneath the full-bodied richness of fruit and depth, is a structured wine.

name: Château Potensac Médoc 2009
wine_description: One of the showpieces of the Medoc, this structured and firm wine has strong Cabernet flavors that give both dry tannins and juicy black currant fruits. Still youthful, this balanced wine is likely to age well.

name: Pelissero Barbaresco Nubiola 2013
wine_description: It has an intense ruby red colour, to the nose it has both fruity and floreal notes that go from the ripe red fruit to the officinal herbs. Soft, tasty, velvety at the same time, leaves on the taste buds a note of sweetness and roundness typical of ripe grape with a slightly dry and astringent closure that distinguishes the Nebbiolo.

name: Château Pichon Baron Pauillac (Grand Cru Classé) 2012
wine_description: A wine of great personality with fresh red-fruit and blackberry scents. It is quick to express itself on the palate, rolling out its assertive, powerful character and rich flesh. The finish is very long-lasting, with dense, precise tannins. A finely-balanced wine of substance with firm structure and body.

name: Château Ducru-Beaucaillou Croix de Beaucaillou Saint-Julien 2010
Terras Gauda Terras Gauda O Rosal 2019
wine_description: This is a highly complex wine with outstanding pleasant citrus aromas of mandarin orange and grapefruit, ripe peach and pineapple, combined with pleasant hints of orange blossom, mint and mild earthy, mineral notes.

name: Château Rauzan-Ségla Margaux (Grand Cru Classé) 2008
wine_description: Candied confectionary nose along with some Margaux perfume and flowers. Palate is nicely fresh. Sweet and modern, with rich berry flavours, balanced and nicely proportioned until the finish.

name: Nino Negri 5 Stelle Sfursat 2015
wine_description: This wine is redolent with spicy notes that disperse into hints of coffee. The flavour is concentrated, vigorous, extraordinarily intense and attractive and with an aristocratic undertone of jam and spices. The finale is full-bodied, ample and very persistent.

name: Jean Foillard Morgon 2017
wine_description: It contains fairly dark red. Sort of muted nose, not giving much, some blackberry and cherry, earthy notes.

name: Château Ducru-Beaucaillou Croix de Beaucaillou Saint-Julien 2012
Château Gruaud Larose Saint-Julien (Grand Cru Classé) 2011
Château Prieuré-Lichine Margaux (Grand Cru Classé) 2014
wine_description: A glossy crimson-black hue, with the aromas of blackberry. A soft creamed-fruit substance on the palate, with lots of ripe, supple, velvety tannins and a good core of acidity. Rich, substantial, with a firm grippy finish.

name: Château Lagrange Les Fiefs de Lagrange Saint-Julien 2015
wine_description: Lively, intense color, without premature evolution. The nose has a fine, elegant character with aromas of ripe fruit and slightly woody notes. In the mouth, the balance is long and consistent. The aftertaste brings out the purity of the fruit thanks to moderate tannins.

name: Château d'Armailhac Pauillac (Grand Cru Classé) 2004
wine_description: A dense and deep red with a violet tint, the wine has a still slightly reserved nose which opens with airing on hints of cassis, blackberry and fresh red fruit mingled with touches of cedarwood. The attack is nicely rounded, with well-integrated tannins that fill out on a mid-palate full of fruit. The flavours linger pleasingly in a full and expressive finish that gives the wine a fine overall balance.

name: San Felice Vigorello 2010
wine_description: Dense ruby colour with hints of garnet. Bouquet comprising blackcurrant conserve, spiced notes and forest fruit. Warm, complex, tannic palate with mild notes of vanilla.

name: Château Pedesclaux Pauillac (Grand Cru Classé) 2012
wine_description: This wine's beautiful purple color is very deep, the nose is very aromatic with nice ripe black fruit. It is  round and harmonious on the palate with silky tannins and a long finish.

name: Domaine de Chevalier Pessac-Léognan (Grand Cru Classé de Graves) 2007
Château Lynch-Moussas Pauillac (Grand Cru Classé) 2010
wine_description: Deep dark ruby red color. Complex and elegant nose dominated by fresh red fruit. Rich texture on the palate which shows a solid tannic backbone with plenty of woody and toasted notes. Its long and striking finish promises a superb longevity.

name: Château Pape Clément Pessac-Léognan (Grand Cru Classé de Graves) 2011
Château le Puy Emilien 2016
wine_description: This wine has red colour of black cherries. Powerful nose of freshly smashed red berries. Intense and rich in the mouth, harmonious final. Well-balanced and supple.

name: E. Guigal Châteauneuf-du-Pape 2013
wine_description: Deep dark red in colour. On the nose spices and mature red fruits. On the palate round tannins with powerful complexity. A rich unctuous wine with notes of mature plums, hazelnuts and red fruits. Very rich wine full of harmony and balance.

name: Château Troplong Mondot Saint-Émilion Grand Cru (Premier Grand Cru Classé) 2011
wine_name: Saint-Émilion Grand Cru (Premier Grand Cru Classé)

name: Château Carbonnieux Pessac-Léognan 2014
wine_description: Medium red color. Aromas of blackcurrant, leaves, bush and earth. On the palate it has notes of fresh blackcurrant, bush and green pepper first, more dried leaves on the midpalate where tobacco and cigar box come along. Scorched earth on the finish.

name: Marchesi di Barolo Cannubi Barolo 2011
wine_description: Garnet-red in color with ruby reflections. Intense perfume with clean scent of roses, vanilla,  licorice, spices and toasted oak. Gentle notes of absinth. The flavor is full and elegant, good-bodied and austere with recurring olfactory sensations. The spicy note and the hints of  wood blend perfectly.

name: Château Citran Haut-Médoc 2014
wine_description: It has beautiful intense black color with violet highlights.  Expressive, releasing aromas of ripe black fruit with light notes of roasting. Good attack with volume, very present black fruits, beautiful structure, well balanced tannins and harmony, rich mid-palate, long finish with silky tannins and leave its full potential aromatic.

name: Château Fombrauge Saint-Émilion Grand Cru (Grand Cru Classé) 2015
wine_description: Color is ruby ​​red, brilliant, clear. The nose is rather expressive, of average complexity. The first fruits are blackcurrant and cherry.  Friandy, rather supple, not very voluminous, the mouth is characterized by its balance: an acidity and a quasi absence of tannins favor the impression of roundness. Beautiful finish, elegant, fresh.

name: Château Prieuré-Lichine Margaux (Grand Cru Classé) 2012
wine_description: A glossy crimson-black hue, with the aromas of blackberry. A soft creamed-fruit substance on the palate, with lots of ripe, supple, velvety tannins and a good core of acidity. Rich, substantial, with a firm grippy finish.

name: Castello Nipozzano Vecchie Viti Chianti Rùfina Riserva 2015
wine_description: Ruby-red colour, luminous and brilliant.  The nose opens with very ripe fruits: cherry, strawberry and raspberry are prominent.  Sweet scents of cotton candy and wild rose and notes of walnut and walnut husks.  Spicy notes follow such as cloves, star anise; the finish is minerally.  The palate is persistent and fresh, very smooth.

name: Bodega Elias Mora Toro Crianza 2015
wine_description:
Colour: Intense black cherry.
Nose: Highly scented with notes of oak, black cherry, blackcurrant and graphite which are accentuated on the palate.
Palate: Very fleshy, evokes fruit confiture, liquorice, mineral and toffee.

name: Château Gruaud Larose Saint-Julien (Grand Cru Classé) 1995
Château Cantemerle Les Allées de Cantemerle Haut-Médoc 2010
wine_description:
This wine’s black cherry and deep garnet color is typical of Bordeaux. Its expressive aromas open up to show very fruity, raspberry notes. In the
mouth the wine is immediately accessible,
notable for its charm and floral character.

name: Château Gruaud Larose Saint-Julien (Grand Cru Classé) 2010
Château Montrose La Dame de Montrose Saint-Estèphe 2012
wine_description: It has a silky robe with a beautiful cherry red colour. The nose is very expressive and concentrated, slightly sweet and woody, with a mixture of red fruit aromas, raspberry, and morello cherry. The palate is powerful and racy, combining suppleness and tight tannins. Beautiful length in the mouth, with tannins less evident in the after-taste.

name: Château Palmer Alter Ego Margaux 2014
wine_description: Alter Ego is a spontaneous uninhibited wine, soft and round as soon as it has finished barrel ageing. Its lush aromas and supple tannins make it a wine that can be appreciated in the first years after bottling. Finesse and elegance, aromatic richness, harmony and length.

name: Château Carbonnieux Pessac-Léognan Blanc (Grand Cru Classé de Graves) 2012
wine_name: Pessac-Léognan Blanc (Grand Cru Classé de Graves)

name: Ogier Clos de l'Oratoire des Papes Châteauneuf-du-Pape 2017
wine_name: Clos de l'Oratoire des Papes Châteauneuf-du-Pape

name: Odfjell Capítulo Flying Fish 2016
wine_description: This alluring wine displays intense aromas of raspberries, dry plums and figs with hints of spicy notes. Juicy with round tannins, a touch of coffee and chocolate and a long finish.

name: Jean-Marc Brocard Chablis Sainte Claire Vieilles Vignes 2018
wine_description: Dress bright green gold. A balanced and persistent wine, with notes of dried fruit and chestnuts. In the mouth, wrapped mineral, fine and powerful

name: Château Gruaud Larose Sarget de Gruaud-Larose Saint-Julien 2008
wine_description: Lovely deep ruby appearance with purple hints. The nose shows aromas of red fruits, fresh cherry, raspberry, light spices. Lots of freshness in the mouth. Fine balance with a great finish.

name: Cheval des Andes Mendoza 2015
wine_description: Deep, almost black core, with bright violet highlights in colour. It opens with notes of fresh red berries, combined with blackcurrant and redcurrants, followed by roses and violets. It is completed by hints of Asian spices such as fresh ginger, nutmeg and cinnamon. Supplementary traces of licorice and plums.

name: Delas Saint-Esprit Côtes-du-Rhône 2018
wine_description: The dress, deep with purple tints. The nose of Syrah varietal aromas predominantly red fruits, violet, licorice palate, its roundness, its scope and finesse make it a unique product in its class.

name: Château Kirwan Margaux (Grand Cru Classé) 2010
wine_description: Moderately saturated ruby. Out of a decanter, fairly forward blackberry and floral nose, but the body is light and the wine shows little until some really grippy tannins and acidity appear and bring the wine to a screeching halt. A highly structured Margaux.

name: Tenuta Castiglioni Toscana 2013
wine_description: A ruby red with dark, purplish highlights precedes a nose exceptional for its depth and breadth, offering a strikingly rich and diverse mosaic of aromas. A complex of black cherry, blackberry, and blackcurrant finds a beautiful foil in spicier notes of roasted coffee beans, bitter chocolate, tobacco leaf, and essence of vanilla.

name: Penfolds Bin 8 Cabernet - Shiraz 2016
wine_description: There is a dense core of black cherry, dark chocolate and black cherry liqueur. Across the palate, splashes of chocolate and mint combine with hints of rosemary and warmed spice. Some cherry, toasty notes are evident from the balanced, integrated oak. This wine has great balance with great integration between good fruit and oak.

name: Château Fombrauge Saint-Émilion Grand Cru (Grand Cru Classé) 2016
wine_description: Color is ruby ​​red, brilliant, clear. The nose is rather expressive, of average complexity. The first fruits are blackcurrant and cherry.  Friandy, rather supple, not very voluminous, the mouth is characterized by its balance: an acidity and a quasi absence of tannins favor the impression of roundness. Beautiful finish, elegant, fresh.

name: Terrazas de los Andes Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon 2014
wine_description: Elegant deep red with black highlights in the glass, this wine oozes intense fruit notes such as blackberry, cherry & plum with sweet spivy hints. The aromas are excellently combined with bitter chocolate & smooth toasted notes, coming from barrel ageing.Intense and well balanced, the tannins are delicate, smooth & well-rounded. A long & elegant final with a great concentration of fruits

name: Château Léoville Barton Saint-Julien (Grand Cru Classé) 1998
wine_description: This wine has an opaque dark red violet colour. With lovely herbal, lavender and blackberry notes on the nose. Tart berry, blackberry, black fruit palate with depth and sweet tannins.

name: Cloudy Bay Chardonnay 2013
wine_description: An irresistible mix of ripe citrus and toasted nut aromas reminiscent of grapefruit, fig and pistachio biscotti taken with chamomile tea. The palate leads with savoury notes which give way to a taut citrus core, revealing the vibrant Marlborough fruit.

name: Château Grand-Puy-Lacoste Pauillac (Grand Cru Classé) 2009
wine_description: Exhibits classic Pauillac aromas and flavors of creme de cassis along with stony/floral notes.

name: Château Léoville Las Cases Saint-Julien (Grand Cru Classé) 2004
Château Pape Clément Pessac-Léognan (Grand Cru Classé de Graves) 2014
Château Malartic-Lagravière Pessac-Léognan (Grand Cru Classé de Graves) 2012
wine_description: This wine has an purple colour accompanied by an unctuous texture, extraordinary elegance, lots of licorice, graphite, blueberry, black raspberry and cherry characteristics. It has a full body, terrific purity and length and good acidity.

name: Penfolds Bin 28 Kalimna Shiraz 2017
wine_description: The nose is complex and beguiling, with notes of demi-glace and roasting pan juices, beneath scents of pipe tobacco, vanilla and pencil shavings oak - much more than just a simple varietal offering. The palate is full-bodied, refined and taut showing dark, black conserve fruit flavours.Liqueur chocolate and spice flavours are impregnated by overt, chewy and ripe tannins.

name: Château Cantemerle Haut-Médoc (Grand Cru Classé) 2014
wine_description: Attractive aromas of pepper and licorice, evolving towards red fruit after agitation. The palate shows a harmonious marriage of charm and firmness based on soft, ripe, and very smooth tannins.

name: Marchesi di Barolo Cannubi Barolo 2012
wine_description: Garnet-red in color with ruby reflections. Intense perfume with clean scent of roses, vanilla,  licorice, spices and toasted oak. Gentle notes of absinth. The flavor is full and elegant, good-bodied and austere with recurring olfactory sensations. The spicy note and the hints of  wood blend perfectly.

name: Château Malescot St. Exupery Margaux (Grand Cru Classé) 2010
wine_description: Notes of graphite, black currant liqueur, incense and camphor make for a complex and intensely penetrating set of aromatics. Dark ruby/purple, medium to full-bodied, with superb concentration and moderate tannin, this wine is a beauty of finesse and substance.

name: Château Margaux Pavillon Rouge du Château Margaux 2004
La Braccesca Achelo Rosso 2016
wine_description: The wine is bright red with the typical purply hues of the grape variety. A fresh, elegant wine with strong mineral hints and fruity sensations of red berries and white plums. Sweet, vibrant tannins.

name: Château Léoville Barton Saint-Julien (Grand Cru Classé) 2002
