wine_description: Potent, mineral-accented dark berry and violet scents, with suggestions of woodsmoke and spicecake emerging slowly. The sweet and penetrating palate offers juicy blueberry and cherry pie flavors, along with an enlivening, zesty acidity. Rich yet stylistically vibrant.

name: Château Malartic-Lagravière Pessac-Léognan (Grand Cru Classé de Graves) 2014
wine_description: This wine has an purple colour accompanied by an unctuous texture, extraordinary elegance, lots of licorice, graphite, blueberry, black raspberry and cherry characteristics. It has a full body, terrific purity and length and good acidity.

name: Orma Toscana 2014
wine_description: Purplish red with hints of violet, then a rich bouquet of intense berry fruit and spice with hints of tobacco. Soft and velvety in the mouth with spice and fully-ripe, sweet fruit

name: Château Gruaud Larose Saint-Julien (Grand Cru Classé) 1999
Château d'Aiguilhe Castillon - Côtes de Bordeaux 2015
wine_description: This powerful wine reflects its terroir with intensity and panache. Vigorous and fruity, it is a favourite of people who love wines of character.

name: Mas Doix Les Crestes Priorat 2016
wine_description: Potent, mineral-accented dark berry and violet scents, with suggestions of woodsmoke and spicecake emerging slowly. The sweet and penetrating palate offers juicy blueberry and cherry pie flavors, along with an enlivening, zesty acidity. Rich yet stylistically vibrant.

name: Château Cantenac Brown BriO de Cantenac Brown Margaux 2014
wine_description: This wine shows ripe fruit with a good depth and a hint of chocolate. Silky tannins and a firm, rich finish.

name: Domaine A. et P. de Villaine Bouzeron 2015
wine_description: Straw Yellow. Medium Intensity, developing, citrus fruits, floral, herbaceous. 	Medium Bodied, dry, medium acidity, moderate intensity, medium-long finish, lemon, green apple, mineral.

name: Château Lynch-Moussas Pauillac (Grand Cru Classé) 2007
wine_description: Deep dark ruby red color. Complex and elegant nose dominated by fresh red fruit. Rich texture on the palate which shows a solid tannic backbone with plenty of woody and toasted notes. Its long and striking finish promises a superb longevity.

name: Domaine de Beaurenard Châteauneuf-du-Pape 2016
wine_description: We make highly concentrated wines of great finesse, elegance and minerality. This is the true signature and pedigree of the local soils, which makes Beaurenard wines suited to lengthy ageing. They can also be drunk young, to procure an intense, lush pleasure.

name: Numanthia Termanthia 2011
wine_description: This wine is deep, brillant purple. An extremely complex and elegant wine. Rich and multifarious, the nose is a sophisticated palette of aromas. Fresh raspberries, blackberries, black currants and other berry fruits enhance floral notes of violets and rose petals. Also present are hints of black pepper and toasted almonds that evolve into sweet spices such as cardamom and vanilla. Notes of truffles and a delicate minerality showcase the Toro terroir. On the palate, the wine is elegant and velvety, where firm and silky tannins are perfectly balanced giving a grand structure and weight. There is a progressive explosion of delicate, concentrated aromas, a profound evolution where everything enjoyed on the nose come forward again. Red and black berries, cacao and floral notes fill the mouth, leading to a lingering, complex finish with hints of spice, minerals and toasted notes.

name: Château La Pointe Pomerol 2009
wine_description: The colour is dense, with dark purple tints. Aromas of violet and small forest fruit gently appear. They are followed by cedar, black spices and sandalwood. The palate is smooth and creamy, yet not at all heavy ; beautifully fresh and well-balanced. The length is impressive, caressing and voluptuous with an inviting, mouth-watering finish.

name: E. Guigal Châteauneuf-du-Pape 2011
wine_description: Deep dark red in colour. On the nose spices and mature red fruits. On the palate round tannins with powerful complexity. A rich unctuous wine with notes of mature plums, hazelnuts and red fruits. Very rich wine full of harmony and balance.

name: Château Léoville Las Cases Saint-Julien (Grand Cru Classé) 2006
Château La Tour de Mons Margaux 2015
wine_description: With an intense colour, the wine displays a very broad aromatic range. Elegant and distinguished, this enticing wine has a fantastic potential for ageing.

name: Château Ormes de Pez Saint-Estèphe 2006
wine_description: Dark red violet in colour. On the nose ripe currant, red berry and herbal notes. A tasty, herbaceous, berry and cassis palate with a medium finish.

name: Château Latour-Martillac Pessac-Léognan (Grand Cru Classé de Graves) 2013
Château Greysac Médoc 2010
wine_description: An attractive bouquet: lightly roasted wood spice and nicely concentrated blackcurrant fruit. A very good wine, straightforward, well-priced for a Bordeaux Medoc.

name: Cordero di Montezemolo Nebbiolo Langhe 2016
wine_description: Bright violet of medium intensity; aromas of raspberry, strawberry and violet. Fresh and robust, full flavor and soft tannins.

name: Domaine Jean-Louis Chave Saint-Joseph Selection Offerus 2014
Stag's Leap Wine Cellars FAY Cabernet Sauvignon 2015
wine_description: A fragrant nose of ripe blackberry and raspberry along with notes of sweet fig, cinnamon and violet. The palate is elegant with silky tannins and a core of rich fruit with a hint of crème brulee. The wine finishes with a lingering berry pie character.

name: Château Marquis de Terme Margaux (Grand Cru Classé) 2009
wine_description: Deep ruby ​​red in color with orange reflections, with a characteristic of small wild berries, including cassis and blueberry, with slightly smoky notes of frankincense and spicy tones of black pepper and cloves. Incredibly expressive on the palate, in a perfect blend of fruit freshness and woody notes,leading to a masterful tannins. An accessible style that confirms the long sweet spices final.

name: Château Mongravey Margaux 2012
wine_description: Lightly firm dusting of cocoa, offering crushed plum and fig fruit flavors, with a perfumy espresso edge chiming in on the medium-weight finish. Ripe spicy fruit aromas. Very pure, ripe fruit flavours. Succulent, spicy, well made.

name: Château Gruaud Larose Saint-Julien (Grand Cru Classé) 1996
E. Guigal Château d'Ampuis Côte-Rôtie 2015
wine_description: Deep dark colour with mauve tints. On the nose spices, black fruits and delicate oak aromas. A dense, expressive and intense nose with aromas of prunes, blackberry and vanilla. A tannic and racy wine on the palate.

name: Domaine de Chevalier Pessac-Léognan (Grand Cru Classé de Graves) 2000
Château du Tertre Margaux (Grand Cru Classé) 2000
wine_description: Great sweetness and flavour. Silky and freshness are combined in this flask to bring you the elegance expected of a great Margaux wine.

name: Château de Camensac Haut-Médoc (Grand Cru Classé) 2014
Château Cantemerle Haut-Médoc (Grand Cru Classé) 2004
wine_description: Attractive aromas of pepper and licorice, evolving towards red fruit after agitation. The palate shows a harmonious marriage of charm and firmness based on soft, ripe, and very smooth tannins.

name: Domaine de Chevalier Pessac-Léognan (Grand Cru Classé de Graves) 2013
Château Teyssier Saint-Émilion Grand Cru 2013
wine_description: These communes provide terroir that produce a wine that may be attacked on release or laid down for a few years. The approach in winemaking, which has all the benefits of the modern equipment afforded by the more senior wines, is new world in style.

name: Château La Fleur de Boüard Lalande-de-Pomerol 2010
wine_description: Cassis, earth and graphite notes were mixed with mocha and toast on the nose. Very deep though, and quite lovely. Palate was rich, with tons of cassis, along with more graphite, some herbs and a toss of earth, all nicely balanced. Decent length, nice flavours of cassis, green pepper and some smoky coffee ground.

name: Famille Perrin Vinsobres Les Cornuds 2016
wine_description: Purple, very deep with purple highlights. Intense aromas of violet, black fruit and spice, black pepper and licorice. Round mouth and full of finesse, with elegant tannins.

name: Fèlsina Berardenga Chianti Classico Riserva 2013
wine_description: Deep, attractive ruby red colour. Elegantly fruity nose, with marked scents of wild red berries foregrounding nuances of mixed spices. The palate, too, shows excellent fruit supported by judicious tannins. Lengthy finish.

name: Domaine de Beaurenard Châteauneuf-du-Pape 2015
wine_description: We make highly concentrated wines of great finesse, elegance and minerality. This is the true signature and pedigree of the local soils, which makes Beaurenard wines suited to lengthy ageing. They can also be drunk young, to procure an intense, lush pleasure.

name: Castello Nipozzano Mormoreto Toscana 2015
wine_description: Purple-flecked deep ruby. Rich, ripe fruit contributes to a complex aromatic mosaic, in which blueberry, blackcurrant, dried plum, raspberry, dates, and wild berry jam are discernible, enriched by spicy nuances of green pepper, ginger, and vanilla which act as an effective foil to impressions of cocoa butter, chlorophyll, and tobacco leaf.

name: Château Palmer Alter Ego Margaux 2015
wine_description: Alter Ego is a spontaneous uninhibited wine, soft and round as soon as it has finished barrel ageing. Its lush aromas and supple tannins make it a wine that can be appreciated in the first years after bottling. Finesse and elegance, aromatic richness, harmony and length.

name: Quintarelli Giuseppe Amarone della Valpolicella Classico 2009
Château Le Crock Saint-Estèphe 2012
wine_description: This is a rich and powerful wine, with a great aromatic complexity. It presents powerful tannins, a  rich bouquet underlined by a fleshy, full structure that will gain in finesse as the years go by, giving a complex and elegant wine.

name: Numanthia Termanthia 2012
wine_description: This wine is deep, brillant purple. An extremely complex and elegant wine. Rich and multifarious, the nose is a sophisticated palette of aromas. Fresh raspberries, blackberries, black currants and other berry fruits enhance floral notes of violets and rose petals. Also present are hints of black pepper and toasted almonds that evolve into sweet spices such as cardamom and vanilla. Notes of truffles and a delicate minerality showcase the Toro terroir. On the palate, the wine is elegant and velvety, where firm and silky tannins are perfectly balanced giving a grand structure and weight. There is a progressive explosion of delicate, concentrated aromas, a profound evolution where everything enjoyed on the nose come forward again. Red and black berries, cacao and floral notes fill the mouth, leading to a lingering, complex finish with hints of spice, minerals and toasted notes.

name: Château Clerc Milon Pauillac (Grand Cru Classé) 2007
wine_description: The nose reveals finely toasted spice and tobacco notes combined with more intense aromas of red fruit and cherry stone with a mineral touch. The palate is full and well-defined, dominated by the lustre of succulent fruit and refined, flavoursome tannins that open on a hint of chocolate. The long, warm-hearted finish is lifted by a slightly saline taste.

name: Rocca di Frassinello Maremma Toscana Ornello 2015
wine_description:
Deep ruby ​​red .
On the nose with balsamic and coffee
toasted . On the palate there are notes of underbrush and a
tannins soft and velvety .

name: Famille Perrin Vinsobres Les Cornuds 2011
wine_description: Purple, very deep with purple highlights. Intense aromas of violet, black fruit and spice, black pepper and licorice. Round mouth and full of finesse, with elegant tannins.

name: Château Olivier Pessac-Léognan (Grand Cru Classé) 2009
wine_description: he nose is very expressive, with ripe red fruit aromas as well as spicy nuances. The middle palate is velvety and full-bodied with rich, smooth tannin. This is a wine of substance, with a great balance between ripe aromatics, finesse, elegance… and a long aftertaste.

name: Château La Fleur de Boüard Lalande-de-Pomerol 2011
wine_description: Cassis, earth and graphite notes were mixed with mocha and toast on the nose. Very deep though, and quite lovely. Palate was rich, with tons of cassis, along with more graphite, some herbs and a toss of earth, all nicely balanced. Decent length, nice flavours of cassis, green pepper and some smoky coffee ground.

name: Château Clerc Milon Pauillac (Grand Cru Classé) 2004
wine_description: The nose reveals finely toasted spice and tobacco notes combined with more intense aromas of red fruit and cherry stone with a mineral touch. The palate is full and well-defined, dominated by the lustre of succulent fruit and refined, flavoursome tannins that open on a hint of chocolate. The long, warm-hearted finish is lifted by a slightly saline taste.

name: Château Cantenac Brown BriO de Cantenac Brown Margaux 2012
wine_description: This wine shows ripe fruit with a good depth and a hint of chocolate. Silky tannins and a firm, rich finish.

name: Domaine Lafage Bastide Miraflors Vieilles Vignes Syrah - Grenache 2017
wine_name: Bastide Miraflors Vieilles Vignes Syrah - Grenache

name: Château La Lagune Haut-Médoc (Grand Cru Classé) 2006
Joseph Drouhin Laforet Bourgogne Chardonnay 2015
wine_description: The colour is golden yellow, with a greenish glint. The aromas are reminiscent of fresh grape and green almond. Elegant texture.

name: Château Beauregard Pomerol 2010
wine_description: This wine has a deep purple hue and already reveals intense and complex aromas of black fruit, such as blackcurrant, blackberry and morello cherry, mingling harmoniously with notes of violets, sweet spices, eucalyptus, forest floor and already very well integrated oak. The entry on the palate is silky and deliciously flavoursome thanks to round, stylish and perfectly ripe tannins.

name: Régnard Grand Régnard Chablis 2018
wine_description: Bright, pale-straw accented with green reflections. On the nose it is elegant and fresh with notes of green apples, lemon and apricot,it has a notable intense aroma. On the palate it is rich, rounded and mellow. There are ample ripe lemony fruit and white peach flavours.

name: Château Gruaud Larose Saint-Julien (Grand Cru Classé) 2002
Château Gruaud Larose Sarget de Gruaud-Larose Saint-Julien 2010
wine_description: Lovely deep ruby appearance with purple hints. The nose shows aromas of red fruits, fresh cherry, raspberry, light spices. Lots of freshness in the mouth. Fine balance with a great finish.

name: Fattoria le Pupille Saffredi 2014
wine_description: Impenetrable ruby red, a beautiful density in the glass. The scents go from red fruits, red currant, blackberries and spices such as cloves, cinnamon and chocolate. In the palate the wine is well-rounded and velvety, engaging all senses with majestic balance. The long persistence allows to fully enjoy the aromatic complexity, in which the spiciness is prevalent.

name: Proyecto Garnachas de España La Garnacha Salvaje del Moncayo 2017
wine_description: It is a bright burgundy wine with medium-depth. While featuring tobacco and wild berry aromas, its freshness and mineral qualities mix resulting in a surprising wine that due to its roundness and youth.

name: Jean-Marc Brocard Chablis Sainte Claire Vieilles Vignes 2017
wine_description: Dress bright green gold. A balanced and persistent wine, with notes of dried fruit and chestnuts. In the mouth, wrapped mineral, fine and powerful

name: Château Malescasse Haut-Médoc 2010
wine_description: Ruby red in colour and it offers an intense nose of blackcurrant, blackberry and raspberry, with great maturity. Subtle undertones of roasted mocha give this wine great elegance and added complexity. The palate has a perfect balance of alcohol and acidity. An intense attack builds over a tight, silky tannic structure leading to a long, dense, aromatic finish.

name: Château Cos Labory Saint-Estèphe (Grand Cru Classé) 2010
Pépière Muscadet-Sèvre et Maine Sur Lie 2018
Torres Mas La Plana Cabernet Sauvignon 2015
Château Brane-Cantenac Baron de Brane Margaux 2009
Col d'Orcia Brunello di Montalcino 2015
wine_description: This wine has shows a ruby colour with violet hues. It is an highly structured wine, full and persistent. The ripe soft tannins are perfectly balanced with the acidity, long pleasant and sapid aftertaste.

name: Château Grand-Puy-Lacoste Pauillac (Grand Cru Classé) 2010
wine_description: Exhibits classic Pauillac aromas and flavors of creme de cassis along with stony/floral notes.

name: Fattoria le Pupille Saffredi 2015
wine_description: Impenetrable ruby red, a beautiful density in the glass. The scents go from red fruits, red currant, blackberries and spices such as cloves, cinnamon and chocolate. In the palate the wine is well-rounded and velvety, engaging all senses with majestic balance. The long persistence allows to fully enjoy the aromatic complexity, in which the spiciness is prevalent.

name: Château Haut-Batailley Pauillac (Grand Cru Classé) 2012
wine_description: Bright ruby color and intense nose of blackberry, cassis, cedar and fresh tobacco. Fine and dense with a beautiful refined personality.

name: Château Langoa Barton Saint-Julien (Grand Cru Classé) 2009
wine_description: Blackberry, floral and dark chocolate follow through to a medium body, with fine tannins and a fresh finish. With notes of earth and black currant fruit submerged beneath a tannic structure.

name: Clos des Papes (Paul Avril) Châteauneuf-du-Pape 2014
wine_description: With a rich, deep color, the perfume exhibits pepper, black raspberry jam, grenadine, garrigue, licorice and raspberry liqueur. The opulent, silky textured fruit coats your mouth and palate, ending in a long, peppery, sweet, pure, red cherry liqueur finish.

name: Château La Tour Carnet Haut-Médoc (Grand Cru Classé) 2006
wine_description: Color is deep garnet color with mahogany reflections slightly tuilés.  The nose is complex, we recognize in this order, blackcurrant, plum. Secondly, it is the spices that are expressed as cinnamon. Roasting the notes then appear in the form of wood burned. The mouth: Franche, mouth lets perceive immediately the incredible delicacy of tannins, coated, perfectly balanced. On the palate, ripe fruit and roasting.

name: Château La Fleur de Boüard Lalande-de-Pomerol 2012
wine_description: Cassis, earth and graphite notes were mixed with mocha and toast on the nose. Very deep though, and quite lovely. Palate was rich, with tons of cassis, along with more graphite, some herbs and a toss of earth, all nicely balanced. Decent length, nice flavours of cassis, green pepper and some smoky coffee ground.

name: Clos Floridène Graves 2015
wine_description: Clos Floridène Rouge is strongly marked by an unusual association in Bordeaux, With a bright and intense color, it has black-currant and wild strawberry aromas, with hints of mint, liquorice and smokiness. The fruit and tannin are powerful, silky and fresh.

name: Château La Dominique Saint-Émilion Grand Cru (Grand Cru Classé) 2008
wine_description: Deep and shiny colour with an intense, characterized nose by seducing aromas of ripe fruits and subtle spicy notes. In most vintages, you will find truffle and licorice notes, complemented by peppery and woody aromas. Fleshy and round, with silky and precise tannins. The finish is long and full and leaves you with a pleasant feeling of bliss.

name: Muga Reserva 2016
wine_description: It has a fresh mouth-feel, almost giving the impression of having mentholated nuances, with a presence of acidic fruit liqueur. It can seem quite a strange combination. In the retronasal phase it is totally spicy and leaves new hints of liqueur fruit at a second level, but this time much more complex in character.

name: Château La Louvière Pessac-Léognan 2011
wine_description: Beautiful, very deep and concentrated red colour.Intense and beautifully complex bouquet with hints of spice and very ripe red fruit. In keeping with the bouquet, the wine is beautifully balanced on the palate. The oak is well-integrated with there are overtones of liquorice and red fruit.

name: Château Lanessan Haut-Médoc 2011
wine_description: Deeply colored and flavored, fuller than most Haut Medocs. Spice, anise, tar, black-currant and plum flavors lend it complexity and character.

name: Château Rauzan-Ségla Margaux (Grand Cru Classé) 2000
wine_description: Candied confectionary nose along with some Margaux perfume and flowers. Palate is nicely fresh. Sweet and modern, with rich berry flavours, balanced and nicely proportioned until the finish.

name: Cordero di Montezemolo Barolo Monfalletto 2014
wine_description: Intense garnet in color, the nose shows floral and spicy notes perfectly blended: tobacco, cherries, cocoa and fresh raspberry highlights. The palate is rich, full-bodied and elegant.

name: Marchesi di Barolo Barbaresco 2015
wine_description: Garnet red with ruby reflections. Less intense with hints of fruit, dog rose and spices. Full flavor, elegant, full bodied, reminiscent of the smells.

name: Château Meyney Saint-Estèphe 2012
wine_description: Shows notes of leather and musk after a period of time. It is full-bodied, well-rounded and structured. After ageing, the wine displays the remarkable charm of the best Saint-Estèphe: complexity, balance and harmony.

name: Cos d'Estournel Cos d'Estournel 1988
wine_description: The call of faraway lands. As mysterious and intriguing as a lone adventurer returning from a solitary sail, Cos d’Estournel is slow to reveal itself. Little by little, it evokes stories of distant places, market stalls brimming with unfamiliar fruits, spices and wares, village festivities warmed by the joy of revelers and the setting sun, and sumptuous visions of ladies and their voluptuous curves. A myriad of scents, colors and tastes appeals to the senses. The Grand Vin of Cos d’Estournel is both demure and deliberately sensuous, a fascinating and elegant nectar.

name: Henri Bourgeois Sancerre La Bourgeoise Blanc 2015
wine_description:
It offer a strong character with aromatic notes as various as its personality is singular.
well balanced, and very reminiscent of the flower and grape. The richness and intensity of the flavor linger long and harmoniously on the palate.

name: Château Meyney Saint-Estèphe 2014
wine_description: Shows notes of leather and musk after a period of time. It is full-bodied, well-rounded and structured. After ageing, the wine displays the remarkable charm of the best Saint-Estèphe: complexity, balance and harmony.

name: E. Guigal Saint-Joseph 2015
wine_description:
Visual : Dark red with violet highlights.
Odor : Powerful nose with dominant red fruit and delicate oak aromas.
Palate : The palate is fresh and fruity. The rather round and supple tannins.

name: Two Hands Bella's Garden Shiraz 2015
wine_description: Deep dark red. Black core with red meniscus. Bursts out of the glass almost in a brooding, elegant manner. Juicy red and black fruits with notes of five spice, earth, black pepper and sandalwood. Fresh juicy fruits erupt and roll across the palate as only a great Barossa Shiraz can. Lovely tactile nature with grippy fine grained tannins.

name: Château Cantenac Brown Margaux (Grand Cru Classé) 2011
E. Guigal Crozes-Hermitage Blanc 2016
wine_description: Golden yellow colour. Aromas of white flowers such as hawthorn blossom and acacia. Delicate oak. Fine and elegant on the palate with a full, round and rich body. Overall a remarkable freshness with all the finesse and richness of the appellation.

name: Avignonesi Rosso di Montepulciano 2016
wine_description: This pure Sangiovese has a medium ruby red colour and is characterized by typical varietal aromas, such as wild cherries and red currant, underlined by a light, balsamic touch. The flavour is round and distinct, with a long, delicately spicy finish.

name: Penfolds RWT Shiraz 2012
wine_description: Deep, dark magenta. On the nose, dark spices and saturated fresh regional Shiraz fruits with telltale wafts of blueberry, blackberry, liquorice and black olive. Secondary notes of rosemary, peppercorn, thyme, juices of beef - verging on that of a terrine/corned beef. Subtle cedary French oak in the background.

name: Château Giscours Le Haut-Médoc de Giscours (Grande Reserve) Haut-Médoc 2014
wine_name: Le Haut-Médoc de Giscours (Grande Reserve) Haut-Médoc

name: Château Rauzan-Gassies Margaux 2010
wine_description: Light crimson in colour. Precise nose of ripe red fruit with a touch of leather and brown sugar. Fine tannins, light to medium bodied with decent length. A very pure, balanced and pleasant wine.

name: Gérard Bertrand Réserve Spéciale Syrah 2016
wine_description: This wine displays aromas of pepper, mild spices, truffles, fruit such as cassis and blackberry, and violets.

name: Château Grand-Puy-Lacoste Pauillac (Grand Cru Classé) 1996
wine_description: Exhibits classic Pauillac aromas and flavors of creme de cassis along with stony/floral notes.

name: La Rioja Alta Viña Arana Gran Reserva 2012
Cos d'Estournel Cos d'Estournel 2011
wine_description: The call of faraway lands. As mysterious and intriguing as a lone adventurer returning from a solitary sail, Cos d’Estournel is slow to reveal itself. Little by little, it evokes stories of distant places, market stalls brimming with unfamiliar fruits, spices and wares, village festivities warmed by the joy of revelers and the setting sun, and sumptuous visions of ladies and their voluptuous curves. A myriad of scents, colors and tastes appeals to the senses. The Grand Vin of Cos d’Estournel is both demure and deliberately sensuous, a fascinating and elegant nectar.

name: Beaulieu Vineyard (BV) Tapestry Reserve Red Blend 2015
wine_description: Jeffrey, the winemaker,  chose Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc for the wine’s core of briary blackberry and cassis expression and its firm tannin structure. He then added Merlot for plush mid-palate texture and a hint of cherry. Petit Verdot and Malbec complete the blend with nuances of ripe plum, rose, forest loam and graphite.

name: Château La Louvière Pessac-Léognan 2014
wine_description: Beautiful, very deep and concentrated red colour.Intense and beautifully complex bouquet with hints of spice and very ripe red fruit. In keeping with the bouquet, the wine is beautifully balanced on the palate. The oak is well-integrated with there are overtones of liquorice and red fruit.

name: Clos de los Siete Clos de Los Siete (by Michel Rolland) 2017
wine_name: Clos de Los Siete (by Michel Rolland)
wine_description: On the nose, C7’s intense and complex aromatic expression delivers subtle notes of fruit and spice. On the palate, the delicate tannins are ripe and silky, and combine with appealing freshness. Well-balanced in structure, full-bodied and offering typical freshness, the wine showcases the charming, elegant style.

name: La Braccesca Achelo Rosso 2014
wine_description: The wine is bright red with the typical purply hues of the grape variety. A fresh, elegant wine with strong mineral hints and fruity sensations of red berries and white plums. Sweet, vibrant tannins.

name: Château Sénéjac Haut-Médoc 2011
wine_description: Very deep colour with an expressive nose of black fruits and spices. It is powerful and intense, while remaining smooth, thanks to the finesse of its tannins. A charming and distinguished wine that can be drunk young, when its fruity aromas are most enjoyable, or, even better, after ageing to discover the elegance and the richness of its terroir.

name: Yves Cuilleron Syrah Les Vignes d'à Côté 2018
wine_description: Wine of pleasure and indulgence. Expressive nose of fresh red fruit. Soft and fruity, Final acidulé.harcuterie, barbecue, beef skewers with green tapenade, chicken kebab with prunes.

name: Château Latour Pauillac de Latour 2008
wine_description: This wine is very fruity and refined with blackberry and fine tannins. Medium to full body with a  clean finish.

name: Château La Mission Haut-Brion La Chapelle de La Mission Haut-Brion Pessac-Léognan 2009
wine_name: La Chapelle de La Mission Haut-Brion Pessac-Léognan
wine_description: This wine has a dense purple colour with meaty notes of camphor, black currant, sweet cherry and blackberry. It has a lush, opulent texture, and an admirable purity and length.

name: Mouton Cadet Réserve Médoc 2016
wine_description:
Reserve Mouton Cadet Medoc combines power, structure and length on the palate. It testifies to artful blending in a subtle balance of rich flavours and well-rounded tannins. A deep and dark colour with a violet tint, the wine has a nose highly typical of its origins that reveals lovely mineral notes enfolded in fruity, blackberry and liquorice aromas accompanied by the vanilla touches of discreet and well-integrated oak.

Rich and powerful on the palate, its structure of dense, tightly-knit but perfectly rounded tannins bears the imprint of ripe Cabernet Sauvignon. Blackcurrant, jammy fruit and mocha flavours are balanced by elegant, delicately toasted oak to give an expressive, generous and expansive whole.

The long, richly flavoured and opulent finish makes this wine a perfect ambassador for its appellation in a very fine vintage.

name: Château Nénin Fugue de Nénin Pomerol 2011
wine_description: This vintage has a garnet color, intense nose of very pretty red fruit flavors and a sweet mouth in attack, roundness, without harshness, with lovely fruit.

name: Château de Camensac Haut-Médoc (Grand Cru Classé) 2006
La Braccesca Sabazio 2015
wine_description: The wine has good ruby red colour and a fresh vibrant aroma of ripe red berry fruit. The flavour is well-structured and very pleasant with nice minerally sensations and soft, stylish tannins.

name: Château Siran Margaux 2014
wine_description: Produced from soils made up of a deep layer of gravel, the wines of Siran are typical of the great Margaux growths. Both powerful and delicate, they express the perfect balance between tannin, fruit and acidity. They are long-ageing wines, which over time develop sweetness on the palate, giving a characteristic silky and velvety mouth-feel.

name: Château Pontet-Canet Pauillac (Grand Cru Classé) 2013
wine_description: Very intense colour. Very intense nose, marked by notes of cherry, blackberry and redcurrant with traces of vanilla, liquorice and cedar. The attack is full to the palate. The tannins of great smoothness reveal a fine elegance. The finish, with no trace of aggressiveness, is marked by a good length.

name: Donnafugata Tancredi 2016
wine_description: Elegant and bodied red wine, its bouquet settles on notes of liquorice, cocoa, black currant, berries with a hits of mint. This wine shows elegance and longevity, thanks to firm and velvety tannins, fruity (cherry and sour cherry) and spicy notes.

name: Paolo Scavino Barolo 2012
wine_description: Aromas of violet, rose, red berry, vineyard dust and alpine herbs float from the glass. The savory, bright palate delivers crushed Morello cherry, red raspberry, graphite and clove alongside polished tannins and brisk acidity.

name: Château Margaux Pavillon Rouge du Château Margaux 2003
Château La Tour de Mons Marquis de Mons Margaux 2015
Château La Nerthe Châteauneuf-du-Pape 2016
wine_description: A wine with a beautiful dark color, with purple reflections. On the nose, we are seduced by the intensity and the purity of the fruit,by the discrete perception of the aromas coming from the ageing in barrels, by the touch of velvet that bring so much complexity. On the palate, the charm continue to operate. The wine is perfectly balanced, fleshy, round, structured, but still dominated by this finese and precision that makes it accessible. The finish is long with hints of sweetness, fruit paste, and sweet spices.

name: Château Smith Haut-Lafitte Le Petit Haut Lafitte Pessac-Léognan 2015
wine_description: Produced mainly from young Cabernet Sauvignon vines on the Château Smith Haut Lafitte vineyard, this is a solid, dark and dense wine. It has rich black-currant flavors that are cut by acidity and firm tannins.

name: Château Clinet Ronan by Clinet Bordeaux 2015
Henri Bourgeois Grande Réserve Sancerre Blanc 2018
Château Gazin Pomerol 2007
wine_description: Lavish richness offers a wide aromatic range of black and red fruits which harmonises with its intense purple colour. It also offers hints of mint, plum, chocolate, coffee or liquorice, a bouquet of almond, toast, tobacco and vanilla. Maturity gives it a nose of spices, truffles, undergrowth and gamey scents: fur, leather. Its taste is characterised by their silky tannins, their balance and concentration, enhanced by a delicate oaky note.

name: Château Patache d'Aux Médoc 2014
wine_description: Brilliant dark in colour and spicy on the nose. The mouth is rich, complex and fleshy with a beautiful persistence. It has beautiful black fruit aromas and generous tannins.

name: Château Pape Clément Pessac-Léognan (Grand Cru Classé de Graves) 2004
Cloudy Bay Te Wahi Pinot Noir 2014
wine_description: Rich cherry and plum fruit piced with oak notes of cinnamon and clove. Sitting below the fruit, earthen and mineral smokiness, which is lifted by floral notes.

name: Château Potensac Médoc 2013
wine_description: One of the showpieces of the Medoc, this structured and firm wine has strong Cabernet flavors that give both dry tannins and juicy black currant fruits. Still youthful, this balanced wine is likely to age well.

name: Château Gruaud Larose Saint-Julien (Grand Cru Classé) 1990
Château de Ferrand Saint-Émilion Grand Cru (Grand Cru Classé) 2009
wine_description: 75% Merlot, for fullness, roundness and persistence. 15% Cabernet Franc and 10% Cabernet Sauvignon for fruitiness, structure and complexity. Very expressive and aromatic wines with present tannins which are well-matured.

name: Château Chasse-Spleen L'Heritage de Chasse-Spleen Haut-Médoc (L'Ermitage de Chasse-Spleen) 2014
wine_name: L'Heritage de Chasse-Spleen Haut-Médoc (L'Ermitage de Chasse-Spleen)

name: Château Larrivet Haut-Brion Pessac-Léognan 2011
wine_description: Beautiful deep garnet-red colour with a complex, charming bouquet featuring roasted and toasty aromas as well as hints of black fruit and vanilla. Elegant, concentrated, powerful, and well-balanced on the palate. Long aftertaste with remarkably smooth tannin. A great wine with fine ageing potential that will richly reward patience.

name: Château Pichon Longueville Comtesse de Lalande Pauillac (Grand Cru Classé) 2012
wine_description: The wine is seductive when young without prejudicing its longevity. As well as an oaky flavour imparted by new oak barrels, the wines show inimitable aromas of tobacco, violets, blackcurrant and ripe fruit, and also hints of pencil lead.

name: Château Pedesclaux Pauillac (Grand Cru Classé) 2014
wine_description: This wine's beautiful purple color is very deep, the nose is very aromatic with nice ripe black fruit. It is  round and harmonious on the palate with silky tannins and a long finish.

name: Château Cos Labory Saint-Estèphe (Grand Cru Classé) 2009
Château Kirwan Margaux (Grand Cru Classé) 2011
wine_description: Moderately saturated ruby. Out of a decanter, fairly forward blackberry and floral nose, but the body is light and the wine shows little until some really grippy tannins and acidity appear and bring the wine to a screeching halt. A highly structured Margaux.

name: Muga Torre Muga 2014
wine_description: A bright, luminous Bordeaux-red colour with a very complex aroma and a perfect combination of fruit, spice and mineral nuances. In its underlying aroma you can find lovely hints of minerals and new leather. On the palate, it has an elegant attack, proud in its evolution and tasty in its lingering aftertaste. A supple, full-bodied, complex wine with a magnificent finish.

name: Château Duhart-Milon Pauillac (Grand Cru Classé) 2012
wine_description: Dark with good concentration, and the nose has a tightly defined fruit character, reticent rather than open, with a light sprinkle of chalk over some floral, black fruits. The palate has a very polished style, with a shell of fruit sitting around a core of very firm tannins which, although a strong component of the blend, do not over-ride the other elements.

name: Château Sociando-Mallet La Demoiselle de Sociando-Mallet Haut-Médoc 2011
MAN Chenin Blanc (Free-Run Steen) 2018
wine_description: Sweet and sour wine - intense tropical fruit flavours offset by a vibrant and sweetness are perfectly balanced.

name: Dominus Napanook 2010
wine_description: It dark crimson in color, with a fragrant, rich nose full of blackberries and dark forest fruits. The aroma slowly reveals subtle notes of smoky sandalwood, chocolate, and sweet almonds. The entry on the palate is round, but firm; precise and enveloping. Well-balanced tannins open throughout the evolution, and linger on the finish with cherries, cedar and cacao.

name: Château La Lagune Haut-Médoc (Grand Cru Classé) 2011
Château Malartic-Lagravière Pessac-Léognan (Grand Cru Classé de Graves) 2011
wine_description: This wine has an purple colour accompanied by an unctuous texture, extraordinary elegance, lots of licorice, graphite, blueberry, black raspberry and cherry characteristics. It has a full body, terrific purity and length and good acidity.

name: Château Haut-Bages Libéral Pauillac (Grand Cru Classé) 2000
wine_description:
Characterised by its red and blackberries aromas but also minerality and cedar. The nose
and the mouth show some freshness. A nice balance with fine tannins. Slightly peppery with a hint of clove.

name: Alphonse Mellot La Moussière Sancerre Blanc 2017
wine_description: It has lively like the look in your eyes, sweet like a kiss. Very fine gold colour with a green sheen. Its nose has a flowery fruity bouquet.

name: Feudi di San Gregorio Fiano Di Avellino 2018
wine_description:
The color is a definitive golden yellow with green reflections. There are sharp sensations of the
Mediterranean: fresh flowers such as chamomile, yellow peach and candied orange. On the palate,there are typical notes of the softness of the vine that are supplemented by freshness and
minerality.

name: Château Lagrange Les Fiefs de Lagrange Saint-Julien 2007
wine_description: Lively, intense color, without premature evolution. The nose has a fine, elegant character with aromas of ripe fruit and slightly woody notes. In the mouth, the balance is long and consistent. The aftertaste brings out the purity of the fruit thanks to moderate tannins.

name: Château Pedesclaux Fleur de Pedesclaux Pauillac 2010
Château Malartic-Lagravière Pessac-Léognan (Grand Cru Classé de Graves) 2015
wine_description: This wine has an purple colour accompanied by an unctuous texture, extraordinary elegance, lots of licorice, graphite, blueberry, black raspberry and cherry characteristics. It has a full body, terrific purity and length and good acidity.

name: Donatella Cinelli Colombini Brunello di Montalcino (Casato Prime Donne) 2013
wine_description: It has dark ruby red that becomes garnet with ageing  full, rich, fine, recalling spices and small red fruits.

name: Dominus Dominus (Christian Moueix) 2014
wine_description: Dark red, almost deep crimson in color. The nose is dense and compact, filled with dark berries, blond tobacco, black cherries and cacao.

name: Descendientes de J. Palacios Villa de Corullón Bierzo 2015
Château Giscours Le Haut-Médoc de Giscours (Grande Reserve) Haut-Médoc 2015
wine_name: Le Haut-Médoc de Giscours (Grande Reserve) Haut-Médoc

name: Castello Nipozzano Montesodi Toscana 2015
wine_description: A deep ruby precedes a nose rich in well-ripened fruit, with blueberry, redcurrant, and cherry well in evidence, enhanced by floral notes of sweet violets and smooth vanilla, tobacco leaf, and cocoa. In the mouth it is intense, velvety, and well balanced.

name: Château Beau-Sejour Becot Saint-Émilion Grand Cru (Premier Grand Cru Classé) 2012
wine_name: Saint-Émilion Grand Cru (Premier Grand Cru Classé)

name: Tenuta Sette Ponti Oreno Toscana 2014
wine_description: Dark ruby red colour tinged with decisive violet tones, expresses on the nose incredible sensations o ullness and complexity with a note of ripe berries that give sensations of chocolate and nuances of balsam. Oreno is a captivating wine, rich in structure but decisively dynamic, enhanced by the nuances of new oak and an interminable nish

name: Château Poujeaux Moulis-en-Médoc 2007
wine_description: Lovely bright fruit, with a crystalline black summer berry character. The palate has good freshness, with a crisp style, and crunchy black fruits. There is even a little suppleness to it. Firm, tannic backbone too, with good acidity.

name: Donnafugata La Fuga Chardonnay Contessa Entellina 2018
wine_description: Brilliant straw yellow, La Fuga 2016 offers a fragrant bouquet with notes of tropical fruit (pineapple) and citrus fruit, combined with scents of meadow flowers. In the mouth it amazes with its intense sapidity combined with a pleasant vein of acidity.

name: Dominus Napanook 2013
wine_description: It dark crimson in color, with a fragrant, rich nose full of blackberries and dark forest fruits. The aroma slowly reveals subtle notes of smoky sandalwood, chocolate, and sweet almonds. The entry on the palate is round, but firm; precise and enveloping. Well-balanced tannins open throughout the evolution, and linger on the finish with cherries, cedar and cacao.

name: Château Le Crock Saint-Estèphe 2009
wine_description: This is a rich and powerful wine, with a great aromatic complexity. It presents powerful tannins, a  rich bouquet underlined by a fleshy, full structure that will gain in finesse as the years go by, giving a complex and elegant wine.

name: Château Dauzac Labastide Dauzac Margaux 2011
wine_description: Crisp, delicate nose reveals a slightly woody character. We find notes of spices (such as pepper and cocoa) and peony.

name: Domaine de Chevalier Pessac-Léognan (Grand Cru Classé de Graves) 2015
Paul Jaboulet Aîné Paralléle 45 Côtes du Rhône Rouge 2017
wine_description: It is bright, strong red colour. It is red fruits, spices. Palate: round tannins, spicy finish.

name: Château Margaux Pavillon Rouge du Château Margaux 2006
Château Canon-La-Gaffelière Saint-Émilion Grand Cru (Premier Grand Cru Classé) 2011
wine_name: Saint-Émilion Grand Cru (Premier Grand Cru Classé)

name: Paco & Lola LoLo Albariño 2018
wine_description: Straw yellow with green trim and intense. Clean and bright.Medium-high intensity highlights green apple and lemon peel. Hints of stone fruit.The palate is fresh, where repeated citrus and is a reminder of herbs. Elegant bitter finish..

name: Château Dassault Saint-Émilion Grand Cru (Grand Cru Classé) 2011
Ricasoli Brolio Chianti Classico Riserva 2016
wine_description: Deep ruby red colour. Fruity and spicy aromas with a delicate touch of  boisé.  The taste is warm and enveloping, ripe fruit,  blackberry, black currant fruit, herbal sensations, tobacco on the palate. Excellent concentration and very well balanced bouquet. Long and persistent finish.

name: Château Langoa Barton Saint-Julien (Grand Cru Classé) 2008
wine_description: Blackberry, floral and dark chocolate follow through to a medium body, with fine tannins and a fresh finish. With notes of earth and black currant fruit submerged beneath a tannic structure.

name: Château La Tour de By Médoc 2014
wine_description: A beautiful dark ruby color, this wine has an elegant nose of blueberry, blackberry accompanied by a beautiful empyreumatic palette. The palate is dense, concentrated and fresh and taut tannins give this wine a nice length.

name: Château Grand-Puy Ducasse Pauillac (Grand Cru Classé) 2011
wine_description: Dark red center and a bluish hue. Intense aromas of blackcurrant, black cherries, shoe polish and herbs on the classic Bordeaux nose. Juicy blackcurrant fruit on the palate backed by nuances of graphite, iron, herbs and chocolate. The taste stretches well over the mipalate and finish.

name: Château Valandraud Virginie de Valandraud Saint-Émilion Grand Cru 2012
wine_name: Virginie de Valandraud Saint-Émilion Grand Cru
wine_description: Potentially one of the finest wines I have tasted from this estate, the 2010 offers up notes of crushed rocks, black raspberries and black currants intermixed with a hint of barrique. Medium to full-bodied and pure with a distinctive chocolate/coffee character, it should be enjoyed over the next 15+ years.

name: E. Guigal Château d'Ampuis Côte-Rôtie 2013
wine_description: Deep dark colour with mauve tints. On the nose spices, black fruits and delicate oak aromas. A dense, expressive and intense nose with aromas of prunes, blackberry and vanilla. A tannic and racy wine on the palate.

name: Château Pichon Baron Pauillac (Grand Cru Classé) 2015
wine_description: A wine of great personality with fresh red-fruit and blackberry scents. It is quick to express itself on the palate, rolling out its assertive, powerful character and rich flesh. The finish is very long-lasting, with dense, precise tannins. A finely-balanced wine of substance with firm structure and body.

name: La Braccesca Achelo Rosso 2011
wine_description: The wine is bright red with the typical purply hues of the grape variety. A fresh, elegant wine with strong mineral hints and fruity sensations of red berries and white plums. Sweet, vibrant tannins.

name: Château de Beaucastel Châteauneuf-du-Pape 1999
wine_description: A stunning example of this Southern Rhône blend with a smooth, earthy nose velvety texture and fruit-forward style; lovely, generous ripe black raspberry fruit and an exquisite finish.

name: Louis Jadot Mâcon-Villages Blanc 2018
wine_description: Dry and easy to drink, lively and charming, this is a fruity wine with a floral scent and a hint of lemon, the Mâcon Villages should be drunk chilled and rather young.

name: Château Lamothe-Bergeron Haut-Médoc 2011
wine_description: Fine rounded plum fruit on the nose. Warm plush cassis fruit with a hint of oak in the mouth. Nice balance and length.

name: Château de Beaucastel Coudoulet de Beaucastel Côtes-du-Rhône 2017
wine_description: Dark garnet in color, fading to pink at the rim. Full bodied, smooth textured and well structured, with good length, this one really benefits from some extended air, as the fruit turns richer and sweeter.

name: Santa Cristina Le Maestrelle Toscana 2017
wine_description: Appears to the eye with a beautiful ruby ​​red color accented with purple. The aromas are intense with hints of fresh fruit and pleasant floral notes. With good structure this wine is round and smooth rich palate. Soft tannins characterize the end with a taste lingering in the mouth.

name: Château Cantenac Brown Margaux (Grand Cru Classé) 2014
Château Léoville Las Cases Clos du Marquis Saint-Julien 2012
Château La Conseillante Pomerol 2006
wine_description: Very fine, round, very fruity wine, which will provide great tasting pleasure even when young. It is very well balanced and shows lovely freshness, underpinned by a medium structure.

name: Château Giscours Le Haut-Médoc de Giscours (Grande Reserve) Haut-Médoc 2011
wine_name: Le Haut-Médoc de Giscours (Grande Reserve) Haut-Médoc

name: Clos des Papes (Paul Avril) Châteauneuf-du-Pape 2015
wine_description: With a rich, deep color, the perfume exhibits pepper, black raspberry jam, grenadine, garrigue, licorice and raspberry liqueur. The opulent, silky textured fruit coats your mouth and palate, ending in a long, peppery, sweet, pure, red cherry liqueur finish.

name: Domaine William Fèvre Chablis Premier Cru Vaillons 2017
wine_description: It has very pronounced floral and fruit driven bouquet, with lovely freshness and a few mineral notes. Full-bodied palate, with lovely roundness.

name: Château Maucaillou Moulis-en-Médoc 2013
wine_description: It is generally sumptuous in colour, with a particularly subtle and pleasantly fruity aromatic strength, very ripe and concentrated flavours. It is harmoniously balanced, expressive and generous, with finesse and elegance. It has a great length on the palate, with a lively appeal and remarkable cellaring potential thanks to very fine, yet clearly present, tannins.

name: Paul Jaboulet Aîné Crozes-Hermitage Domaine de Thalabert 2011
Château Figeac Saint-Émilion Grand Cru (Premier Grand Cru Classé) 2003
wine_name: Saint-Émilion Grand Cru (Premier Grand Cru Classé)

name: Château d'Issan Blason d'Issan Margaux 2010
wine_description: Deep cherry crimson. Fresh, graphite with pure dark fruit. Lots of lead pencil on the palate and not at all leafy. Lovely purity and very silky, elegant tannins. Aromatic. Cool and fresh and elegant. Lightish but still has lovely scented length.

name: Terrazas de los Andes Reserva Torrontés 2016
wine_description: Pale yellow in the glass with a steely glare and a very expressive bouquet that displays fruity notes of apple, wild and passion fruit. Remarkable floral aromas and intense herbal notes combine with a spicy character with attractive notes of ginger, typical of this variety. The mouth of this lively and seductive wine has excellent acidity that enhances its freshness. A smooth wine, easy to drink and great aromatic persistence thanks to its remarkable citrus character.

name: Château La Tour Carnet Haut-Médoc (Grand Cru Classé) 2016
wine_description: Color is deep garnet color with mahogany reflections slightly tuilés.  The nose is complex, we recognize in this order, blackcurrant, plum. Secondly, it is the spices that are expressed as cinnamon. Roasting the notes then appear in the form of wood burned. The mouth: Franche, mouth lets perceive immediately the incredible delicacy of tannins, coated, perfectly balanced. On the palate, ripe fruit and roasting.

name: Paul Jaboulet Aîné Hermitage La Chapelle Rouge 1999
wine_description: Intense ruby red, limpid and bright. Highly complex, distinguished nose, revealing the great finesse. Black fruits, sweet spices and, ultimately, finely woody. It is shaped by nature, the sun and the rain. That's why every year, this wine is unique. Discover, vintage by vintage, that gave us this land.

name: Château Troplong Mondot Saint-Émilion Grand Cru (Premier Grand Cru Classé) 2000
wine_name: Saint-Émilion Grand Cru (Premier Grand Cru Classé)

name: Argiolas Korem Isola dei Nuraghi 2015
wine_description: An opaque ruby-red color, this is a sophisticated wine with layered aromas of blackberry, wild berries, smoky minerality, leather, chocolate and a touch of savory spice.The wine offers the same rich breadth of flavors, with incredible balance and velvety, fine-grained tannins.

name: Château Kirwan Margaux (Grand Cru Classé) 2015
wine_description: Moderately saturated ruby. Out of a decanter, fairly forward blackberry and floral nose, but the body is light and the wine shows little until some really grippy tannins and acidity appear and bring the wine to a screeching halt. A highly structured Margaux.

name: Château Léoville Poyferré Saint-Julien (Grand Cru Classé) 2013
Château Troplong Mondot Saint-Émilion Grand Cru (Premier Grand Cru Classé) 2004
wine_name: Saint-Émilion Grand Cru (Premier Grand Cru Classé)

name: Feudi di San Gregorio Taurasi 2008
wine_description:
Bright ruby red with garnet, fragrant scents of sour cherry and cherry, cinnamon
and nutmeg, vanilla and anise. The taste is full and balanced with soft, sweet tannins
which give a good persistence aromatic.

name: Pio Cesare Barbaresco 2013
wine_description: Elegance and velvety, with ripe and spicy fruit. Strong tannins, but elegant. Good structure and concentration. Very long life.

name: Château Malescot St. Exupery Margaux (Grand Cru Classé) 2008
wine_description: Notes of graphite, black currant liqueur, incense and camphor make for a complex and intensely penetrating set of aromatics. Dark ruby/purple, medium to full-bodied, with superb concentration and moderate tannin, this wine is a beauty of finesse and substance.

name: Château Léoville Barton Saint-Julien (Grand Cru Classé) 2014
wine_description: This wine has an opaque dark red violet colour. With lovely herbal, lavender and blackberry notes on the nose. Tart berry, blackberry, black fruit palate with depth and sweet tannins.

name: E. Guigal Côte-Rôtie Brune & Blonde de Guigal 2016
wine_description: Dark ruby red in colour. On the  nose spices, red berries and delicate oak aromas. On the palate a wine with round and soft tannins. Harmony between an imperceptible acidity, tannins giving it a good watch but softened by a long oak aging.

name: Château Fourcas Hosten Listrac-Médoc 2008
wine_description: This philosophy motivates us on a daily basis to produce great quality wines, obviously respecting the environment, which are affordable and drinkable as young wines. A major source of satisfaction and motivation is making wines which are balanced, supple and deep at the same time

name: Château Meyney Saint-Estèphe 2011
wine_description: Shows notes of leather and musk after a period of time. It is full-bodied, well-rounded and structured. After ageing, the wine displays the remarkable charm of the best Saint-Estèphe: complexity, balance and harmony.

name: Mauro Molino Barolo 2011
wine_description: Garnet red colour with very intense bouquet of cherry and dried rose. Warm and dry palate, persistent with intense tannins.

name: Château de Rochemorin Pessac-Léognan 2014
wine_description: The attack is supple and fruity. Spicy, tobacco, tar or even find themselves in the final. This wine has a nice tannic structure and richness is typical of wines from Pessac-Léognan. The wooded, well controlled, provides additional structure to this wine that we take pleasure to drink now, but that we can also afford to wait a few years.

name: Château Carbonnieux Pessac-Léognan 2005
wine_description: Medium red color. Aromas of blackcurrant, leaves, bush and earth. On the palate it has notes of fresh blackcurrant, bush and green pepper first, more dried leaves on the midpalate where tobacco and cigar box come along. Scorched earth on the finish.

name: Château Sénéjac Haut-Médoc 2016
wine_description: Very deep colour with an expressive nose of black fruits and spices. It is powerful and intense, while remaining smooth, thanks to the finesse of its tannins. A charming and distinguished wine that can be drunk young, when its fruity aromas are most enjoyable, or, even better, after ageing to discover the elegance and the richness of its terroir.

name: Château Siran Margaux 2015
wine_description: Produced from soils made up of a deep layer of gravel, the wines of Siran are typical of the great Margaux growths. Both powerful and delicate, they express the perfect balance between tannin, fruit and acidity. They are long-ageing wines, which over time develop sweetness on the palate, giving a characteristic silky and velvety mouth-feel.

name: Marchesi di Gresy Barbaresco Martinenga 2009
wine_description: Garnet red, brilliant, with light orange hues. Intense and harmonious, reminiscent of violet, wild wood berries, strawberries and sour black cherry jam with a pleasant balsamic note of cloves. Full, harmonius, with good complexity and persistent aftertaste

name: Château Latour Les Forts de Latour Pauillac 2004
wine_description: Deep ruby and plum color is accompanied by aromas of smoke, earth, black currants, and notions of walnuts as well as spice box. Round and generous.

name: Michele Chiarlo Tortoniano Barolo 2009
wine_description:
Colour: garnet red with bright reflections Aroma: engaging, ethereal and complex, hints of withered roses, juniper and delicate spices 
Taste: ample, harmonious and aristocratic.

name: Château Malartic-Lagravière Pessac-Léognan (Grand Cru Classé de Graves) 2008
wine_description: This wine has an purple colour accompanied by an unctuous texture, extraordinary elegance, lots of licorice, graphite, blueberry, black raspberry and cherry characteristics. It has a full body, terrific purity and length and good acidity.

name: Tenuta Sette Ponti Oreno Toscana 2016
wine_description: Dark ruby red colour tinged with decisive violet tones, expresses on the nose incredible sensations o ullness and complexity with a note of ripe berries that give sensations of chocolate and nuances of balsam. Oreno is a captivating wine, rich in structure but decisively dynamic, enhanced by the nuances of new oak and an interminable nish

name: Château Cantenac Brown Margaux (Grand Cru Classé) 2007
Michele Chiarlo Tortoniano Barolo 2013
wine_description:
Colour: garnet red with bright reflections Aroma: engaging, ethereal and complex, hints of withered roses, juniper and delicate spices 
Taste: ample, harmonious and aristocratic.

name: Dominio del Aguila Pícaro Viñas Viejas 2017
wine_description: Dynamic and fresh wine that reflects the personality of the terroir. The nose highlights its pleasant aroma of red and black fruit with sweet and floral touches. Medium bodied, silky texture, is characterized by its fresh style with marked fruity notes, juicy tannins and a long, lingering finish.

name: Château Montrose Saint-Estèphe (Grand Cru Classé) 2002
wine_description: It has a fine and elegant robe with a beautifully intense and dark garnet. The nose, powerful and harmonious, is pleasantly woody. Aerated, it reveals lightly toasted aromas, followed with hints of ripe fruits and liquorice. The palate is full and soft with tight tannins and a light sweetness. The finish is long and harmonious.

name: E. Guigal Côtes-du-Rhône Blanc 2017
wine_description: Yellow gold, clear and brilliant colour. On the nose freshness marked by the distinctive aromas of Viognier ;white flowers, apricot, acacia and white peach. On the palate fruity with plenty of richness and body. A well-rounded wine with elegance, strength and balance.

name: Miraval Coteaux Varois en Provence Blanc 2016
wine_description: Beautiful pale yellow colour, bright with golden undertones. The nose is very open with rich aromas of yellow flesh fruit and tropical fruit such as fresh pineapple and mango. The minerality of the Keuper marls on the Chateau’s terroir is apparent here. A few smoked notes. The palate is fleshy and mineral at the same time with aromas of white-flesh fruit, small peaches and almonds. The balance between the minerality and the flesh gives this wine a unique sensation. The final is rich on apricots and is uplifted by toasted aromas.

name: Château La Tour de Mons Margaux 2014
wine_description: With an intense colour, the wine displays a very broad aromatic range. Elegant and distinguished, this enticing wine has a fantastic potential for ageing.

name: Château Cantenac Brown Margaux (Grand Cru Classé) 2005
Penfolds St. Henri Shiraz 2011
wine_description: Dark garnet with a deep core. Floral, perfumed, fresh. Boiled-fruitcake mix - nutmeg/cinnamon and mixed spices are laced with glacéed (Cointreau-like) citrus fruits. Subtle praline & liquorice trail on the finish. Medium to full-bodied with an acid/tannin conveyance propelling flavour to the back-palate.

name: Château Ferrière Margaux (Grand Cru Classé) 2011
wine_description: Good black cherry and cream character. The palate has fine substance, with a slightly leaner midpalate, stony fruit and light tannic structure.

name: Clos Henri Vineyard Petit Clos Sauvignon Blanc 2017
wine_description: Chalky and flinty mineral notes are followed by citrus, capsicum and pretty white flower aromas. This wine has good balance, a very nice acid presence and a smooth finish. It is tangy, round, soft, super fruity and easy to drink.

name: Château Smith Haut-Lafitte Le Petit Haut Lafitte Pessac-Léognan 2011
wine_description: Produced mainly from young Cabernet Sauvignon vines on the Château Smith Haut Lafitte vineyard, this is a solid, dark and dense wine. It has rich black-currant flavors that are cut by acidity and firm tannins.

name: Château Canon Saint-Émilion Grand Cru (Premier Grand Cru Classé) 2012
wine_name: Saint-Émilion Grand Cru (Premier Grand Cru Classé)

name: Pelissero Barbaresco Nubiola 2010
wine_description: It has an intense ruby red colour, to the nose it has both fruity and floreal notes that go from the ripe red fruit to the officinal herbs. Soft, tasty, velvety at the same time, leaves on the taste buds a note of sweetness and roundness typical of ripe grape with a slightly dry and astringent closure that distinguishes the Nebbiolo.

name: Famille Perrin Châteauneuf-du-Pape Les Sinards Blanc 2017
Château Giscours Le Haut-Médoc de Giscours (Grande Reserve) Haut-Médoc 2013
wine_name: Le Haut-Médoc de Giscours (Grande Reserve) Haut-Médoc

name: Château Lynch-Bages Echo de Lynch-Bages Pauillac 2014
wine_description: It displays a striking colour and an expressive nose on aromas of black fruits and spices. The attack is lively and racy and the still-fiery tannins are sure to mellow as ageing takes place in one-wine barrels.

name: Château Montrose La Dame de Montrose Saint-Estèphe 2014
wine_description: It has a silky robe with a beautiful cherry red colour. The nose is very expressive and concentrated, slightly sweet and woody, with a mixture of red fruit aromas, raspberry, and morello cherry. The palate is powerful and racy, combining suppleness and tight tannins. Beautiful length in the mouth, with tannins less evident in the after-taste.

name: Château Pedesclaux Fleur de Pedesclaux Pauillac 2011
Château Léoville Poyferré Saint-Julien (Grand Cru Classé) 1998
Tenuta delle Terre Nere Etna Calderara Sottana Rosso 2015
wine_description: The widest spectrum of flavors, bouquets, nuances. Floral and spicy, leathery and aromatic, it delivers a wonderful filling sensation on the palate, yet stepping lightly.

name: Château Bouscaut Pessac-Léognan (Grand Cru Classé de Graves) 2010
Château Smith Haut-Lafitte Pessac-Léognan (Grand Cru Classé de Graves) 2003
Château Cantemerle Les Allées de Cantemerle Haut-Médoc 2011
wine_description:
This wine’s black cherry and deep garnet color is typical of Bordeaux. Its expressive aromas open up to show very fruity, raspberry notes. In the
mouth the wine is immediately accessible,
notable for its charm and floral character.

name: Château Haut-Bages Libéral Pauillac (Grand Cru Classé) 2014
wine_description:
Characterised by its red and blackberries aromas but also minerality and cedar. The nose
and the mouth show some freshness. A nice balance with fine tannins. Slightly peppery with a hint of clove.

name: Bolla Le Origini Amarone della Valpolicella Classico Riserva 2013
wine_name: Le Origini Amarone della Valpolicella Classico Riserva
wine_description: A deep and velvety garnet colour with a violet hue. A perfume of wild cherries, jam, mature pear, vanilla, liquorice and cedar wood. Full-bodied, warm on the palate with clear hints of cocoa and spices.

name: Altesino Brunello di Montalcino  Montosoli 2012
wine_description: It has a deep ruby red colour which turns a garnet red with age. Its bouquet has outstanding character with hints of black cherry, blackberries, raspberries, violet, liquorice, vanilla and a slight accent of pink peppercorn.

name: Château Pavie Macquin Saint-Émilion Grand Cru (Premier Grand Cru Classé) 2011
wine_name: Saint-Émilion Grand Cru (Premier Grand Cru Classé)

name: Château Grand-Puy Ducasse Pauillac (Grand Cru Classé) 2009
wine_description: Dark red center and a bluish hue. Intense aromas of blackcurrant, black cherries, shoe polish and herbs on the classic Bordeaux nose. Juicy blackcurrant fruit on the palate backed by nuances of graphite, iron, herbs and chocolate. The taste stretches well over the mipalate and finish.

name: Marrenon Grand Marrenon Rouge 2017
wine_description: A nice and intense violin-ruby red robe which is typical of a strong concentration. The nose is expressive, fruity and very pleasing with ripe/jammy fruits and blond tobacco notes. In mouth, sweet attack with dominant fresh fruits. Nice amplitude thanks to intense aromas, kept up with concentrated tannins.

name: E. Guigal Saint-Joseph 2016
wine_description:
Visual : Dark red with violet highlights.
Odor : Powerful nose with dominant red fruit and delicate oak aromas.
Palate : The palate is fresh and fruity. The rather round and supple tannins.

name: M. Chapoutier Chante-Alouette Hermitage Blanc 2015
wine_description:
Colour: Brilliant and green golden.
Nose: Complex et subtle, aromas of quince, honey, ginger, accacia with a hint of lime blossom.
Mouth: Frank attack, without harshness,powerfull mouth with a final taste of almond ; very elegant and good length.

name: Alphonse Mellot La Moussière Sancerre Blanc 2018
wine_description: It has lively like the look in your eyes, sweet like a kiss. Very fine gold colour with a green sheen. Its nose has a flowery fruity bouquet.

name: Château Duhart-Milon Pauillac (Grand Cru Classé) 2004
wine_description: Dark with good concentration, and the nose has a tightly defined fruit character, reticent rather than open, with a light sprinkle of chalk over some floral, black fruits. The palate has a very polished style, with a shell of fruit sitting around a core of very firm tannins which, although a strong component of the blend, do not over-ride the other elements.

name: Louis Jadot Bourgogne Couvent des Jacobins 2017
Château La Gaffelière Saint-Émilion Grand Cru (Premier Grand Cru Classé) 2015
wine_name: Saint-Émilion Grand Cru (Premier Grand Cru Classé)
wine_description: Red color of average intensity. Fruity, fresh and ripe nose. Caressing on the palate of fruity and fresh type. Developing very tasty, the wine evolves with coated tannins and a lovely violet aroma in its persistence.

name: Donnafugata Tancredi 2008
wine_description: Elegant and bodied red wine, its bouquet settles on notes of liquorice, cocoa, black currant, berries with a hits of mint. This wine shows elegance and longevity, thanks to firm and velvety tannins, fruity (cherry and sour cherry) and spicy notes.

name: Château Carbonnieux Pessac-Léognan 2015
wine_description: Medium red color. Aromas of blackcurrant, leaves, bush and earth. On the palate it has notes of fresh blackcurrant, bush and green pepper first, more dried leaves on the midpalate where tobacco and cigar box come along. Scorched earth on the finish.

name: Château Canon-La-Gaffelière Saint-Émilion Grand Cru (Premier Grand Cru Classé) 2010
wine_name: Saint-Émilion Grand Cru (Premier Grand Cru Classé)

name: Château Kirwan Charmes de Kirwan Margaux 2015
wine_description:
It displays a brilliant ruby red colour. Its nose offers elegant notes of black and red fruits such as cherry and red and black currant.
Delicate woody notes round out the palette of aromas.
A fresh and lively quality immediately enchants the taste buds, while quickly giving way to sweeter sensations with a pleasant roundness. Creamy notes add a touch of extra roundness to the wine and the tasting finishes with lovely spice scents.
This wine is bountiful, gourmand, and will be delicious

name: Château Haut-Brion Le Clarence de Haut Brion Pessac-Léognan (Château Bahans Haut-Brion) 2005
wine_name: Le Clarence de Haut Brion Pessac-Léognan (Château Bahans Haut-Brion)

name: Château La Tour de Mons Marquis de Mons Margaux 2011
Château de Fieuzal Pessac-Léognan (Grand Cru Classé de Graves) 2014
Domaine de l'Hortus Le Loup dans la Bergerie 2018
wine_description: Ruby with purple highlights. Seductive, with red fruit flavors (strawberry, raspberry) and sweet spices. Round, soft and greedy, a basket of crisp fruit, very fine tannins. a drinkable final.

name: Domaine de Chevalier Pessac-Léognan (Grand Cru Classé de Graves) 2004
La Braccesca Sabazio 2014
wine_description: The wine has good ruby red colour and a fresh vibrant aroma of ripe red berry fruit. The flavour is well-structured and very pleasant with nice minerally sensations and soft, stylish tannins.

name: Château Prieuré-Lichine Margaux (Grand Cru Classé) 2015
wine_description: A glossy crimson-black hue, with the aromas of blackberry. A soft creamed-fruit substance on the palate, with lots of ripe, supple, velvety tannins and a good core of acidity. Rich, substantial, with a firm grippy finish.

name: Terres Dorées Chardonnay Classic Beaujolais 2018
wine_description: On the nose luscious green apple fruit mingles with poached pear and citrus zest. The palate does have some weight, but this is a lean, sharp wine with a sturdy mineral backbone. It’s really quite amazing to drink such a precise wine for such a value

name: Château Langoa Barton Saint-Julien (Grand Cru Classé) 2007
wine_description: Blackberry, floral and dark chocolate follow through to a medium body, with fine tannins and a fresh finish. With notes of earth and black currant fruit submerged beneath a tannic structure.

name: Domaine Jean-Louis Chave Saint-Joseph Selection Offerus 2013
Château d'Aiguilhe Castillon - Côtes de Bordeaux 2009
wine_description: This powerful wine reflects its terroir with intensity and panache. Vigorous and fruity, it is a favourite of people who love wines of character.

name: Château Soutard Saint-Émilion Grand Cru (Grand Cru Classé) 2012
wine_description: Medium to full-bodied. Great in structure, the acidity tells more about longest-live and very well in balance and firm tannin. A truly classic and austere wine.

name: Château Fourcas Hosten Listrac-Médoc 2011
wine_description: This philosophy motivates us on a daily basis to produce great quality wines, obviously respecting the environment, which are affordable and drinkable as young wines. A major source of satisfaction and motivation is making wines which are balanced, supple and deep at the same time

name: Badenhorst Secateurs Red Blend 2016
wine_description: It has perfumed, peppery, spicey, smokey and exhibit ripe red fruit notes. As always the palate texture of this style of wine is supple, smooth on the entry but with enough grip to end dry and refreshing. In the mouth the texture and fineness of fruit tannin and drinkability of the wine is immediately evident.

name: Château La Dominique Saint-Émilion Grand Cru (Grand Cru Classé) 2012
wine_description: Deep and shiny colour with an intense, characterized nose by seducing aromas of ripe fruits and subtle spicy notes. In most vintages, you will find truffle and licorice notes, complemented by peppery and woody aromas. Fleshy and round, with silky and precise tannins. The finish is long and full and leaves you with a pleasant feeling of bliss.

name: Château Duhart-Milon Pauillac (Grand Cru Classé) 2002
wine_description: Dark with good concentration, and the nose has a tightly defined fruit character, reticent rather than open, with a light sprinkle of chalk over some floral, black fruits. The palate has a very polished style, with a shell of fruit sitting around a core of very firm tannins which, although a strong component of the blend, do not over-ride the other elements.

name: Château Fonroque Saint-Émilion Grand Cru (Grand Cru Classé) 2011
wine_description: The color is deep red. The nose is deep, marked by black fruits mixed with floral notes. Some very subtle woody notes complete the nose. The first taste is nice, sweet and deep at the same time, it goes on a juicy structure with body, it is refined with a velvety palate. The finish is very fresh, dense, persistent on a brilliant fruit associated with mineral notes.

name: Rimauresq Côtes de Provence (Cru Classé) 2016
wine_description: The nose is inviting with wonderful redcurrant, plum and blackberry aromas with hints of black pepper. The palate has more concentrated fruit blackberry, redcurrant and tart blackcurrants, a velvety mouthfeel and structure as well as freshness and a tasty chewy texture. The style is warm and generous but with a deftness of touch adding elegance and balance to the rich fruit.

name: Henri Bourgeois Grande Réserve Sancerre Blanc 2015
Château Troplong Mondot Saint-Émilion Grand Cru (Premier Grand Cru Classé) 2008
wine_name: Saint-Émilion Grand Cru (Premier Grand Cru Classé)

name: Château Fleur Cardinale Saint-Émilion Grand Cru (Grand Cru Classé) 2014
Château Beauregard Pomerol 2011
wine_description: This wine has a deep purple hue and already reveals intense and complex aromas of black fruit, such as blackcurrant, blackberry and morello cherry, mingling harmoniously with notes of violets, sweet spices, eucalyptus, forest floor and already very well integrated oak. The entry on the palate is silky and deliciously flavoursome thanks to round, stylish and perfectly ripe tannins.

name: Paul Jaboulet Aîné Crozes-Hermitage Domaine de Thalabert 2013
Château Clerc Milon Pauillac (Grand Cru Classé) 2014
wine_description: The nose reveals finely toasted spice and tobacco notes combined with more intense aromas of red fruit and cherry stone with a mineral touch. The palate is full and well-defined, dominated by the lustre of succulent fruit and refined, flavoursome tannins that open on a hint of chocolate. The long, warm-hearted finish is lifted by a slightly saline taste.

name: Château Latour Les Forts de Latour Pauillac 2009
wine_description: Deep ruby and plum color is accompanied by aromas of smoke, earth, black currants, and notions of walnuts as well as spice box. Round and generous.

name: E. Guigal Condrieu La Doriane 2016
wine_description:
Visual : pale golden yellow color and shiny crystal clear.
Odor : White flowers, apricot, white peaches, powerful and elegant aromatic intensity.
Palate : Fresh, round, rich and bold bouche.Expression affirmed the soil. Very fine and very fresh.
Ensemble : Harmony of low acidity and a pleasant fruit bathed in a fleshy roundness.

name: Cos d'Estournel Cos d'Estournel 2012
wine_description: The call of faraway lands. As mysterious and intriguing as a lone adventurer returning from a solitary sail, Cos d’Estournel is slow to reveal itself. Little by little, it evokes stories of distant places, market stalls brimming with unfamiliar fruits, spices and wares, village festivities warmed by the joy of revelers and the setting sun, and sumptuous visions of ladies and their voluptuous curves. A myriad of scents, colors and tastes appeals to the senses. The Grand Vin of Cos d’Estournel is both demure and deliberately sensuous, a fascinating and elegant nectar.

name: Domaine de la Janasse Châteauneuf-du-Pape Vieilles Vignes 2011
wine_description: The color is dark with purple reflections. The nose has discreet aromas of crushed black fruits and garrigue.

name: Château Poujeaux Moulis-en-Médoc 2000
wine_description: Lovely bright fruit, with a crystalline black summer berry character. The palate has good freshness, with a crisp style, and crunchy black fruits. There is even a little suppleness to it. Firm, tannic backbone too, with good acidity.

name: Clos des Papes (Paul Avril) Châteauneuf-du-Pape 2013
wine_description: With a rich, deep color, the perfume exhibits pepper, black raspberry jam, grenadine, garrigue, licorice and raspberry liqueur. The opulent, silky textured fruit coats your mouth and palate, ending in a long, peppery, sweet, pure, red cherry liqueur finish.

name: Château Latour Les Forts de Latour Pauillac 2008
wine_description: Deep ruby and plum color is accompanied by aromas of smoke, earth, black currants, and notions of walnuts as well as spice box. Round and generous.

name: Château Mazeyres Le Seuil de Mazeyres Pomerol 2014
wine_description:
Ruby color with purple glints. First nose on minty notes showing a nice freshness.
Then spices with a touch of pepper mixed with small black fruits (blackcurrant, blackberries) are revealed in a very nice and complex nose. The tannins are silky and brought by a pure fruit and a pretty roasted touch of oak.

name: Château Pape Clément Pessac-Léognan (Grand Cru Classé de Graves) 2016
Xavier Vignon Côtes du Rhône 2016
wine_description: Wine rich in color, ruby dress with crimson reflects. Nose is intense and shows red fruits, black fruits, flowers and spices. Palate is spacious, very silky, powerful and generous.

name: Château Mazeyres Pomerol 2014
wine_description: Ruby color with purple glints. A touch of vanilla on the first nose then notes of hazelnuts. Black-cherry and raspberry when the wine evolves. The attack is soft and subtile and the tannins are developed with charm on the palate. A light touch of oak is giving complexity to the wine.

name: Domaine de Beaurenard Châteauneuf-du-Pape 2012
wine_description: We make highly concentrated wines of great finesse, elegance and minerality. This is the true signature and pedigree of the local soils, which makes Beaurenard wines suited to lengthy ageing. They can also be drunk young, to procure an intense, lush pleasure.

name: Château Canon-La-Gaffelière Saint-Émilion Grand Cru (Premier Grand Cru Classé) 2006
wine_name: Saint-Émilion Grand Cru (Premier Grand Cru Classé)

name: Château Giscours La Sirène de Giscours Margaux 2008
wine_description:
Deep purple color, soft concentrated nose of red fruits and fresh cut cedar. 
Mouth: some ripe fruit, some consentration and bitter, dry and short finish.

name: Château Margaux Pavillon Rouge du Château Margaux 2008
Jean-Marc Brocard Chardonnay Bourgogne Kimmeridgien 2015
wine_description: t consists of alternate layers of dense chalk and softer clay, which is encrusted with marine fossils (oestra, virgula). These shells give the wine its mineral qualities for which the area is famous. The citrus and honeyed flavors of this fresh, crisp wine will continue to develop over the next two to three years. It is delicious either as an aperitif or with seafood and fish dishes.

name: Château Canon Croix Canon Saint-Émilion Grand Cru 2012
Château Brane-Cantenac Baron de Brane Margaux 2012
Château Kirwan Margaux (Grand Cru Classé) 2014
wine_description: Moderately saturated ruby. Out of a decanter, fairly forward blackberry and floral nose, but the body is light and the wine shows little until some really grippy tannins and acidity appear and bring the wine to a screeching halt. A highly structured Margaux.

name: Caiarossa Toscana 2006
wine_description: The nose of this wine offers a whirl of aromas ranging from hints of caramel to small red forest fruit and notes of spice, rich balsamic and deep minerals. The mouth confirms the lightness and elegance found on the nose and the tannins are alive and compact.

name: Château Malartic-Lagravière La Réserve de Malartic (Le Sillage) Pessac-Léognan 2015
wine_name: La Réserve de Malartic (Le Sillage) Pessac-Léognan
wine_description: Beautiful garnet red colour. Aroma of red and black fruit on the nose, with good freshness and spicy notes. Good body on the palate with a velvety fullness developing aromas of blackberries and black cherries. Overall very good balance and intensity, including the finish.

name: Château d'Armailhac Pauillac (Grand Cru Classé) 2015
wine_description: A dense and deep red with a violet tint, the wine has a still slightly reserved nose which opens with airing on hints of cassis, blackberry and fresh red fruit mingled with touches of cedarwood. The attack is nicely rounded, with well-integrated tannins that fill out on a mid-palate full of fruit. The flavours linger pleasingly in a full and expressive finish that gives the wine a fine overall balance.

name: Château La Garde Pessac-Léognan 2009
wine_description: It has deep and concentrated appearance. A seductive bouquet emitting aromas of ripe fruits, liquorice and a smoky character often found in the terroirs of Pessac-Leognan. On the palate, the power of the delicate, rounded tannins is accompanied by generous rich character and volume.
