The wine’s harmonious presence culminates in a long, well-balanced finish, with well-integrated oak character.

name: Château Grand-Puy-Lacoste Pauillac (Grand Cru Classé) 1995
wine_description: Exhibits classic Pauillac aromas and flavors of creme de cassis along with stony/floral notes.

name: Marchesi di Gresy Barbaresco Martinenga 2013
wine_description: Garnet red, brilliant, with light orange hues. Intense and harmonious, reminiscent of violet, wild wood berries, strawberries and sour black cherry jam with a pleasant balsamic note of cloves. Full, harmonius, with good complexity and persistent aftertaste

name: Château Puygueraud Francs - Côtes de Bordeaux 2015
Clos de Bouard Dame de Boüard Montagne Saint-Émilion 2016
Château Pedesclaux Pauillac (Grand Cru Classé) 2015
wine_description: This wine's beautiful purple color is very deep, the nose is very aromatic with nice ripe black fruit. It is  round and harmonious on the palate with silky tannins and a long finish.

name: Château Dauzac Margaux (Grand Cru Classé) 2011
wine_description: Back on the palate with dark fruit notes with a liveliness giving an elegant freshness. In the final, this liquorice aromas with a long cool confirming the quality of Cabernet Sauvignon. The precise tannins guarantee a nice development.

name: Domaine du Coulet - Matthieu Barret Petit Ours 2018
Château Gruaud Larose Saint-Julien (Grand Cru Classé) 1988
Château Pichon Baron Les Griffons Pauillac 2015
Château Gaillard Saint-Émilion Grand Cru 2015
wine_description: Dry cherry-red coloured wine features medium woody, spicy, fruity and vegetal scents and offers a broad texture as well as fleshy tannins.

name: Castello di Ama Chianti Classico 2006
wine_description: A luminous and fairly deep green-shot gold in colour. Spacious aromas of fig, apricot, and bitter almond. A dry, crisp entry, then a sweetness on the palate that is delicious but never cloying. Very long, fruit-laden conclusion.

name: Clos Henri Vineyard Petit Clos Pinot Noir 2017
wine_description: Bright, fresh vibrant red cherry, raspberry, violet and a suggestion of mint ripe cherry and summer berry fruit aromas, not to mention attractive spicy and savory complexity. The structure is proudly emphasised on the palate, the tannins really impress and the balance is right on

name: Château Grand-Puy-Lacoste Pauillac (Grand Cru Classé) 2002
wine_description: Exhibits classic Pauillac aromas and flavors of creme de cassis along with stony/floral notes.

name: Banfi Fonte Alla Selva Chianti Classico 2015
wine_description:
Color: deep red purple. 
Nose: varietal aromas of cherry, plum and blackberry, enriched by notes more 
complex of licorice. 
Taste: large and ripe, balanced by good acidity. 
Good persistence.

name: Château d'Armailhac Pauillac (Grand Cru Classé) 2003
wine_description: A dense and deep red with a violet tint, the wine has a still slightly reserved nose which opens with airing on hints of cassis, blackberry and fresh red fruit mingled with touches of cedarwood. The attack is nicely rounded, with well-integrated tannins that fill out on a mid-palate full of fruit. The flavours linger pleasingly in a full and expressive finish that gives the wine a fine overall balance.

name: Château de Chamirey Mercurey 2016
wine_description:
A dense ruby colour, deep and intense. The nose opens on intense black fruits aromas
(blackcurrant and blueberry) as well as soft spices (cinnamon, nutmeg). Flavourful. On the palate we have a great density and a powerful expression.

name: Clos Floridène Graves 2011
wine_description: Clos Floridène Rouge is strongly marked by an unusual association in Bordeaux, With a bright and intense color, it has black-currant and wild strawberry aromas, with hints of mint, liquorice and smokiness. The fruit and tannin are powerful, silky and fresh.

name: Château Gazin Pomerol 2010
wine_description: Lavish richness offers a wide aromatic range of black and red fruits which harmonises with its intense purple colour. It also offers hints of mint, plum, chocolate, coffee or liquorice, a bouquet of almond, toast, tobacco and vanilla. Maturity gives it a nose of spices, truffles, undergrowth and gamey scents: fur, leather. Its taste is characterised by their silky tannins, their balance and concentration, enhanced by a delicate oaky note.

name: Banfi Fonte Alla Selva Chianti Classico 2016
wine_description:
Color: deep red purple. 
Nose: varietal aromas of cherry, plum and blackberry, enriched by notes more 
complex of licorice. 
Taste: large and ripe, balanced by good acidity. 
Good persistence.

name: Château d'Aiguilhe Castillon - Côtes de Bordeaux 2014
wine_description: This powerful wine reflects its terroir with intensity and panache. Vigorous and fruity, it is a favourite of people who love wines of character.

name: Château Canon-La-Gaffelière Saint-Émilion Grand Cru (Premier Grand Cru Classé) 2012
wine_name: Saint-Émilion Grand Cru (Premier Grand Cru Classé)

name: Tua Rita Giusto di Notri Toscana 2015
Gaja Barbaresco 2015
wine_description: Garnet in colour. Aromas of forest fruits, plums, liquorice, mineral and coffee scents on the nose. This wine has a dense structure, flavours of ripe fruit and a full body. It displays a long, complex finish with fine, silk-like tannins and good acidity.

name: Domaine Lafage Vieilles Vignes Cayrol Carignan 2016
Château du Tertre Margaux (Grand Cru Classé) 2008
wine_description: Great sweetness and flavour. Silky and freshness are combined in this flask to bring you the elegance expected of a great Margaux wine.

name: Château Rauzan-Ségla Margaux (Grand Cru Classé) 2003
wine_description: Candied confectionary nose along with some Margaux perfume and flowers. Palate is nicely fresh. Sweet and modern, with rich berry flavours, balanced and nicely proportioned until the finish.

name: Domaine du Vieux Télégraphe Télégramme Châteauneuf-du-Pape 2017
Château La Tour de Bessan Margaux 2014
wine_description:
Deep purple dress. Nose opening with aeration : wild red berries, mint and vanilla. The wine has
strong and round tannins. The finish is long and fresh.

name: Château Léoville Poyferré Saint-Julien (Grand Cru Classé) 2014
Château Malescot St. Exupery Margaux (Grand Cru Classé) 2000
wine_description: Notes of graphite, black currant liqueur, incense and camphor make for a complex and intensely penetrating set of aromatics. Dark ruby/purple, medium to full-bodied, with superb concentration and moderate tannin, this wine is a beauty of finesse and substance.

name: Château La Conseillante Pomerol 2004
wine_description: Very fine, round, very fruity wine, which will provide great tasting pleasure even when young. It is very well balanced and shows lovely freshness, underpinned by a medium structure.

name: Château Ormes de Pez Saint-Estèphe 2003
wine_description: Dark red violet in colour. On the nose ripe currant, red berry and herbal notes. A tasty, herbaceous, berry and cassis palate with a medium finish.

name: Château Reynon Cadillac - Côtes de Bordeaux 2013
wine_description: The nose is very smooth, intensely fruity, with hints of smoke and toast. On the palate, this wine is robust, rich, with solid tannins and lengthens.

name: Trimbach Riesling Alsace Réserve 2012
wine_description:
Beautiful colour with green edges, the nose is developed and shows a hint of mineral flavour
associated with ripe Riesling fruits.

name: Prunotto Occhetti Nebbiolo d'Alba 2016
wine_description: A ruby red of good intensity tending towards garnet. Elegant in aroma with notes of raspberries, this wine is round and elegant and very versatile.

name: Château Valandraud Saint-Émilion Grand Cru (Premier Grand Cru Classé) 2014
wine_name: Saint-Émilion Grand Cru (Premier Grand Cru Classé)

name: Famille Perrin Gigondas La Gille 2017
wine_description:
Deep ruby color and velvety. Red fruit, earth, mineral. Tannins present without aggression. 
Fortified wine, supported, elegant, robust and distinguished.

name: Château Cote de Baleau Saint-Émilion Grand Cru (Grand Cru Classé) 2015
Castellare Toscana I Sodi di San Niccolo 2014
wine_name: Toscana I Sodi di San Niccolo
wine_description: It is especially dark, powerful and brooding. Black fruit, smoke, tar and incense are some of the many notes that flow from a structured, tense frame. I Sodi di San Niccolo is 85% Sangioveto and 15% Malvasia Nera aged in French oak barrels.

name: Laibach The Ladybird Red 2015
wine_description: Deep dark colour. Oodles of fruit with blackberry, sour cherry and wild spice evident. Some leather, tomato cocktail and cherries on the palate with just a hint of oak. A medium bodied wine with soft plummy tannins and a beautiful long finish. Good complexity and dimension to really over deliver.

name: Château Prieuré-Lichine Confidences de Prieuré-Lichine Margaux 2015
wine_description: Quite a sweet-fruit nose makes itself known to start with, then ripe flavors and modest tannins make this very approachable. It’s only the finish that’s a little dry and angular.

name: Domaine de l'Hortus Pic-Saint-Loup Classique Bergerie 2018
wine_description: Very lovely wine with silky texture, full fruit without the heat or jammyness and good backone.

name: Alain Jaume Domaine du Clos de Sixte 2016
Château Négrit Montagne-Saint-Émilion 2016
wine_description: Dark in color, almost black, this wine inspires confidence; the ripe fruit bouquet is very clean. Its mouthfeel is rich and suave, underpinned by lively tannins.

name: Château du Tertre Margaux (Grand Cru Classé) 2013
wine_description: Great sweetness and flavour. Silky and freshness are combined in this flask to bring you the elegance expected of a great Margaux wine.

name: Château Carbonnieux Pessac-Léognan Blanc (Grand Cru Classé de Graves) 2009
wine_name: Pessac-Léognan Blanc (Grand Cru Classé de Graves)

name: Pio Cesare Barbaresco 2012
wine_description: Elegance and velvety, with ripe and spicy fruit. Strong tannins, but elegant. Good structure and concentration. Very long life.

name: Château de Sancerre Cuvée du Connetable Sancerre 2017
Château Rauzan-Ségla Margaux (Grand Cru Classé) 2009
wine_description: Candied confectionary nose along with some Margaux perfume and flowers. Palate is nicely fresh. Sweet and modern, with rich berry flavours, balanced and nicely proportioned until the finish.

name: Château Grand Corbin-Despagne Saint-Émilion Grand Cru (Grand Cru Classé) 2012
Coursodon Saint-Joseph Silice 2016
wine_description: Ruby colour. Mature black berry nose and full of fruit. A well balanced wine with fine tannins, which can easily be aged for a few years in cellar.

name: Domaine du Grand Tinel Alexis Establet Châteauneuf-du-Pape 2010
wine_description: Refined, polished and silky, with freshness in its kirsch core that really stands out in the finish. Made from 100% old vine Grenache.

name: Marqués de Riscal Barón de Chirel Rioja Reserva 2014
wine_description: A dark cherry colour, lively with few signs of evolution. High aromatic intensity in which the toasted and spicy aromas from the French oak predominate, together with ripe, dark-berried fruit. In the mouth, it is fresh and smooth with soft, polished tannins in which the wood is not too intrusive. Complex and elegant with a long, balanced finish.

name: Château Puech-Haut Tête de Bélier Saint-Drézéry Rouge 2017
Penfolds Bin 2 Shiraz - Mourvèdre 2017
wine_description: Aromas of satsuma plum and dark cherry are set against a spicy nutmeg and savoury backdrop. A medium bodied wine, with softened, fine tannins courting dark cherry and raspberry fruits, with well integrated oak in the background. Spice flavours, and a hint of liquorice add further complexity.

name: Château de Pennautier Cabardès 2014
wine_description: Dress showing off a dark cherry red color. simple nose with hints of red berries. It also evokes subtle vegetal and mineral notes. Make discover this red featuring refreshing acidity and firm tannins provided. Moreover, it reminds spice flavors. Its supple palate ending in a long finish.

name: Marchesi di Barolo Cannubi Barolo 2014
wine_description: Garnet-red in color with ruby reflections. Intense perfume with clean scent of roses, vanilla,  licorice, spices and toasted oak. Gentle notes of absinth. The flavor is full and elegant, good-bodied and austere with recurring olfactory sensations. The spicy note and the hints of  wood blend perfectly.

name: Château Lanessan Haut-Médoc 2016
wine_description: Deeply colored and flavored, fuller than most Haut Medocs. Spice, anise, tar, black-currant and plum flavors lend it complexity and character.

name: L'Ostal Cazes Estibals Minervois 2016
wine_description: Deep red hue and violet glints. This wine offers notes of scrubland, morello cherries and red fruits. On the palate, the attack is full and smooth with well-marked tannins and a touch of oakiness.

name: Castello di Ama Chianti Classico 2017
wine_description: A luminous and fairly deep green-shot gold in colour. Spacious aromas of fig, apricot, and bitter almond. A dry, crisp entry, then a sweetness on the palate that is delicious but never cloying. Very long, fruit-laden conclusion.

name: Château de Pressac Saint-Émilion Grand Cru (Grand Cru Classé) 2015
Château Branaire-Ducru Duluc de Branaire-Ducru Saint-Julien (Chateau Duluc) 2014
Cloudy Bay Chardonnay 2015
wine_description: An irresistible mix of ripe citrus and toasted nut aromas reminiscent of grapefruit, fig and pistachio biscotti taken with chamomile tea. The palate leads with savoury notes which give way to a taut citrus core, revealing the vibrant Marlborough fruit.

name: Donnafugata Mille E Una Notte 2016
wine_description: A structured red wine with a remarkable personality. Complex and elegant offers to the nose a rich bouquet with balsamic scents, floral notes and spicy nuances. This wine is deep ruby-red in colour. The palate opens with floral notes of violet and rounds out with hints of tobacco on the persistent finish.

name: Château d'Armailhac Pauillac (Grand Cru Classé) 2013
wine_description: A dense and deep red with a violet tint, the wine has a still slightly reserved nose which opens with airing on hints of cassis, blackberry and fresh red fruit mingled with touches of cedarwood. The attack is nicely rounded, with well-integrated tannins that fill out on a mid-palate full of fruit. The flavours linger pleasingly in a full and expressive finish that gives the wine a fine overall balance.

name: Château Langoa Barton Saint-Julien (Grand Cru Classé) 2005
wine_description: Blackberry, floral and dark chocolate follow through to a medium body, with fine tannins and a fresh finish. With notes of earth and black currant fruit submerged beneath a tannic structure.

name: Château d'Armailhac Pauillac (Grand Cru Classé) 2016
wine_description: A dense and deep red with a violet tint, the wine has a still slightly reserved nose which opens with airing on hints of cassis, blackberry and fresh red fruit mingled with touches of cedarwood. The attack is nicely rounded, with well-integrated tannins that fill out on a mid-palate full of fruit. The flavours linger pleasingly in a full and expressive finish that gives the wine a fine overall balance.

name: Château Léoville Las Cases Saint-Julien (Grand Cru Classé) 2007
Château La Tour de Mons Margaux 2011
wine_description: With an intense colour, the wine displays a very broad aromatic range. Elegant and distinguished, this enticing wine has a fantastic potential for ageing.

name: Château Rauzan-Ségla Margaux (Grand Cru Classé) 2001
wine_description: Candied confectionary nose along with some Margaux perfume and flowers. Palate is nicely fresh. Sweet and modern, with rich berry flavours, balanced and nicely proportioned until the finish.

name: Château Malartic-Lagravière Pessac-Léognan (Grand Cru Classé de Graves) 2013
wine_description: This wine has an purple colour accompanied by an unctuous texture, extraordinary elegance, lots of licorice, graphite, blueberry, black raspberry and cherry characteristics. It has a full body, terrific purity and length and good acidity.

name: Château Calon-Ségur Marquis de Calon Saint-Estèphe 2011
wine_description: The estate’s Second Wine is a different expression of the Calon terroir. With an average proportion of 75% Merlot in the blend, it is enjoyable to drink in the immediate term and exhibits a warm and velvety character. It is aged in barrels, a third of which are new, for up to 18 months.

name: San Leonardo San Leonardo 2014
wine_description: Intense ruby red with garnet highlights. A wine of remarkable intensity on the nose, which layers bell peppers and wild berries over a background note of vanilla. The palate is full, warm and impressively rounded, with intense aromatics that linger on the palate.

name: Caiarossa Toscana 2010
wine_description: The nose of this wine offers a whirl of aromas ranging from hints of caramel to small red forest fruit and notes of spice, rich balsamic and deep minerals. The mouth confirms the lightness and elegance found on the nose and the tannins are alive and compact.

name: Château Cantenac Brown Margaux (Grand Cru Classé) 2015
Château Langoa Barton Saint-Julien (Grand Cru Classé) 2011
wine_description: Blackberry, floral and dark chocolate follow through to a medium body, with fine tannins and a fresh finish. With notes of earth and black currant fruit submerged beneath a tannic structure.

name: Clos des Lunes La Petite Lune 2015
Altesino Brunello di Montalcino  Montosoli 2008
wine_description: It has a deep ruby red colour which turns a garnet red with age. Its bouquet has outstanding character with hints of black cherry, blackberries, raspberries, violet, liquorice, vanilla and a slight accent of pink peppercorn.

name: Château Combel La Serre Le Pur Fruit du Causse Cahors 2018
wine_name: Le Pur Fruit du Causse Cahors

name: Château Grand-Puy Ducasse Pauillac (Grand Cru Classé) 2006
wine_description: Dark red center and a bluish hue. Intense aromas of blackcurrant, black cherries, shoe polish and herbs on the classic Bordeaux nose. Juicy blackcurrant fruit on the palate backed by nuances of graphite, iron, herbs and chocolate. The taste stretches well over the mipalate and finish.

name: Mauro Molino Barolo 2015
wine_description: Garnet red colour with very intense bouquet of cherry and dried rose. Warm and dry palate, persistent with intense tannins.

name: Château La Gaffelière Saint-Émilion Grand Cru (Premier Grand Cru Classé) 2012
wine_name: Saint-Émilion Grand Cru (Premier Grand Cru Classé)
wine_description: Red color of average intensity. Fruity, fresh and ripe nose. Caressing on the palate of fruity and fresh type. Developing very tasty, the wine evolves with coated tannins and a lovely violet aroma in its persistence.

name: Sena Aconcagua Valley 2016
wine_description: Dark, dry red color. The scent has notes of berries, tobacco, cocoa, coconut and pepper. The flavor is intense, with a wealth of nuances and a very nice balance, which gives it a very classic French flavor.

name: Bolla Le Origini Amarone della Valpolicella Classico Riserva 2007
wine_name: Le Origini Amarone della Valpolicella Classico Riserva
wine_description: A deep and velvety garnet colour with a violet hue. A perfume of wild cherries, jam, mature pear, vanilla, liquorice and cedar wood. Full-bodied, warm on the palate with clear hints of cocoa and spices.

name: Château Bernadotte Haut-Médoc 2005
wine_description: This wine is both fresh and fruity with solid tanins. It is a Haut-Medoc in a style combining modernism and tradition.  Its texture will gain smoothness with ageing.

name: Penfolds Bin 311 Chardonnay 2017
wine_description: Explosive aromas of freshly crushed crab apples and lemon rind are completed by a subtle mineral aroma reminiscent of fresh sea air. on the palate, a lavish array of complex fruits combine with nectarous mouth watering acid. White stone fruits, figs and pick grapefruit are balanced by a creamed honey mid-palate. Color of pale white gold.

name: Tor del Colle Montepulciano d'Abruzzo Riserva 2017
wine_description: Deep ruby red colour with garnet flecks tending to purple with agein. Intense, vinous bouquet with an immediate cherry flavour changing to notes of blackberries and liquorice. Dry and herbaceous on the palate, it becomes round full-bodied and more balanced with age.

name: Château Haut-Batailley Pauillac (Grand Cru Classé) 2005
wine_description: Bright ruby color and intense nose of blackberry, cassis, cedar and fresh tobacco. Fine and dense with a beautiful refined personality.

name: Álvaro Palacios Vi de Vila Gratallops 2015
Château Haut-Brion Le Clarence de Haut Brion Pessac-Léognan (Château Bahans Haut-Brion) 2009
wine_name: Le Clarence de Haut Brion Pessac-Léognan (Château Bahans Haut-Brion)

name: Cos d'Estournel Cos d'Estournel 1997
wine_description: The call of faraway lands. As mysterious and intriguing as a lone adventurer returning from a solitary sail, Cos d’Estournel is slow to reveal itself. Little by little, it evokes stories of distant places, market stalls brimming with unfamiliar fruits, spices and wares, village festivities warmed by the joy of revelers and the setting sun, and sumptuous visions of ladies and their voluptuous curves. A myriad of scents, colors and tastes appeals to the senses. The Grand Vin of Cos d’Estournel is both demure and deliberately sensuous, a fascinating and elegant nectar.

name: Château Citran Haut-Médoc 2013
wine_description: It has beautiful intense black color with violet highlights.  Expressive, releasing aromas of ripe black fruit with light notes of roasting. Good attack with volume, very present black fruits, beautiful structure, well balanced tannins and harmony, rich mid-palate, long finish with silky tannins and leave its full potential aromatic.

name: Ricasoli Brolio-Bettino 2013
wine_description: Intense ruby colour. Fresh notes of ripe red fruit with clear hints of spicy herbs. Full-bodied & vigorous with a certain maturity and minerality, great elegance and character.

name: Château Saint-Pierre Saint-Julien (Grand Cru Classé) 2011
wine_description: Smoky and earthy, with copious jammy cassis fruit and sweet tannin, this is an excellent, full-bodied wine. The saturated deep purple color is followed by a persistent, concentrated wine with copious sweet tannin.

name: Château Olivier Pessac-Léognan (Grand Cru Classé) 2014
wine_description: he nose is very expressive, with ripe red fruit aromas as well as spicy nuances. The middle palate is velvety and full-bodied with rich, smooth tannin. This is a wine of substance, with a great balance between ripe aromatics, finesse, elegance… and a long aftertaste.

name: Château Labrousse Blaye - Côtes de Bordeaux 2016
wine_description: The color is sustained and brilliant and its bouquet is as elegant as greedy. it combines the fruity with the woody in a rich and dense bouquet.

name: Château Beaumont Haut-Médoc 2016
wine_description: Great intensity. Very deep colour with garnet reflections. The nose is very open and inviting with soft oaky notes of vanilla and spice bringing out the red fruits such as blackcurrant and black cherry. The attack on the palate is smooth and fresh. The tannic development is of great quality, with fatness giving real mouthfeel. The lightly oaked fruit aromas are very elegant and contribute to the fine aromatic persistence.

name: Château Maucaillou Moulis-en-Médoc 2015
wine_description: It is generally sumptuous in colour, with a particularly subtle and pleasantly fruity aromatic strength, very ripe and concentrated flavours. It is harmoniously balanced, expressive and generous, with finesse and elegance. It has a great length on the palate, with a lively appeal and remarkable cellaring potential thanks to very fine, yet clearly present, tannins.

name: Château de Camensac Haut-Médoc (Grand Cru Classé) 2008
Château Léoville Poyferré Château Moulin Riche Saint-Julien 2009
Château Giscours La Sirène de Giscours Margaux 2013
wine_description:
Deep purple color, soft concentrated nose of red fruits and fresh cut cedar. 
Mouth: some ripe fruit, some consentration and bitter, dry and short finish.

name: Château Langoa Barton Saint-Julien (Grand Cru Classé) 2006
wine_description: Blackberry, floral and dark chocolate follow through to a medium body, with fine tannins and a fresh finish. With notes of earth and black currant fruit submerged beneath a tannic structure.

name: Clos Rene Pomerol 2012
wine_description: It is a rich and complex wine with notes of coffee, caramel, smoke, violets and black currants. It has firm, silky tannins and it is well balanced.

name: Magaña Barón de Magaña (Finca La Sarda Crianza) 2010
wine_name: Barón de Magaña (Finca La Sarda Crianza)
wine_description: Dense color ruby purple, abundant notes of blackberry, camphor and flowers, in mouth with body great exuberance and purity, wonderful texture, round and generous finish.

name: Château Ducru-Beaucaillou Croix de Beaucaillou Saint-Julien 2014
M. Chapoutier Crozes-Hermitage La Petite Ruche 2017
wine_description: Colour : Deep purple red. Nose : Red fruits, blackcurrant and raspberry. Mouth : Fresh and round tasting with a finish of stewed fruits all in finess.

name: Bonneau du Martray Corton-Charlemagne Grand Cru 2007
Jean-Marc Brocard Chablis 2018
wine_description: Straw-coloured with green highlights. The nose is precise, frank, chiselled, with slightly iodized notes of citrus fruits. Sometimes are added aniseed, mentholated notes, with touches of orange blossom. The mouth has a very classic structure, crunchy and delicious, on notes of citrus fruits (lemon, crystallized lemon, lemon peel) and of minerality (iodized and salty touches). Finish is \"salivating\", very thirst-quenching.

name: Château Haut-Brion Le Clarence de Haut Brion Pessac-Léognan (Château Bahans Haut-Brion) 2008
wine_name: Le Clarence de Haut Brion Pessac-Léognan (Château Bahans Haut-Brion)

name: Mastroberardino Taurasi Radici 2006
wine_description: It is deep ruby red. Full, complex and intense, with notes of cherry, violet, wild berries and a distinctive spicy aroma. Fascinating and elegant in the mouth. With flavors of plum, black cherry, strawberry and intense spices.

name: Château Pontet-Canet Pauillac (Grand Cru Classé) 2015
wine_description: Very intense colour. Very intense nose, marked by notes of cherry, blackberry and redcurrant with traces of vanilla, liquorice and cedar. The attack is full to the palate. The tannins of great smoothness reveal a fine elegance. The finish, with no trace of aggressiveness, is marked by a good length.

name: Alphonse Mellot La Moussière Sancerre Blanc 2016
wine_description: It has lively like the look in your eyes, sweet like a kiss. Very fine gold colour with a green sheen. Its nose has a flowery fruity bouquet.

name: Bertani Amarone della Valpolicella Classico 2010
wine_description: Amarone Classico Bertani is a timeless wine that expresses the unique style that Bertani has always dedicatedly pursued. It is a classic style that does not need to change because it is always up-to-date. This wine has a deep garnet red colour. It presents a great variety of characters: dry fruit, liquorice and spice. It opens up in the mouth with all the red-berry fruits.

name: Conterno Fantino Barbera d'Alba Vignota 2015
wine_description: Ruby red in appearance. Elegantly scented with pleasant notes of ripe and sour cherry. Rich and velvety on the palate with a persistent length.

name: Dal Forno Romano Valpolicella Superiore Monte Lodoletta 2012
wine_description: This wine offers hints of blueberry, blackberry, cherry and chocolate which emerge gradually as the wine breathes. The potent tannins, which give structure to this product, are in perfect symbiosis with the velvety aromas of sweet spices and jam which envelop the palate and excite the senses.

name: Château Nénin Fugue de Nénin Pomerol 2010
wine_description: This vintage has a garnet color, intense nose of very pretty red fruit flavors and a sweet mouth in attack, roundness, without harshness, with lovely fruit.

name: Château Malescot St. Exupery Margaux (Grand Cru Classé) 2005
wine_description: Notes of graphite, black currant liqueur, incense and camphor make for a complex and intensely penetrating set of aromatics. Dark ruby/purple, medium to full-bodied, with superb concentration and moderate tannin, this wine is a beauty of finesse and substance.

name: Tenuta di Valgiano Palistorti Colline Lucchesi 2012
wine_description: The intense bouquet is reminiscent of spices and ripe fruit. Rich and full bodied on the palate with intense fruity aromas which give the wine its excellent enduring characteristics. The fresh structure is supported by the good content of mature, balanced tannins.

name: Château Maucaillou Moulis-en-Médoc 2005
wine_description: It is generally sumptuous in colour, with a particularly subtle and pleasantly fruity aromatic strength, very ripe and concentrated flavours. It is harmoniously balanced, expressive and generous, with finesse and elegance. It has a great length on the palate, with a lively appeal and remarkable cellaring potential thanks to very fine, yet clearly present, tannins.

name: Château de Rochemorin Pessac-Léognan 2015
wine_description: The attack is supple and fruity. Spicy, tobacco, tar or even find themselves in the final. This wine has a nice tannic structure and richness is typical of wines from Pessac-Léognan. The wooded, well controlled, provides additional structure to this wine that we take pleasure to drink now, but that we can also afford to wait a few years.

name: Shafer Hillside Select Cabernet Sauvignon 2008
wine_description: Aromas and flavours of dark cherry, black coffee, sweet vanilla and wet forest floor with rose petal, cranberry, blueberry, oregano, and sage.

name: Clos des Menuts Saint-Émilion Grand Cru 2014
wine_description: Deep and intense crimson robe. Fine nose of ripe grapes, with elegant toasted and vanilla oak aromas confirmed in the mouth. Elegance, balance and harmony.

name: Château Duhart-Milon Pauillac (Grand Cru Classé) 1996
wine_description: Dark with good concentration, and the nose has a tightly defined fruit character, reticent rather than open, with a light sprinkle of chalk over some floral, black fruits. The palate has a very polished style, with a shell of fruit sitting around a core of very firm tannins which, although a strong component of the blend, do not over-ride the other elements.

name: Château Langoa Barton Saint-Julien (Grand Cru Classé) 2010
wine_description: Blackberry, floral and dark chocolate follow through to a medium body, with fine tannins and a fresh finish. With notes of earth and black currant fruit submerged beneath a tannic structure.

name: Château Gazin Pomerol 2012
wine_description: Lavish richness offers a wide aromatic range of black and red fruits which harmonises with its intense purple colour. It also offers hints of mint, plum, chocolate, coffee or liquorice, a bouquet of almond, toast, tobacco and vanilla. Maturity gives it a nose of spices, truffles, undergrowth and gamey scents: fur, leather. Its taste is characterised by their silky tannins, their balance and concentration, enhanced by a delicate oaky note.

name: Château Gazin Pomerol 2012
wine_description: Lavish richness offers a wide aromatic range of black and red fruits which harmonises with its intense purple colour. It also offers hints of mint, plum, chocolate, coffee or liquorice, a bouquet of almond, toast, tobacco and vanilla. Maturity gives it a nose of spices, truffles, undergrowth and gamey scents: fur, leather. Its taste is characterised by their silky tannins, their balance and concentration, enhanced by a delicate oaky note.

name: Château Grand Corbin Les Charmes de Grand Corbin Saint-Émilion Grand Cru 2013
wine_name: Les Charmes de Grand Corbin Saint-Émilion Grand Cru
wine_description: Deeply colored with light woody notes, a juicy attack and very ripe tannins. Olive and grape aromas stand out, with a finish showing a nutty character of almonds and hazelnuts accompanied by great freshness and a savory touch.

name: Château Clerc Milon Pauillac (Grand Cru Classé) 2003
wine_description: The nose reveals finely toasted spice and tobacco notes combined with more intense aromas of red fruit and cherry stone with a mineral touch. The palate is full and well-defined, dominated by the lustre of succulent fruit and refined, flavoursome tannins that open on a hint of chocolate. The long, warm-hearted finish is lifted by a slightly saline taste.

name: Château La Lagune Haut-Médoc (Grand Cru Classé) 2012
Beaulieu Vineyard (BV) Georges De Latour Private Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon 2015
wine_name: Georges De Latour Private Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon
wine_description: It has aromas of crushed blackberries, dark cherries, bittersweet chocolate and violet. The elegant dark-fruit flavors, supported by firm, supple tannins, pick up distinctive minerality on the palate.

name: Louis Latour Beaujolais-Villages 2016
wine_description: It is ruby red in colour, It offers aromas of mocha, cherry and violet. On the palate this wine is ample, with violet and strawberry aromas and a nice tannic finish.

name: Château Saint-Pierre Saint-Julien (Grand Cru Classé) 2008
wine_description: Smoky and earthy, with copious jammy cassis fruit and sweet tannin, this is an excellent, full-bodied wine. The saturated deep purple color is followed by a persistent, concentrated wine with copious sweet tannin.

name: Château Cantenac Brown Margaux (Grand Cru Classé) 2006
Trimbach Pinot Gris Alsace Réserve 2016
wine_description: Very ripe and harmonious style. Rich with yellow juicy peaches on the nose as well as ripe pears : full bodied with ripe smoky tropical fruit flavours and a long slightly nutty finish.

name: Château Dassault Saint-Émilion Grand Cru (Grand Cru Classé) 2010
Château Olivier Pessac-Léognan (Grand Cru Classé) 2015
wine_description: he nose is very expressive, with ripe red fruit aromas as well as spicy nuances. The middle palate is velvety and full-bodied with rich, smooth tannin. This is a wine of substance, with a great balance between ripe aromatics, finesse, elegance… and a long aftertaste.

name: Trimbach Riesling Alsace Réserve 2016
wine_description:
Beautiful colour with green edges, the nose is developed and shows a hint of mineral flavour
associated with ripe Riesling fruits.

name: Shafer Hillside Select Cabernet Sauvignon 2009
wine_description: Aromas and flavours of dark cherry, black coffee, sweet vanilla and wet forest floor with rose petal, cranberry, blueberry, oregano, and sage.

name: Domaine Chante Cigale Châteauneuf-du-Pape 2016
wine_description: It has lots of warm black fruit and plum aromas, with cinnamon, spices, pepper and a hint of vanilla. The palate is concentrated with damsons, red fruit, spice and stony minerality with a very elegant and warm finish. The mouth is initially very silky but gives way to some mouth watering acidity and firm tannins.

name: Château Gazin L'Hospitalet de Gazin Pomerol 2010
wine_description: A dark, winey style, with flavors of steeped plum, kirsch and black cherry preserves, notes of singed spice and apple wood and a long, licorice-framed finish. Features a bit of chewy grip, but there's ample flesh at the core for balance.

name: La Braccesca Bramasole Syrah 2012
wine_description: The wine has a beautiful deep red color with violet undertones, which are typical of this varietal. The fragrance is intense, with subtle hints of vanilla blended with notes of mature fruit. It is a well-balanced and elegant wine, with flavors of red fruit and white plum. The finish is soft and lingering on the palate.

name: Domaine de la Janasse Châteauneuf-du-Pape Vieilles Vignes 2012
wine_description: The color is dark with purple reflections. The nose has discreet aromas of crushed black fruits and garrigue.

name: Château d'Aiguilhe Castillon - Côtes de Bordeaux 2007
wine_description: This powerful wine reflects its terroir with intensity and panache. Vigorous and fruity, it is a favourite of people who love wines of character.

name: Château de Camensac La Closerie de Camensac Haut-Médoc 2011
M. Chapoutier Châteauneuf-du-Pape La Bernardine 2016
wine_description: Colour: Intense crimson-red. Nose: Complex and subtle, blackcurrant and plum followed by roasted coffee and cinnamon, cherry, morello cherry. Mouth: Opening into spicy and fruity aromas.

name: Château Lanessan Haut-Médoc 2012
wine_description: Deeply colored and flavored, fuller than most Haut Medocs. Spice, anise, tar, black-currant and plum flavors lend it complexity and character.

name: Gómez Cruzado Reserva 2012
wine_description: Clean and shiny, dark red cherry colored. Very expressive nose, with the tertiary aromas of the ageing displaying vanilla, cocoa and orange peel, and those of the variety, showing dark and candied fruit. In the mouth it’s rounded, fresh, with a fine acidity, silky tannins and fruit driven aftertaste.

name: Château d'Armailhac Pauillac (Grand Cru Classé) 1996
wine_description: A dense and deep red with a violet tint, the wine has a still slightly reserved nose which opens with airing on hints of cassis, blackberry and fresh red fruit mingled with touches of cedarwood. The attack is nicely rounded, with well-integrated tannins that fill out on a mid-palate full of fruit. The flavours linger pleasingly in a full and expressive finish that gives the wine a fine overall balance.

name: Château du Tertre Margaux (Grand Cru Classé) 2015
wine_description: Great sweetness and flavour. Silky and freshness are combined in this flask to bring you the elegance expected of a great Margaux wine.

name: Château Pedesclaux Fleur de Pedesclaux Pauillac 2014
Pio Cesare Barbaresco 2014
wine_description: Elegance and velvety, with ripe and spicy fruit. Strong tannins, but elegant. Good structure and concentration. Very long life.

name: Château Lascombes Chevalier de Lascombes Margaux 2014
wine_description: A dark, complex wine, which delivers so much weight and richness. It is boasting powerful tannins and fine acidity against a backdrop of full, generous fruits.

name: Château Grand-Puy-Lacoste Pauillac (Grand Cru Classé) 2014
wine_description: Exhibits classic Pauillac aromas and flavors of creme de cassis along with stony/floral notes.

name: Pieropan Soave Classico 2019
wine_description:
Brilliant straw yellow colour with greenish hints. The delicate nose is reminiscent of almond blossoms and marzipan. Good depth of fruit
on the palate, nicely balanced by a zingy acidity that enhances its long length.

name: La Chablisienne Chablis 1er Cru 'Côte de Lechet' 2015
Caiarossa Toscana 2013
wine_description: The nose of this wine offers a whirl of aromas ranging from hints of caramel to small red forest fruit and notes of spice, rich balsamic and deep minerals. The mouth confirms the lightness and elegance found on the nose and the tannins are alive and compact.

name: Château Lynch-Moussas Pauillac (Grand Cru Classé) 2015
wine_description: Deep dark ruby red color. Complex and elegant nose dominated by fresh red fruit. Rich texture on the palate which shows a solid tannic backbone with plenty of woody and toasted notes. Its long and striking finish promises a superb longevity.

name: Bruno Rocca Barbaresco Rabajà 2014
wine_description: Garnet red, intense and deep. Perfume that envelops the nose with hints of sweet wood (vanilla, hazelnut) and buttery notes that close then to the fruit of raspberry and cherry. Taste: warm, enveloping, with soft tannins and acids; elegant, luxurious aftertaste that lingers well with flavors already warned the nose.

name: Château Meyney Saint-Estèphe 2008
wine_description: Shows notes of leather and musk after a period of time. It is full-bodied, well-rounded and structured. After ageing, the wine displays the remarkable charm of the best Saint-Estèphe: complexity, balance and harmony.

name: Château Léoville Las Cases Saint-Julien (Grand Cru Classé) 1983
Fattoria le Pupille Poggio Valente 2009
wine_description: It has an intense ruby red colour with orange reflections which denote the evolution of Sangiovese throughout the years.

name: Contino Reserva 2014
wine_description: Ruby red, clean, middle layer, nose of red fruits and vanilla, intense. The palate is broad, tasty, with warmth and long aftertaste, very round and balanced.

name: Château La Lagune Haut-Médoc (Grand Cru Classé) 2004
Domaine A. et P. de Villaine Bouzeron 2017
wine_description: Straw Yellow. Medium Intensity, developing, citrus fruits, floral, herbaceous. 	Medium Bodied, dry, medium acidity, moderate intensity, medium-long finish, lemon, green apple, mineral.

name: Château Cote de Baleau Saint-Émilion Grand Cru (Grand Cru Classé) 2011
Château Gruaud Larose Sarget de Gruaud-Larose Saint-Julien 2013
wine_description: Lovely deep ruby appearance with purple hints. The nose shows aromas of red fruits, fresh cherry, raspberry, light spices. Lots of freshness in the mouth. Fine balance with a great finish.

name: Paul Jaboulet Aîné Hermitage La Chapelle Rouge 2004
wine_description: Intense ruby red, limpid and bright. Highly complex, distinguished nose, revealing the great finesse. Black fruits, sweet spices and, ultimately, finely woody. It is shaped by nature, the sun and the rain. That's why every year, this wine is unique. Discover, vintage by vintage, that gave us this land.

name: Cordero di Montezemolo Barolo Monfalletto 2015
wine_description: Intense garnet in color, the nose shows floral and spicy notes perfectly blended: tobacco, cherries, cocoa and fresh raspberry highlights. The palate is rich, full-bodied and elegant.

name: Château Smith Haut-Lafitte Les Hauts de Smith Pessac-Léognan 2015
Viu Manent Gran Reserva Carmenère 2018
wine_description: Intense ruby red with a mahogany red hue. The nose presents tremendous fruity intensity and freshness with aromas that recall red fruits such as cherries, wild berries, and light notes of spices that lend complexity. The palate is very well balanced with good evolution, marked by its verticality and elegance. Very persistent with a lush, intense finish.

name: Château Cantemerle Les Allées de Cantemerle Haut-Médoc 2014
wine_description:
This wine’s black cherry and deep garnet color is typical of Bordeaux. Its expressive aromas open up to show very fruity, raspberry notes. In the
mouth the wine is immediately accessible,
notable for its charm and floral character.

name: Château Beau-Sejour Becot Saint-Émilion Grand Cru (Premier Grand Cru Classé) 2009
wine_name: Saint-Émilion Grand Cru (Premier Grand Cru Classé)

name: Henri Bourgeois Pouilly-Fumé En Travertin 2017
wine_description: It has aromatic, floral and smoked nature of the  grape variety is the most dominant aspect of this charming wine.  It displays its elegance, fruitiness and roundness and is very persistent in the mouth.

name: Château Sociando-Mallet La Demoiselle de Sociando-Mallet Haut-Médoc 2009
Château Sociando-Mallet Haut-Médoc 1990
wine_description: Opaque black/purple colour, with notes of crushed rock, white flowers, graphite, blueberry and cassis, the wine is tight and needs to be coaxed from the glass. It is medium to full-bodied, with an excruciatingly tough-textured finish.

name: Château du Glana Saint-Julien 2014
wine_description: It has medium bodied, soft, already approachable with its open, black cherry, earth, red plum, oak and tobacco profile.

name: Château de Marsannay Marsannay 2014
wine_description: Deep cherry color with fresh ripe aromas and slightly smoked notes. Supple, full and well-balanced with spicy aromas.

name: Tenuta Il Poggione Rosso di Montalcino 2014
wine_description: Intense ruby red colour. Fruity bouquet with red berry notes. Very well structured, yet soft, long-lasting flavour with smooth, velvety tannins.

name: Château Ferrière Margaux (Grand Cru Classé) 2012
wine_description: Good black cherry and cream character. The palate has fine substance, with a slightly leaner midpalate, stony fruit and light tannic structure.

name: Cosse Maisonneuve Le Combal Cahors 2014
wine_description:
A typical black wine of Cahors, with elegance & balance. The nose is all delightful prunes & liquorice, reprised on the palate with chewy fruit & a creamy note from very subtle oak ageing. 
 
A powerful and full-bodied wine to be enjoyed with red meat dishes with simple but full flavours.

name: Paul Jaboulet Aîné Parallèle 45 Côtes Du Rhône Blanc 2015
wine_description: It has pale yellow colour with green hues. Aromatic and fresh white flowers and citrus. Ample and warm with a nice freshness in the final.

name: Château de Camensac La Closerie de Camensac Haut-Médoc 2010
Château Haut-Bages Libéral Pauillac (Grand Cru Classé) 2015
wine_description:
Characterised by its red and blackberries aromas but also minerality and cedar. The nose
and the mouth show some freshness. A nice balance with fine tannins. Slightly peppery with a hint of clove.

name: Château Malescot St. Exupery Margaux (Grand Cru Classé) 2014
wine_description: Notes of graphite, black currant liqueur, incense and camphor make for a complex and intensely penetrating set of aromatics. Dark ruby/purple, medium to full-bodied, with superb concentration and moderate tannin, this wine is a beauty of finesse and substance.

name: Château Pichon Baron Les Griffons Pauillac 2012
Château Valandraud Saint-Émilion Grand Cru (Premier Grand Cru Classé) 2012
wine_name: Saint-Émilion Grand Cru (Premier Grand Cru Classé)

name: Château de Fieuzal Pessac-Léognan (Grand Cru Classé de Graves) 2015
Château Nénin Fugue de Nénin Pomerol 2009
wine_description: This vintage has a garnet color, intense nose of very pretty red fruit flavors and a sweet mouth in attack, roundness, without harshness, with lovely fruit.

name: Château Peyrabon Château La Fleur Peyrabon Pauillac 2015
Bodega Campo Eliseo Campo Alegre 2012
wine_description:
EYE : Lovely colour of morello cherries.

NOSE : The nose is expressive with aromas of red fruits, cocoa and light notes of spice.

MOUTH : On the palate it is round, structured and tannic.

name: Domaine Antonin Guyon Bourgogne Hautes-Côtes de Nuits 'Les Dames de Vergy' 2015
wine_name: Bourgogne Hautes-Côtes de Nuits 'Les Dames de Vergy'
wine_description: It has beautiful dark ruby color with aromas of berries. Very stylish and good persistence in the mouth. Rich, well balanced with great finesse.

name: Grattamacco Bolgheri Superiore 2016
wine_description: The taste of this wine reverberates the elegance of the vintage characters, presenting a jaunty aromatic intensity, where we find the characteristic fruity and balsamic notes and its own bloody imprint. The patient maturation of the skins and pips is felt in the fragrance of the tannin and acidity lively vein that accompanies the broad flavour in the final.

name: Château Potensac Chapelle de Potensac Médoc 2013
wine_description: Excellent notes of crushed rocks, red and black currants, licorice and earth. Supple-textured, medium-bodied and nicely concentrated, it should provide pleasure over the next 7-10 years.

name: Paul Jaboulet Aîné Hermitage La Chapelle Rouge 2006
wine_description: Intense ruby red, limpid and bright. Highly complex, distinguished nose, revealing the great finesse. Black fruits, sweet spices and, ultimately, finely woody. It is shaped by nature, the sun and the rain. That's why every year, this wine is unique. Discover, vintage by vintage, that gave us this land.

name: Castello Monaci Negroamaro Salento Maru 2017
wine_description: Garnet-red colour; intense bouquet, full and satisfying flavour even if slightly bitter, round, and of excellent structure.

name: Château Canon-La-Gaffelière Saint-Émilion Grand Cru (Premier Grand Cru Classé) 2009
wine_name: Saint-Émilion Grand Cru (Premier Grand Cru Classé)

name: Château Troplong Mondot Saint-Émilion Grand Cru (Premier Grand Cru Classé) 2010
wine_name: Saint-Émilion Grand Cru (Premier Grand Cru Classé)

name: Château La Fleur-Pétrus Pomerol 2011
wine_description: On the nose a tight core of black fruits, blackcurrants and dark cherries. Beautifully textured on the palate, sweet and quite fleshy, supple and flattering. Lots of ripe tannins but they are very well hidden by this layer of fruit, with a lovely sense of grip coming in. Great acidity at the core. Wonderful structure and balance here, and an elegant substance to the finish.

name: Château Potensac Chapelle de Potensac Médoc 2015
wine_description: Excellent notes of crushed rocks, red and black currants, licorice and earth. Supple-textured, medium-bodied and nicely concentrated, it should provide pleasure over the next 7-10 years.

name: Domaine A. et P. de Villaine Bouzeron 2016
wine_description: Straw Yellow. Medium Intensity, developing, citrus fruits, floral, herbaceous. 	Medium Bodied, dry, medium acidity, moderate intensity, medium-long finish, lemon, green apple, mineral.

name: Alain Jaume Domaine Grand Veneur Côtes du Rhône Les Champauvins 2017
wine_name: Domaine Grand Veneur Côtes du Rhône Les Champauvins
wine_description: It has intense, brilliant garnet-red color. The aromas of woods and ripe red berries are typical of the terroir. The tannic structure is elegant and smooth. The finish is dominated by slight touches of spices and truffles. A complete wine, rich and fine.

name: Château Dauzac Margaux (Grand Cru Classé) 2014
wine_description: Back on the palate with dark fruit notes with a liveliness giving an elegant freshness. In the final, this liquorice aromas with a long cool confirming the quality of Cabernet Sauvignon. The precise tannins guarantee a nice development.

name: Château Rauzan-Ségla Margaux (Grand Cru Classé) 2010
wine_description: Candied confectionary nose along with some Margaux perfume and flowers. Palate is nicely fresh. Sweet and modern, with rich berry flavours, balanced and nicely proportioned until the finish.

name: Château Prieuré-Lichine Confidences de Prieuré-Lichine Margaux 2014
wine_description: Quite a sweet-fruit nose makes itself known to start with, then ripe flavors and modest tannins make this very approachable. It’s only the finish that’s a little dry and angular.

name: Château Gazin Pomerol 2008
wine_description: Lavish richness offers a wide aromatic range of black and red fruits which harmonises with its intense purple colour. It also offers hints of mint, plum, chocolate, coffee or liquorice, a bouquet of almond, toast, tobacco and vanilla. Maturity gives it a nose of spices, truffles, undergrowth and gamey scents: fur, leather. Its taste is characterised by their silky tannins, their balance and concentration, enhanced by a delicate oaky note.

name: Château Poujeaux Moulis-en-Médoc 2015
wine_description: Lovely bright fruit, with a crystalline black summer berry character. The palate has good freshness, with a crisp style, and crunchy black fruits. There is even a little suppleness to it. Firm, tannic backbone too, with good acidity.

name: Altesino Brunello di Montalcino  Montosoli 2011
wine_description: It has a deep ruby red colour which turns a garnet red with age. Its bouquet has outstanding character with hints of black cherry, blackberries, raspberries, violet, liquorice, vanilla and a slight accent of pink peppercorn.

name: Protos Reserva 2014
wine_description: This elegant wine comes from 50 year old vineyards from the Burgos region of Ribera del Duero. With 18 months of mostly French barrels and another 18 months in bottle, it delivers a perfect blend of ripe fruits and wood flavors.

name: Château Bouscaut Pessac-Léognan (Grand Cru Classé de Graves) 2012
Château La Gaffelière Saint-Émilion Grand Cru (Premier Grand Cru Classé) 2011
wine_name: Saint-Émilion Grand Cru (Premier Grand Cru Classé)
wine_description: Red color of average intensity. Fruity, fresh and ripe nose. Caressing on the palate of fruity and fresh type. Developing very tasty, the wine evolves with coated tannins and a lovely violet aroma in its persistence.

name: Finca Bacara Crazy Grapes Monastrell 2015
wine_description: Pale red color and clean with vivid tones typical of his youth. On the nose, there are attractive floral aromas with hints of ripe fruit and a balsamic background. In the mouth is a balanced wine, sweet, acidity correct, unctuous, smooth and persistent finish.

name: Château Léoville Las Cases Saint-Julien (Grand Cru Classé) 1997
Château Grand Corbin-Despagne Saint-Émilion Grand Cru (Grand Cru Classé) 2010
Château Grand-Puy Ducasse Pauillac (Grand Cru Classé) 2014
wine_description: Dark red center and a bluish hue. Intense aromas of blackcurrant, black cherries, shoe polish and herbs on the classic Bordeaux nose. Juicy blackcurrant fruit on the palate backed by nuances of graphite, iron, herbs and chocolate. The taste stretches well over the mipalate and finish.

name: Georges Vigouroux Gouleyant Malbec 2017
wine_description: Its color is dark cherry red. Its nose is typical of the shows notes of ripe red and black fruits such as Cherry, blackberry, Raspberry. Its mouth is also very fruity and finishes on soft and elegant tannins.

name: Château Saint-Pierre Saint-Julien (Grand Cru Classé) 2006
wine_description: Smoky and earthy, with copious jammy cassis fruit and sweet tannin, this is an excellent, full-bodied wine. The saturated deep purple color is followed by a persistent, concentrated wine with copious sweet tannin.

name: Bruno Rocca Barbaresco Rabajà 2013
wine_description: Garnet red, intense and deep. Perfume that envelops the nose with hints of sweet wood (vanilla, hazelnut) and buttery notes that close then to the fruit of raspberry and cherry. Taste: warm, enveloping, with soft tannins and acids; elegant, luxurious aftertaste that lingers well with flavors already warned the nose.

name: Château Gazin Pomerol 1999
wine_description: Lavish richness offers a wide aromatic range of black and red fruits which harmonises with its intense purple colour. It also offers hints of mint, plum, chocolate, coffee or liquorice, a bouquet of almond, toast, tobacco and vanilla. Maturity gives it a nose of spices, truffles, undergrowth and gamey scents: fur, leather. Its taste is characterised by their silky tannins, their balance and concentration, enhanced by a delicate oaky note.

name: Muga Torre Muga 2015
wine_description: A bright, luminous Bordeaux-red colour with a very complex aroma and a perfect combination of fruit, spice and mineral nuances. In its underlying aroma you can find lovely hints of minerals and new leather. On the palate, it has an elegant attack, proud in its evolution and tasty in its lingering aftertaste. A supple, full-bodied, complex wine with a magnificent finish.

name: Clos des Lunes Lune d'Argent 2017
wine_description:
Pale gold color with green hues.
Lively citrus nose,  coated with sweet aromas of acacia and lime.
Rich pulpy flesh of ripe Semillon.  Delicious mineral complexity. The acidity of Sauvignon provides a good tension.
Balanced and fruity long finish

name: Penfolds St. Henri Shiraz 2016
wine_description: Dark garnet with a deep core. Floral, perfumed, fresh. Boiled-fruitcake mix - nutmeg/cinnamon and mixed spices are laced with glacéed (Cointreau-like) citrus fruits. Subtle praline & liquorice trail on the finish. Medium to full-bodied with an acid/tannin conveyance propelling flavour to the back-palate.

name: J.A. Ferret Pouilly-Fuissé 2016
wine_description: Great balance between weight and freshness, with elegance derived from seamless minerality. Layers of subtle fruit notes combine stone fruits, acacia flowers and spiced hazelnut butter. The finish is long, intense and spicy. A wine whose balance permits it to age gracefully.

name: Château La Mission Haut-Brion Pessac-Léognan (Grand Cru Classé de Graves) 2007
Château La Conseillante Pomerol 2011
wine_description: Very fine, round, very fruity wine, which will provide great tasting pleasure even when young. It is very well balanced and shows lovely freshness, underpinned by a medium structure.

name: Château Mazeyres Pomerol 2012
wine_description: Ruby color with purple glints. A touch of vanilla on the first nose then notes of hazelnuts. Black-cherry and raspberry when the wine evolves. The attack is soft and subtile and the tannins are developed with charm on the palate. A light touch of oak is giving complexity to the wine.

name: Château Pichon Baron Pauillac (Grand Cru Classé) 1997
wine_description: A wine of great personality with fresh red-fruit and blackberry scents. It is quick to express itself on the palate, rolling out its assertive, powerful character and rich flesh. The finish is very long-lasting, with dense, precise tannins. A finely-balanced wine of substance with firm structure and body.

name: Château La Fleur de Boüard Lalande-de-Pomerol 2013
wine_description: Cassis, earth and graphite notes were mixed with mocha and toast on the nose. Very deep though, and quite lovely. Palate was rich, with tons of cassis, along with more graphite, some herbs and a toss of earth, all nicely balanced. Decent length, nice flavours of cassis, green pepper and some smoky coffee ground.

name: Château Dassault Saint-Émilion Grand Cru (Grand Cru Classé) 2012
Mas Doix Salanques Priorat 2013
wine_description: Intense, red-fruited aromas over notes of leather and tar. The blackberry toned palate has an equally tarry richness, brightened by a fresh line of refreshing citrus acidity. Complex, bold and generous with superb, harmonious length.

name: Domaine Breton - Catherine & Pierre Breton Trinch! 2018
Château Canon-La-Gaffelière Saint-Émilion Grand Cru (Premier Grand Cru Classé) 2015
wine_name: Saint-Émilion Grand Cru (Premier Grand Cru Classé)

name: Domenico Clerico Barbera d'Alba Trevigne 2015
wine_description: It has deep dark color, the nose is rich of ripe black cherry and peppery. Balanced and elegant: very round wine, with perfect combination of acidity, fruit and body. Very rich, but elegant.

name: Newton Cabernet Sauvignon Unfiltered 2016
wine_description: Aromas of Dutch cocoa, mulberry, vanillan oak and herb-infused tapenade lead to a rich and full and plush palate.

name: Château La Fleur de Boüard Lalande-de-Pomerol 2014
wine_description: Cassis, earth and graphite notes were mixed with mocha and toast on the nose. Very deep though, and quite lovely. Palate was rich, with tons of cassis, along with more graphite, some herbs and a toss of earth, all nicely balanced. Decent length, nice flavours of cassis, green pepper and some smoky coffee ground.

name: Château Marquis de Terme Margaux (Grand Cru Classé) 2006
wine_description: Deep ruby ​​red in color with orange reflections, with a characteristic of small wild berries, including cassis and blueberry, with slightly smoky notes of frankincense and spicy tones of black pepper and cloves. Incredibly expressive on the palate, in a perfect blend of fruit freshness and woody notes,leading to a masterful tannins. An accessible style that confirms the long sweet spices final.

name: Penfolds RWT Shiraz 2015
wine_description: Deep, dark magenta. On the nose, dark spices and saturated fresh regional Shiraz fruits with telltale wafts of blueberry, blackberry, liquorice and black olive. Secondary notes of rosemary, peppercorn, thyme, juices of beef - verging on that of a terrine/corned beef. Subtle cedary French oak in the background.

name: Château Pedesclaux Pauillac (Grand Cru Classé) 2013
wine_description: This wine's beautiful purple color is very deep, the nose is very aromatic with nice ripe black fruit. It is  round and harmonious on the palate with silky tannins and a long finish.

name: Trimbach Riesling Alsace Cuvée Frédéric Emile 2010
wine_description: This harmonious wine is very rich and fat, but has no residual sugar and has a wonderful mineral structure.

name: Château Joanin Bécot Castillon - Côtes de Bordeaux 2011
Château Cap de Faugères Castillon - Côtes de Bordeaux 2015
wine_description: Medium bodied, with some berry and mineral character and a good finish.

name: Château Lynch-Moussas Pauillac (Grand Cru Classé) 2013
wine_description: Deep dark ruby red color. Complex and elegant nose dominated by fresh red fruit. Rich texture on the palate which shows a solid tannic backbone with plenty of woody and toasted notes. Its long and striking finish promises a superb longevity.

name: Petrolo Toscana Torrione 2015
wine_description: Deep ruby colour with some hints of purple at the rim, almost black at the core. Full aromas of black currant, cherry and some fresh red currant with hints of leather and mint. Full bodied with lots of concentrated fruit, fresh acidity and chewy tannins. Long finish.

name: Château Gazin L'Hospitalet de Gazin Pomerol 2012
wine_description: A dark, winey style, with flavors of steeped plum, kirsch and black cherry preserves, notes of singed spice and apple wood and a long, licorice-framed finish. Features a bit of chewy grip, but there's ample flesh at the core for balance.

name: Château Prieuré-Lichine Confidences de Prieuré-Lichine Margaux 2012
wine_description: Quite a sweet-fruit nose makes itself known to start with, then ripe flavors and modest tannins make this very approachable. It’s only the finish that’s a little dry and angular.

name: Château Haut-Bailly La Parde de Haut-Bailly Pessac-Léognan 2012
Château Lascombes Chevalier de Lascombes Margaux 2015
wine_description: A dark, complex wine, which delivers so much weight and richness. It is boasting powerful tannins and fine acidity against a backdrop of full, generous fruits.

name: Joseph Drouhin Beaune 1er Cru 'Clos des Mouches' 2011
wine_description: Primary notes of red fruit dominate, such as Morello cherry, raspberry, blackberry. There are hints of complexity with smoky flavours evolving towards liquorice. When the wine is maturing, aromas of pepper, tobacco, humus and undergrowth appear.

name: Domaine Drouhin Arthur Chardonnay 2015
wine_description: It has finely balanced with a wonderful round texture and excellent length.

name: Château La Pointe Pomerol 2014
wine_description: The colour is dense, with dark purple tints. Aromas of violet and small forest fruit gently appear. They are followed by cedar, black spices and sandalwood. The palate is smooth and creamy, yet not at all heavy ; beautifully fresh and well-balanced. The length is impressive, caressing and voluptuous with an inviting, mouth-watering finish.

name: Château Poujeaux La Salle de Poujeaux Moulis 2011
Paul Jaboulet Aîné Hermitage La Chapelle Rouge 2007
wine_description: Intense ruby red, limpid and bright. Highly complex, distinguished nose, revealing the great finesse. Black fruits, sweet spices and, ultimately, finely woody. It is shaped by nature, the sun and the rain. That's why every year, this wine is unique. Discover, vintage by vintage, that gave us this land.

name: Château Faugères Saint-Émilion Grand Cru (Grand Cru Classé) 2012
Trimbach Riesling Alsace Réserve 2015
wine_description:
Beautiful colour with green edges, the nose is developed and shows a hint of mineral flavour
associated with ripe Riesling fruits.

name: Château Léoville Las Cases Saint-Julien (Grand Cru Classé) 2010
Château Haut-Bages Libéral Pauillac (Grand Cru Classé) 2003
wine_description:
Characterised by its red and blackberries aromas but also minerality and cedar. The nose
and the mouth show some freshness. A nice balance with fine tannins. Slightly peppery with a hint of clove.

name: Château Grand Corbin Saint-Émilion Grand Cru (Grand Cru Classé) 2012
Château Troplong Mondot Saint-Émilion Grand Cru (Premier Grand Cru Classé) 2009
wine_name: Saint-Émilion Grand Cru (Premier Grand Cru Classé)

name: E. Guigal Crozes-Hermitage Blanc 2014
wine_description: Golden yellow colour. Aromas of white flowers such as hawthorn blossom and acacia. Delicate oak. Fine and elegant on the palate with a full, round and rich body. Overall a remarkable freshness with all the finesse and richness of the appellation.

name: Penfolds RWT Shiraz 2014
wine_description: Deep, dark magenta. On the nose, dark spices and saturated fresh regional Shiraz fruits with telltale wafts of blueberry, blackberry, liquorice and black olive. Secondary notes of rosemary, peppercorn, thyme, juices of beef - verging on that of a terrine/corned beef. Subtle cedary French oak in the background.

name: Paul Jaboulet Aîné Hermitage La Petite Chapelle 2012
wine_description: It has intense and aromatic with sweet spices, floral notes as well as very ripe fruit. Powerful and harmonious and a very long finish.

name: Château Cantemerle Haut-Médoc (Grand Cru Classé) 2016
wine_description: Attractive aromas of pepper and licorice, evolving towards red fruit after agitation. The palate shows a harmonious marriage of charm and firmness based on soft, ripe, and very smooth tannins.

name: Château Léoville Las Cases Clos du Marquis Saint-Julien 2001
Château Le Crock Saint-Estèphe 2008
wine_description: This is a rich and powerful wine, with a great aromatic complexity. It presents powerful tannins, a  rich bouquet underlined by a fleshy, full structure that will gain in finesse as the years go by, giving a complex and elegant wine.

name: Antinori Castello della Sala Cervaro della Sala 2018
wine_name: Castello della Sala Cervaro della Sala

name: David Duband Bourgogne Pinot Noir 2017
wine_description: Beautifully pure, with aromas of peonies. The graceful mouthfeel is built around very fine, light tannins.

name: Tabali Reserva Viognier 2013
wine_description: This aromatic and subtle Viognier presents a clean yellow color. In the nose the citric notes, white pepper, ginger and chirimoya.

name: Château du Glana Saint-Julien 2015
wine_description: It has medium bodied, soft, already approachable with its open, black cherry, earth, red plum, oak and tobacco profile.

name: Gérard Bertrand Perles de Sauvignon Blanc 2018
Château Pedesclaux Fleur de Pedesclaux Pauillac 2013
Château Pavie Macquin Saint-Émilion Grand Cru (Premier Grand Cru Classé) 2008
wine_name: Saint-Émilion Grand Cru (Premier Grand Cru Classé)

name: Domaine de Trévallon Alpilles Rouge 2014
wine_description: Dark chocolate, eucalyptus, and ripe blackcurrant and blackcurrant leaf on the nose. The palate is superbly balanced, with reams of ripe cassis fruit, full bodied, but fresh and lively.

name: Château l'Évangile Pomerol 2006
wine_description: Deep, dark colour with hints of violet. Very fruity nose with dark berries (Morello cherries, blackcurrants) and fresh notes of mocha and toast. On the palate, the attack is refined and silky, with a powerful, balanced tannic structure. The texture is dense and very velvety thanks to the ripe, well-coated tannins. The finish is long with fruity notes, but is dominated by the quality of the tannins.

name: Fleur La Mothe Médoc 2011
wine_description: Dark cherry, boysenberry and dark plum fruit with touches of dried rose petal. The palate is medium bodied with crisp acidity on the entry. It is cohesive and harmonious with a natural, blackberry and sous bois infused finish that glides across the mouth

name: Château La Tour de Mons Margaux 2016
wine_description: With an intense colour, the wine displays a very broad aromatic range. Elegant and distinguished, this enticing wine has a fantastic potential for ageing.

name: Fèlsina Fontalloro 2012
wine_description: A rich, brilliant ruby red. Good spice on the nose, with generous notes of tobacco and wet earth (and of dry earth as well). The palate is supported by a hefty charge of medium-smooth tannins to ensure the required lengthy ageing. Superb weight and structure, with a classic finish. Significant cellarability in great vintages.

name: Cos d'Estournel Cos d'Estournel 1993
wine_description: The call of faraway lands. As mysterious and intriguing as a lone adventurer returning from a solitary sail, Cos d’Estournel is slow to reveal itself. Little by little, it evokes stories of distant places, market stalls brimming with unfamiliar fruits, spices and wares, village festivities warmed by the joy of revelers and the setting sun, and sumptuous visions of ladies and their voluptuous curves. A myriad of scents, colors and tastes appeals to the senses. The Grand Vin of Cos d’Estournel is both demure and deliberately sensuous, a fascinating and elegant nectar.

name: Château des Adouzes Le Tigre Faugères 2017
wine_description:
Intense ruby red color. Cassis and raspberry on the nose with hints of pepper and spice. Good structure yet
balanced on the palate thanks to the freshness.

name: Couly-Dutheil Les Gravières Chinon 2015
wine_description: It is beautiful purple color, with very pleasant aromatics of green pepper and small red fruits. Fruity on the palate, making it easy to drink and very charming.A wonderful pairing with chicken, veal, and ham.

name: Château Grand Corbin-Despagne Saint-Émilion Grand Cru (Grand Cru Classé) 2011
Château Canon Saint-Émilion Grand Cru (Premier Grand Cru Classé) 2005
wine_name: Saint-Émilion Grand Cru (Premier Grand Cru Classé)

name: Odfjell Orzada Carignan 2016
wine_description: Deep and intense ruby color with a touch of violet. This wine displays a never ending mix of aromas such as cherry liqueur, liquorice, black fruits and mushrooms, with additional notes of apricots, white peaches, pears and a touch of lychee.

name: Stephane Montez - Domaine du Monteillet Cuvée du Papy Saint-Joseph 2017
Château Paloumey Haut-Médoc 2015
wine_description: Spice, cedar and cinnamon on the nose. Ample, positive damson and plum frut with a neat oak overlay. Structured, ripe tannins and soft, balanced acidity and a fine, dry finish.

name: Bonneau du Martray Corton-Charlemagne Grand Cru 2005
Château Carbonnieux Château Tour Léognan Pessac-Léognan 2013
wine_description: The wine had a deep ruby color and was wonderfully soft on the palate. It had aromas of red fruit and cinnamon.

name: Château de Fonbel Saint-Émilion Grand Cru 2014
wine_description: Herbs, strawberry and spice are in the nose, followed by a medium bodied, crisp, bright cherry finish.

name: Clos de l'Oratoire Saint-Émilion Grand Cru (Grand Cru Classé) 2014
Château Pichon Baron Pauillac (Grand Cru Classé) 2013
wine_description: A wine of great personality with fresh red-fruit and blackberry scents. It is quick to express itself on the palate, rolling out its assertive, powerful character and rich flesh. The finish is very long-lasting, with dense, precise tannins. A finely-balanced wine of substance with firm structure and body.

name: Château Calon-Ségur Marquis de Calon Saint-Estèphe 2016
wine_description: The estate’s Second Wine is a different expression of the Calon terroir. With an average proportion of 75% Merlot in the blend, it is enjoyable to drink in the immediate term and exhibits a warm and velvety character. It is aged in barrels, a third of which are new, for up to 18 months.

name: Château Saint-Pierre Saint-Julien (Grand Cru Classé) 2012
wine_description: Smoky and earthy, with copious jammy cassis fruit and sweet tannin, this is an excellent, full-bodied wine. The saturated deep purple color is followed by a persistent, concentrated wine with copious sweet tannin.

name: Château La Tour Carnet Haut-Médoc (Grand Cru Classé) 2013
wine_description: Color is deep garnet color with mahogany reflections slightly tuilés.  The nose is complex, we recognize in this order, blackcurrant, plum. Secondly, it is the spices that are expressed as cinnamon. Roasting the notes then appear in the form of wood burned. The mouth: Franche, mouth lets perceive immediately the incredible delicacy of tannins, coated, perfectly balanced. On the palate, ripe fruit and roasting.

name: Château Lafite Rothschild Carruades de Lafite Pauillac 1999
wine_description: Heady, floral nose with exceptional complexity. On the palate, fine balance on the attack continues with good flavour expression before a fairly long finish with lovely structure, still lively and with a hint of woodiness.

name: Château Marquis de Terme Margaux (Grand Cru Classé) 2015
wine_description: Deep ruby ​​red in color with orange reflections, with a characteristic of small wild berries, including cassis and blueberry, with slightly smoky notes of frankincense and spicy tones of black pepper and cloves. Incredibly expressive on the palate, in a perfect blend of fruit freshness and woody notes,leading to a masterful tannins. An accessible style that confirms the long sweet spices final.

name: Francis Ford Coppola Diamond Collection Zinfandel (Red Label) 2017
wine_description: Sourced from ‘old vines’ in Amador County and cooler vineyards in Paso Robles and Sonoma, our Zinfandel has exceptional depth and complexity. Petite Sirah is blended in to further enhance the luscious strawberry jam, cassis and briar flavors that follow its perfume of dark fruit, sweet spice and toasty vanilla.

name: Domaine de Chevalier L'Esprit de Chevalier Pessac-Léognan 2011
wine_description: It is rich, lively, and complex with very pure aromas. It is a fruity, classy wine, but more open than the grand vin and therefore a treat to drink young.

name: Château Léoville Barton Saint-Julien (Grand Cru Classé) 2013
wine_description: This wine has an opaque dark red violet colour. With lovely herbal, lavender and blackberry notes on the nose. Tart berry, blackberry, black fruit palate with depth and sweet tannins.

name: Château La Gaffelière Saint-Émilion Grand Cru (Premier Grand Cru Classé) 2009
wine_name: Saint-Émilion Grand Cru (Premier Grand Cru Classé)
wine_description: Red color of average intensity. Fruity, fresh and ripe nose. Caressing on the palate of fruity and fresh type. Developing very tasty, the wine evolves with coated tannins and a lovely violet aroma in its persistence.

name: Domaine de Beaurenard Châteauneuf-du-Pape 2011
wine_description: We make highly concentrated wines of great finesse, elegance and minerality. This is the true signature and pedigree of the local soils, which makes Beaurenard wines suited to lengthy ageing. They can also be drunk young, to procure an intense, lush pleasure.

name: Château Larrivet Haut-Brion Pessac-Léognan 2016
wine_description: Beautiful deep garnet-red colour with a complex, charming bouquet featuring roasted and toasty aromas as well as hints of black fruit and vanilla. Elegant, concentrated, powerful, and well-balanced on the palate. Long aftertaste with remarkably smooth tannin. A great wine with fine ageing potential that will richly reward patience.

name: Cos d'Estournel Pagodes de Cos 2014
wine_description: The joy and spontaneity of moments shared with loved ones. An impromptu lunch with friends is the perfect occasion to open a bottle of Pagodes de Cos. It is reminiscent of the simple pleasures of life, like homemade blackcurrant syrup, a bowl of just-picked red cherries or a freshly opened jar of citrus jam. Pagodes de Cos is at once indulgent, comforting and vivacious, like a carefree conversation with family or friends in a familiar place.

name: Château Haut-Brion Le Clarence de Haut Brion Pessac-Léognan (Château Bahans Haut-Brion) 2011
wine_name: Le Clarence de Haut Brion Pessac-Léognan (Château Bahans Haut-Brion)

name: Louis Jadot Côte de Beaune Villages 2013
wine_description: It has a young and fruity wine, with aromas of red fruits, and cherries. With a delicate structure and soft tannins, it will perfectly match with light dishes (hot entrées, white and red meat in light sauce).

name: Château de Tracy Pouilly-Fumé 2018
wine_description: Pale gold with silver highlights, bright. Strong initial aromas of boxwood, cedar, blackcurrant buds and red currants. The aromatic expression intensifies and gains complexity as the wine breathes, revealing aromas of exotic and while fleshed fruit and of spices such as green pepper and aniseed. A harmonious middle palate and ending with a mineral, saline finish.

name: Almaviva Almaviva 2017
wine_description: Deep, intense, ruby red color with purple tones. Aromas of cassis, black berries and violet, notes of vanilla, cacao, licorice, and spices.

name: Château Barde-Haut Saint-Émilion Grand Cru (Grand Cru Classé) 2011
Château Grand Mayne Saint-Émilion Grand Cru (Grand Cru Classé) 2010
wine_description: Rose petal and berry aromas follow through to a full body, with chewy tannins and a tobacco and berry aftertaste.

name: Brotte Châteauneuf-du-Pape Domaine Barville Rouge 2016
wine_description: It has ruby tinted purple highlights. Of great finesse, revealing aromas of spices, black fruit (cassis, blackberries, cherries) and notes of roasted red pepper Mouth- where elegant Attack the forest fruits predominate.

name: Château Beauregard Pomerol 2012
wine_description: This wine has a deep purple hue and already reveals intense and complex aromas of black fruit, such as blackcurrant, blackberry and morello cherry, mingling harmoniously with notes of violets, sweet spices, eucalyptus, forest floor and already very well integrated oak. The entry on the palate is silky and deliciously flavoursome thanks to round, stylish and perfectly ripe tannins.

name: Château Larrivet Haut-Brion Pessac-Léognan 2013
wine_description: Beautiful deep garnet-red colour with a complex, charming bouquet featuring roasted and toasty aromas as well as hints of black fruit and vanilla. Elegant, concentrated, powerful, and well-balanced on the palate. Long aftertaste with remarkably smooth tannin. A great wine with fine ageing potential that will richly reward patience.

name: Château Gruaud Larose Saint-Julien (Grand Cru Classé) 2014
Château Lamothe-Bergeron Haut-Médoc 2012
wine_description: Fine rounded plum fruit on the nose. Warm plush cassis fruit with a hint of oak in the mouth. Nice balance and length.

name: Château Cantenac Brown BriO de Cantenac Brown Margaux 2015
wine_description: This wine shows ripe fruit with a good depth and a hint of chocolate. Silky tannins and a firm, rich finish.

name: Château Rauzan-Ségla Margaux (Grand Cru Classé) 1995
wine_description: Candied confectionary nose along with some Margaux perfume and flowers. Palate is nicely fresh. Sweet and modern, with rich berry flavours, balanced and nicely proportioned until the finish.

name: Château Smith Haut-Lafitte Pessac-Léognan (Grand Cru Classé de Graves) 2015
Château Valandraud Virginie de Valandraud Saint-Émilion Grand Cru 2014
wine_name: Virginie de Valandraud Saint-Émilion Grand Cru
wine_description: Potentially one of the finest wines I have tasted from this estate, the 2010 offers up notes of crushed rocks, black raspberries and black currants intermixed with a hint of barrique. Medium to full-bodied and pure with a distinctive chocolate/coffee character, it should be enjoyed over the next 15+ years.

name: Ridge Vineyards Lytton Estate Petite Sirah 2016
Clos Fourtet Saint-Émilion Grand Cru (Premier Grand Cru Classé) 2012
wine_name: Saint-Émilion Grand Cru (Premier Grand Cru Classé)
wine_description: A purple ruby colour reflecting the full-bodied, deep character of the wine. Black cherry, floral aromas on the nose with a touch of chocolate and subtle hints of oak. Savoury on the palate with silky tannins and a mineral freshness.

name: Il Borro Toscana 2010
wine_description: Il Borro has a purple color with intense reflections purpurei. The smell is intense, full, concentrated, with notes of underbrush and hints of spices. The taste is dry, full-bodied and with soft tannins, consistent and well-blended, remarkably persistent.

name: Château Mauvesin Barton Moulis-en-Médoc 2011
wine_description: Sustained purple color. Nose of red fruits, cherry, currant which harmoniously blends with toasted notes. Ample and well balanced wine on the palate with soft tannins and integrated oak.

name: Clos Floridène Graves 2013
